1522122212211122211211111112211111.content:
With his new slave all tuckered out and resting, Jinta decided to look for something else to amuse him. A quick glance around the city showed that he had destroyed pretty much everything in the immediate area. Surely there was still more places he hadn’t visited, though. The giant boy picked a direction and started walking, his colossal feet crushing the destroyed buildings even more. It didn’t take long before he reached an area that looked almost untouched. The only sign of his presence was the many abandoned cars and buildings that the little bugs had left behind when they heard of Jinta’s rampage.

“What’s this? This place actually looks decent! We can’t have that!” Jinta shouted to himself before kicking everything in sight. His feet uprooted buildings, trees, and other structures with ease. If a normal kid had tried kicking a building, they’d probably leave with a badly stubbed toe. Jinta on the other hand was demolishing buildings like they were made of sand. Metal, glass, and debris all went flying to parts unknown. After Jinta had finished making everything within his reach look like a war zone, he turned his interest to something else.

A slightly taller building caught his eye. The young god placed his bare sole on top of the construction and slowly began to apply pressure. He smirked as he listened to the glass windows of the building shatter and its supports give away one by one. Soon the building was collapsing floor by floor until all that remained was its roof which had been moved to ground level.

“Ha, weak.” Jinta muttered as he looked for something more worthy. His large eyes fell upon several office buildings that had been built side-by-side. They were all of similar shape and equal in size. Jinta’s idea was an obvious one. He walked over to the first building and used his finger to give the smaller object a gentle push. The building was easily pushed backward and smashed into the one next to it, sending glass and smoke everywhere. The second building, in turn, toppled over and smashed into the third one. The third building collapsed onto the fourth. This continued until the last building fell onto the street and buried a few more buildings under its mass.

“Here I thought dominos were boring!” Jinta laughed, but still wasn’t done. He looked for something else to destroy. “Hey, carrot top, you see anything you recognize?”

Ichigo looked down at the city from Jinta’s pants pocket. It was astounding how different the city looked, both from Jinta’s destruction and from his new view. It took a few moments before he noticed a building he knew all too well.

“Hey, that’s my school over there!” Ichigo said, pointing in the direction of the facility. Jinta looked where his slave was pointing and smiled.

“School, eh? Blech, who needs school?!” Jinta thundered as he stomped over to the white building and stood over it, overshadowing the small building with ease. Ichigo watched as Jinta gripped the empty building by its sides and tore it out of the ground, holding it away from his waist. The giant felt the weak construction ready to fall apart in his hands. Before it had the chance to fall apart, Jinta drew his leg back and gave it a swift kick. The high school didn’t have a chance and exploded in his hands. The former Substitute Soul Reaper smiled as his school, classroom, desk, even the homework he forgot yesterday was obliterated in a brilliant display. He used to wish his school would burn down so he didn’t have to go, but he never would have imagined that a giant would destroy it!

Jinta wiped his hands with his shirt and studied the area. The once untainted area had been reduced to nothing but another area of disaster. However, is interest was beginning to wane. He enjoyed watching his little victims run from his huge form and listening to their screams of terror. Now, all he could hear was the slow collapse of lifeless structures and his own breathing.

“Maybe it’s time to move onto another town.” Jinta told himself. He looked left and right and scratched the back of is head. “So…where IS the next town?”
1522122212211122211211111112211111.title: A Change of Scenery

choices: Jinta continues to try to break down the barrier
Soul Society prepares to attack Jinta while he's trapped.
15221222122111222112111111122111112.content:
As Jinta finished his rampage of Karakura Town, the one proud city now nothing more than a smoldering ruin littered with the decaying remains of buildings and the occasional corpse of a human caught in the melee. There was nothing left for him, nothing at all. Even though he was a massive tower of a human boy he couldn't immediately see the next town over. He scanned the horizon and saw the ocean off in one direction.

"Better not go that way. There won't be much to see at all."

He turned the other way and saw, in three directions, featureless countryside. He pointed in each direction and thought about it.

"Hey, carrot top, you got any idea where the next town is?" Jinta asked his bug.

Ichigo thought about it. He wasn't very good with geography and hadn't left the town in his life. The only times he had was when he went to the Soul Society and Jinta couldn't get there. At least, Ichigo didn't think he could...

"I'm terribly sorry Lord Jinta. But I don't know." Ichigo replied.

"Don't worry about it. I'll just pick a direction at random."

Jinta closed his eyes and pointed forward before spinning around, devastating the pavement around him, pipes exploding and spraying water over his feet. When he opened his eyes he saw that he was pointing at the ocean.

"Well that didn't work..."

He closed his eyes and performed this ritual again. As he did this, the higher ups in Soul Society were taking action. This was their chance. They needed to make sure that the giant didn't escape and cause any more damage to property or human life. Orders were passed down, Soul Reapers dashed left and right, and computers printed out figures that detailed the amount of kido it was going to take to create what they needed to create. A group of the best kido users in the Soul Society gathered in a group inside a plain white room, with a screen showing Karakura Town on the ceiling. They all started chanting spells, some using tools to increase the potency of the kido. One by one they finished the chant and slowly, a barrier appeared around the town. Each Soul Reaper purposefully finished slightly after the Soul Reaper before them so that the barrier was layered, like an onion. This way, the barrier would be able to withstand more punishment if it were to be attacked and, judging by the boy's actions before this, it would receive a lot of punishment.

Back in Karakura Town, Jinta, after having spun around for the last ten minutes, had finally pointed in a direction that wasn't the ocean. He sat for a minute, waiting for the area to stop spinning before standing up. Even then, he still felt a wave of dizziness pass over him, causing him to stumble and fall to the ground again. Cracks radiated out from Jinta's body, causing fissures to appear, debris falling into the newly made holes.

"Ouch! Dammit, that wasn't the smartest thing to do..."

He checked his pocket and was glad to see that his obedient teen was safe. Ichigo had retreated to the bottom of the pocket and the soft material had protected him. Unfortunately, looking at his shoulder, he noticed that Hisagi had fallen away. He quickly scanned the area where he had fallen and found him sprawled head over heels in a pile of rubble. He was definitely awake again, his eyes wide and slightly twitchy.

"You should be more careful sixty nine man. A god like me can't be bothered to regulate all his movements for the sake of a bug." Jinta taunted.

Hisagi wanted badly to yell, to attack, to maim this boy for his words but knew he would just be swatted like a fly or crushed like an insect. He needed to wait for a better opportunity...

Jinta grabbed the young Soul Reaper by the foot and hoisted him in the air.

"Good. You're already learning not to talk back." Jinta said. "Back on the shoulder with you."

He dropped Hisagi on his shoulder who sat cross legged, too agitated to sleep anymore. He watched as Jinta made his way to the edge of Karakura Town, clearly intending to head to a new town. He bit his lip, wanting to do something to stop the monster but he was totally powerless. Any kido he could think of would just bounce off his skin. As Hisagi was resigning himself to the fate of the next town, Jinta suddenly crashed into something.

"What the--? What's this?"

Jinta put his hands against the barrier and knocked against it. It felt like an invisible wall was before him. He had seen things like this before while working for Urahara. It was a kido barrier. A strong looking one at that. Jinta grinned as he realized this.

"Alright! This should be a great challenge for me! You slaves watch as your god takes down this barrier!" He cracked his knuckles, preparing to punch the barrier with all his might. With a roar he pushed forward, his knuckles connecting with the barrier. The entire face of the barrier shuddered, appearing briefly around Jinta's hand before returning to invisibility. Jinta shook his hand slightly and was surprised to see the barrier was totally unaffected. He punched it again and got the same results. He kicked it, first with his right foot then his left and just made his toes go numb. He lowered his shoulder and rammed against the barrier, forcing as much power into it as he could. Nothing. Jinta didn't like this at all. He had been unopposed all today. At best he had been annoyed. Now...he was trapped...he didn't like that idea AT ALL. Gods didn't get stopped by stupid magic walls. He wasn't going to rest until this barrier was dust.
15221222122111222112111111122111112.title: The God Got Trapped

choices: Everything goes smoothly and Jinta is put to sleep.
Things don't go as planned when Jinta begins to grow again.
152212221221112221121111111221111122.content:
In Soul Society, Captain Kurotsuchi was sitting at his interface going over the flow of data while he listened to a report from Captain Ukitake.

“I see, so you trapped the brat in the same city he was rampaging in. How clever, but what’s next? That barrier, as strong as it is, will break before I’m finished with the antidote.” explained Mayuri.

“We’re aware of that. We plan on launching a surprise attack soon. As long as he continues to bash away at that barrier, he’ll eventually show signs of fatigue. Even gods get tired…” replied Jushiro.

“That’s true, but are you positive you can kill it?”

“Of course not. It would take too much manpower to even have a chance at killing him. We intend only to secure him until you’ve finished.”

“How amusing. You think you can keep THAT held down for a day or two? Don’t make jokes.” the captain chuckled as he pushed a few buttons on his chair and a small hole opened on his interface. A metallic claw crept out of the hole and dropped a small pill into the man’s hand. Mayuri handed this pill to his fellow captain.

“What is this?” asked Ukitake, glancing over the small pill in his hand.

“A drug I created to put Hollows to sleep so I could dissect them while they still breathed. This Jinta is a bit…bigger than a Hollow, but it should still kick in and put him to sleep for a few days. More than enough time for me to finish this antidote.”

“Very well, I’ll give this to Vice-Captain Kira. He’ll be leading the attack force.” With that, Ukitake left the lab with only a slight wave from the seated captain.

A little while later, in the human world, Jinta was still beating down on the barrier blocking is path. The kido barrier was slowly weakening, but it was still too early for any visible damage to be seen. To Jinta, it was like he wasn’t doing any damage at all. The giant was beginning to pant loudly, sweat pouring from his forehead. He wiped the sweat away with his arm and glared at the invisible wall in front of him.

“Stupid barrier! Why won’t you break!” he shouted, hammering the wall with his mighty fists. “I…refuse…to be stopped!” Jinta punished the wall again, but kept his fist against the barrier. He leaned on his arm and tried to catch his breath.

“Lord Jinta, maybe you should take a break. At this rate you’ll tire yourself out.” Ichigo said with some concern in his voice.

“Don’t be stupid, carrot top! Gods don’t get tired!” Jinta drew his first back and was about to give the barrier another knuckle sandwich until he felt a familiar sensation around his neck. Several kido ropes looped themselves around the boy’s neck and pulled backwards, causing Jinta to stumble away from the wall. The red head looked back to see the group of Soul Reapers that were casting the kido on him.

“Not you bugs again! Do I have to squash some more of you?!” Jinta grabbed the ropes around his neck and tried to pull them off, but to no avail. What would have been an easy task was made much harder from is exhaustion. In addition, more kido ropes wrapped themselves around his throat and made it difficult for the giant to speak. “Bastards! You better say your prayers!” Jinta was about to turn around and stomp the living daylights out of the foolish bugs, but two groups of Soul Reapers were waiting for him on either side and cast more kido ropes around his hands. With a mighty tug, Jinta’s arms were pulled down and his body went with them, forcing the god to his knees. The Soul Reapers attached their kido to the ground, binding the giant to the earth. Jinta growled and pulled at the ropes, but only managed to cause more pain to is sore joints.

Hisagi, who had been watching everything, felt himself being lifted up and flash stepped off the kid’s shoulder. When the figure placed him on the ground, the 9th squad vice-captain looked up to meet the emotionless eyes of the 3rd squad vice-captain.

“Kira? What are you doing here?” Hisagi asked the blond man.

“To take down this monster, and to rescue you of course. Who gave you the order to go to the World of the Living?” Kira asked with a serious tone.

“Sorry. I couldn’t just wait while this brat did whatever he felt like. I had to at least check on the situation personally.”

“That worked out well.” Kira joked with a rare smile. A few more Soul Reapers ran by the two vice-captains. This attack force was a bit bigger than the last one. Hisagi stood up and stopped one of the Soul Reapers.

“Hold on.” he ordered the young-looking Soul Reaper as he reached into his clothes and took out the vial of blood he had taken from Jinta. “Please go back to Soul Society and give this to Captain Kurotsuchi. It should be of some use to him.” The young Soul Reaper took the vial and nodded to his superior before turning around and heading back the way he came.

“You should head back to, you don’t look so good.” Izuru told Shuhei as he noticed the latter could barely stay on his feet.

“I’m fine. I’m more worried about you; do you have a plan? Once he gets his energy back, he’ll break trough those ropes like they’re plastic.”

“Don’t worry, I have that covered.” Kira replied as he reached into his clothes and took out the pill Captain Ukitake had given him. “Wait there, this won’t take long.” Kira flash stepped a few times until he was face-to-face with the giant menace known as Jinta. Jinta looked at the puny bug and gave him a killer glare.

“I’m going to guess you’re the one in charge, right?” Jinta asked as he grinded his teeth in anger.

“That’s correct. I’m Vice-Captain Izuru Kira of the 3rd Division.” Kira responded with an emotionless face.

“Oh, I don’t even know what I’m going to do with you once I’m free. Just know this: you’re deader than dead!”

“Yeah, yeah, yeah. Keep yapping.” Kira teased the giant kid as he got ready toss the pill into the giant’s mouth.

Meanwhile, Ichigo was at a loss of words. His master…is god…was being restrained! There was just no way a bunch of lower life forms could do this to him! Maybe Jinta was just pretending to be trapped for a little fun? Had that barrier really taken so much out of him? Jinta had annihilated every force that fought against him, but was this the end?
152212221221112221121111111221111122.title: How to Take Down a God

choices: Jinta takes care of the Soul Reapers and the barrier
Jinta has developed some new powers with his size...
1522122212211122211211111112211111222.content:
Everything was going exactly as planned. It was easier than anyone had hoped. The Soul Society was known for its fierce efficiency in taking care of threats. Within seconds Jinta would be sleeping like a baby and the nightmare would be over. Karakura Town would be rebuilt, the souls that were currently flooding the Soul Society would be taken care of, and everything would continue as it did before this hellish attack. Kira had pulled back his hand and was about to toss the pill into the monster's mouth when something happened. Kira thought...it almost looked like...Jinta's mouth was moving up...

Jinta noticed it long before anyone else. A powerful energy was building up inside him, filling him with new energy. He stood to his feet and tore the ropes apart like they nothing and grinned at Kira.

"Oooh, I'm going to enjoy this!" He cracked his knuckles which sounded as ominous as thunder.

He took a step forward and was about to grab Kira when he felt something else happening to his body. The energy that had revitalized him was now working over time, filling his body with power. It was a feeling he had felt twice before. He laughed a laugh that slowly deepened as his body grew even bigger. The Soul Reapers on the ground desperately tried to restrain him with kido ropes but they snapped almost as soon as they caught hold. Jinta's body was swelling at such a rate they couldn't keep him down. Jinta yawned theatrically and said, "Wow, and I thought you bugs were pathetic before. You're becoming less than bugs to me every second!"

Ichigo looked up in awe at Jinta. He had feared this. His god was becoming even greater. Would he, a speck of lint, be treated as before? Would Jinta grow bored of him and merely crush him? Or eat him? Even as the fear was evident in his mind Ichigo couldn't help but feel relieved. His god was truly great. He had been worried for no reason. Truly Jinta was amazing. He would never again doubt his god and master.

Hisagi, meanwhile, was stumbling along, trying to avoid Jinta's growing toes. The mammoth mountains of flesh that he had kissed not long ago were towering overhead, completely capable of destroying him. He barely managed to avoid the massive pillars by diving to the side. Hisagi collapsed onto the ground looking up in horror. Everything had been perfect and now...he only prayed that the boy wouldn't find him.

Kira determinedly flash stepped upwards towards Jinta's mouth. Jinta watched as the Soul Reaper attempted to finish his mission. He felt unstoppable again. After he was done here the barrier around this pathetic ruin would be nothing to him. He slowly stopped growing and stared down at the speck before him. Surprisingly he could still clearly see him. In fact, he could see him far better than he could before he grew! He sniffed the air and realized he could distinguish a bunch of different scents. Dust, water, sweat, the left over baked goods in his pocket, everything! He cocked his ear and listened. He could pick out every individual voice coming from the ground, each murmur of fear, Hisagi's prayers that he wouldn't be found and even Ichigo's mutterings from his pocket about how he could be useful to his god. Jinta looked down at Kira again and saw he was getting ready to throw something. He could see the tiny pill leave the Soul Reaper's hand and fly toward his mouth. Jinta reached up and grabbed the tiny pill between two of his massive digits. He held it out for Kira to see, held perfectly.

"Nice try emo boy. Was this supposed to stop me? Pills can't stop a GOD!" Jinta roared the last word, the force of his voice pushing Kira back.

It was amazing. All of Jinta's senses had increased in sensitivity to the point that he could interact personally with the specks at his toes. He truly was a god. He reached forward again and plucked Kira out of the air. To Kira it was like two skyscrapers coming together, holding him tightly, but not crushingly. It was an odd experience. Jinta brought the Soul Reaper to his face and said, "I warned you. I said you'd be deader than dead when I was done with you. Now I think I know a good way."

Jinta's voice was like a force in and of itself. It rolled deeply over Kira's body, vibrating within him, filling him with a primal fear. He had never faced anything this terrifying before in his life. Jinta lifted him up above his head and said, "Be lucky. You're going to become a part of a god's body!"

With a slight flick of his wrist Kira was propelled down onto the massive boy's tongue. Kira looked up in horror as the mouth snapped shut leaving him in total darkness. Jinta swallowed, able to taste every aspect of Kira's body and clothes. He was...not very tasty, but he needed to be punished. He licked his lips and looked down at the Soul Reapers beneath him. He crossed his arms and said, "I'll be with you guys in a minute. First I have to find my other slave."

He bent down, the earth rumbling quite severely from his every movement. His massive eye scanned the ground and soon found Hisagi, hiding partially under some debris. With infinite care Jinta pushed aside the debris, in complete control of every part of his body, no matter how small. He gripped Hisagi between his fingers and lifted him to his face.

"Hey sixty nine face! Since you kissed my feet earlier I'm not going to kill you with the rest of these Soul Reapers. When you're rested up we'll see if you're still being stubborn."

Hisagi just hung there, at the complete mercy of a being far greater than he. He didn't know what to do anymore...

Jinta dropped him onto his shoulder and turned his attention to the Soul Reapers at his feet.

"And now...its your guys' turn!" He said with an evil grin.
1522122212211122211211111112211111222.title: God Rises Again

choices: Jinta takes care of the barrier, but something (or someone) else blocks his way.
Mayuri makes a breakthrough with Jinta's blood sample.
15221222122111222112111111122111112222.content:
“You bugs should feel lucky; you’re going to die by the hands of a god!” Jinta boomed as he crouched down and reached a hand for the large group of Soul Reapers. The men watched as a hand the size of an urban block lowered upon them. They were too scared to move and sweating like pigs. As Jinta got ready to crush the specks in his fist, he suddenly noticed something odd. As his fingers moved through the air, the space they occupied moved with them. Startled, the kid giant stood back up and examined his hand. He wiggled his fingers and watched them manipulate the very fabric of space. Was he…bending reality? “Whoa, that’s awesome!”

The Soul Reapers below didn’t know why the god had started ignoring them, but didn’t question it. They took the opportunity to run for their lives. By the time Jinta noticed them, they had gotten pretty far away. It didn’t matter a bit, however, since even from this distance Jinta would simply have to lift a foot to end their pitiful lives. Still, the act of defiance made him angry.

“Were do you insects think you’re going?! STOP!” Jinta hollered the last word, forcing his command at the fleeing bugs like a gale-force hurricane. When the sound hit the Soul Reapers’ ears like a sonic boom, they froze on the spot. As if glued to the street, every one of the Soul Reapers were paralyzed. Not by fear this time, but by something else. Something that transcended them.

“What’s going on?! I can’t move!”
“Me neither! My legs are frozen!”
“We’re all gonna die!!”

Jinta didn’t know what to say, but liked whatever it was. Somehow, the bodies of the poor mortals were forced to obey him…even if their minds resisted. Jinta just smiled and lifted his titanic boyfoot over the insects. The frightened men could only watch and pray as a sole several miles long blocked out the sun and descended. Less than a second was all it took for every one of them to be snuffed out like bugs. Jinta lifted his foot back up to reveal nothing but a footprint. Anything that remained of the weak insects were either buried or stuck to his sole and mixed with tons debris and grime.

“That takes care of them. Anyone else?” Jinta looked around and, using his new super sight, spotted three Soul Reapers fleeing together. They must have hightailed it out of there the moment things got bad. Cowards. Rather than take the two or three steps it would take to catch up with them, Jinta decided to test out this new reality bending powers of his. Using his fingers, he gripped the space in front of him and tore it like he would a sheet of paper. Reality peeled back and revealed a black void beneath it. Using the same hand, Jinta reached into the fissure. Like he had imagined, his hand reappeared near the Soul Reapers via another tear and blocked their path.

“Didn’t you Death Gods know? Real gods are omnipresent!” Jinta told them as he moved his hand and scooped the three up along with a lot of debris. When he removed his hand from the void, he was holding three injured Soul Reapers buried somewhere under tons of rubble. Finding it too tedious to pick them out, Jinta just tossed his handful into his gaping mouth and chewed loudly. A deep gulp emptied his mouth of the city block.

“Wonder what else I can do. Anyone else out there?!”

Sure enough, there was a single survivor. A young Soul Reaper fresh out of the academy. This was his first mission in the living world and he was scared shitless. Everyone was dead and he was alone, hiding behind a half-destroyed building. As he listened to the thundering sounds of Jinta’s footsteps, he silently prayed he wouldn’t be found. The sound stopped after awhile and silence filled the air. The young man didn’t hear anything for a few minutes and decided that the monster had left. He was about to start a mad run, when he stopped himself. He looked down to see that he was several miles in the air! The entire building and the ground it stood on was floating above the ground!

“I could hear your breathing, tiny man.”

The newbie looked up and saw the face of the giant grinning down at him. Jinta had his hands on his hips as he stared the scared coward down. The god had manipulated gravity and forced the building to float just above his chest. He didn’t even have to move a muscle!

“Please…please spare me.” the Soul Reaper stuttered, tears flowing down is cheeks. Jinta just shook his head and decreed, “No.”

With the god’s will known, the lone survivor watched as Jinta’s nostrils opened wider and he took a deep breath through his nose. Before he knew it, the Soul Reaper’s feet were off the ground and he was hurtling toward Jinta’s nose with bits and pieces of the building. He flew into the nostril and became stuck in a big mound of the boy’s snot. He couldn’t even struggle; he was stuck like he was fused to the mucus. He was still alive, at least. Jinta just assumed he was dead and couldn’t detect the Soul Reaper anymore. Nonetheless, it would only be a matter of time before he suffocated or was crushed by the kid’s snots. Maybe he’d get lucky and the boy would blow his nose, freeing him and never knowing it. For now…he just waited.

Jinta sniffed a bit and let the building drop back down to Earth. With the last bug dealt with, he could get back to business. Still, these new abilities were amazing. Super senses, reality warping, gravity warping, and a voice that could not be refused (although he didn’t know what the limitations of that one was).

“I just keep getting more awesome with each growth! Maybe I’ll get some muscle next time!” Jinta praised himself as he flexed his huge, but undeveloped bicep.

“You rock, Lord Jinta! I’m so happy to serve a god like you!” Ichigo shouted up at his master, even though he could hear him even if he whispered.

“You haven’t seen anything yet, carrot top! The world’s just begun to feel the wrath of Lord Jinta!”
15221222122111222112111111122111112222.title: Powers of a God

choices: Grimmjow starts growing and breaks free to face Jinta
Grimmjow rapidly grows and breaks free to face Jinta
152212221221112221121111111221111122221.content:
Jinta smirked and turned toward the barrier. He walked up to it and poked it with his finer. He could hear it groan massively, like a huge force had pressed against it. Jinta decided to try something. He reached to the side and ripped a hole in reality. He reached his hand into it and watched as his hand appeared on the other side of the barrier. He could easily just step around the barrier and move on...but what fun would that be? He closed the hole up and turned back to the barrier. Pulling his arm back he punched the barrier as hard as he could. A sound like hundreds of windows shattering at the same time filled the air as Jinta's god fist tore into kido barrier like it was wet paper. It was inconceivable to believe that, mere minutes before, Jinta had been unable to break this pathetic excuse for a barrier. He moved a few steps to the right and noticed that he had just destroyed a small portion of it. He grinned and cracked his knuckles.

As Jinta continued destroying the barrier in its entirety, just for the fun of it, he was still unaware of the second party that was watching him. Gin grinned at the wonderful show he had been watching and was looking forward to seeing what would happen next. Suddenly, one of the view screens on his right changed from scenes of devastation to one of Sosuke Aizen. Gin grinned up at him and said, "Yes? What is it?"

"I'm calling a meeting of the Espada Gin. Please come down to the meeting room."

The image on the screen disappeared and Gin got to his feet. This should be interesting...

Down in the meeting room the Espada were seated around a large table, Aizen at the head.

"I've called you all here for the situation in Karakura Town."

"Situation? What are you talking about?" Nnoitra asked.

"Didn't you know?" Grimmjow said, slouched in his seat and staring into the darkness of the room. "Some giant human brat is rampaging around the World of the Living."

Whispers suddenly erupted down the table as the Espada learned of this news. This was unheard of. "What exactly does this have to with us?" Barragan growled.

"Apollo...if you would?"

Apollo stood from his spot at the table and held up a small vial of a clear, slimy liquid. "I have been studying the boy tirelessly and have managed to complete this. This is an imperfect form of the substance that altered the boy. It's something I've never seen before, a completely new element. Or perhaps its so rare and old there are no records of it. Either way, with this substance a lifeforms power could be increased several fold. Now, judging by my research, the boy had several times this amount introduced into his system which is why he's grown so fast, so large, and so powerful. However, he was a mere human. If this were to be used, say, on a being with greater spiritual pressure it would have a much greater effect."

Everyone's attention was focused on the vial. Such a powerful thing...each one of them thought of what they could do with power like that...

"I only have this one vial of the substance synthesized at the moment. As such, I still need it to study and perfect."

"Screw that!" Grimmjow shouted, slamming his hand on the table. Everyone turned to look at him in surprise.

"Did you see that kid? We don't have time to be just sitting around! The longer we wait, the stronger he gets! If I were to take that stuff now I'd definitely get stronger than him!"

"And there we come to the real reason you're interrupting." Hallibel said. "You just want it for yourself."

"And why shouldn't I get it?" Grimmjow asked. "Are you suggesting every one of you wouldn't take this if you had the chance?"

No one said anything. Starrk raised his hand half halfheartedly and said, "I really don't care..."

No one paid him any attention. The Espada started arguing amongst themselves, each stating their case about the situation. After the squabbling has gone on for a few minutes Aizen increased his spiritual pressure and everyone turned to face him. "I happen to agree with Grimmjow. This is a delicate situation. Apollo...when is the earliest you can have the substance perfected?"

"A day or two at most..."

"You see? In a day or two that boy will no doubt have grown even stronger. We can't take risks with my plan so close to fruition. That's why one of you, the Espada, must take that substance and destroy that boy. But do leave something for Apollo to study. It may prove useful in the future."

As soon as he was done talking Grimmjow leaped from his seat and grabbed the vial. He moved a few steps away from the table as the other Espada shouted in rage, annoyance, indignation, and surprise. The mad Espada held the vial up between his fingers and grinned at the others. "Too slow!"

Using just his thumb he popped the top on the vial and downed the slimy liquid inside, tossing the empty bottle over his shoulder and heading for the exit of Los Noches to enter the World of the Living. There was silence among the Espada. Gin broke it by saying, "Show of hands. Who's actually surprised?"

As all of this was going on, Jinta was finishing tearing down the last of the barrier, the ceiling falling down on him, shattering on his head and shoulders, most of it missing Hisagi. He dusted his hands and surveyed the area one last time. There was truly nothing left. It was time to move on. He took one step outside of the town when something flew in front of his eyes. He focused in on it and saw that it was a man he had never seen before, with blue hair, and a...hole...in his stomach.

"Hey...you're a Hollow aren't you?" Jinta asked in his booming voice.

Grimmjow hadn't been expecting the sheer power in the boy's voice. Seeing him in real life was a totally different experience than seeing him on a viewing screen. But he wasn't about to be intimidated by a kid. He stood his ground and said, "Listen up brat! I can't have you causing trouble anymore! You're ruining my fun!"

Jinta put his hands on his hips and replied, "Tough! Why should a god care about what a dust speck thinks? Get out of my way!"

Jinta raised his hand and folded a piece of reality around Grimmjow, trapping him in a ball of time and space. Jinta grabbed the ball and tossed it in his hands a few times, wondering what he should do with this guy. Judging by the fact that he was humanoid and his mask was almost totally missing, he had to be an Arrancar. That wasn't really all that different from a Soul Reaper. He already had two Soul Reaper slaves, why not add an Arrancar? He looked like he was a fun one too. Hard to break.

As Jinta thought this over in his mind, Grimmjow was starting to change inside the ball. The slime had worked its way into his system at last and the change was sure to be drastic.
152212221221112221121111111221111122221.title: An Equal Approaches?

choices: Jinta succesfully traps Grimmjow.
The plan doesn't work. Uh-oh!
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
Grimmjow floated inside is prison, waiting for the concoction he drank to kick in. This kid was going to get it for humiliating him like this. A few moments after thinking this, Grimmjow felt a burst of energy inside him. He looked down at himself and watched as the strange slime began to seep out of his body and soak is skin and clothes. It was…kind of gross.

“Okay, that’s weird…” Grimmjow muttered to himself, not liking the idea of being covered in a sticky slime. The liquid disappeared back into his body after drenching him and the blue-haired Arrancar felt his energy spike. His body began to rapidly expand and in no time, it was pressing against the pint-sized sphere. Jinta noticed it too and watched curiously. Was this some strange ability of the Arrancar or was he…growing? Grimmjow grunted in discomfort and was starting to become annoyed with the bubble. He let his spiritual pressure leak out in a single burst, causing the sphere to crack in several places and shatter into pieces. Jinta jumped back in surprise

“W-what are you doing?! “ Jinta shouted at him. “Why are you growing? You’re not supposed to be growing! Only I can grow!”

“Ha! Think again, you oversized brat.” Grimmjow shouted back as he quickly became as big as the boy’s finger…than his fist…and soon his head. “Did you enjoy playing god? Well, playtime’s over!”

Jinta only looked on his shock as the Arrancar quickly grew larger and larger, faster than he had. Jinta could deal with the military…the Soul Reapers…even the Arrancar were nothing before him! But now, when someone way out of his league began growing in front of him, even this young god began showing signs of fear. The youthful man’s spiritual pressure was already quickly climbing above his own. It felt heavy and stung like razor blades.

When Grimmjow had grown to half the size of the gargantuan Jinta, he landed his feet on the ground. Fissures appeared along the earth as the Arrancar stepped down. He looked up at Jinta’s face and smirked before bringing his fist back and punching the boy right in the gut. Jinta was fast enough to tense his abdominal muscles to absorb the blow, but it still launched him back a few yards. Blood began trickling from his mouth. Jinta wiped it away and gave the Espada as nasty glare.

“That does it, you’re dead pussy cat!” Jinta warned the older male before he lunged forward and threw his own punch towards Grimmjow chest. The same punch that had shattered the barrier hit the man in the chest hard, but didn’t budge him an inch. Grimmjow’s Hierro could now make his body harder than diamond. The spiky haired Arrancar grabbed Jinta’s fist and, with a grin, lifted the boy over his head and tossed him away. Jinta rolled a few miles away, unable to stop himself. Hisagi held onto Jinta’s shirt for his dear life, while Ichigo was thrown about inside his pocket like a gumball. When Jinta finally stopped, he was sitting on his butt; his clothes covered in dirt. He tried to throw another glare at Grimmjow, but it only lasted a second before turning into another stare of awe. The older man had already reached Jinta’s height and stopped growing, towering over him like he would at normal size. Before Jinta could stand up, Grimmjow was already over him and grabbed Jinta by the throat. Lord Jinta was lifted off the ground, kicking his legs wildly and clawing at his captor’s hand desperately.

“Master, what’s wrong?!” Ichigo yelled up at him. “You can cream this guy, I know it!” Jinta heard his slave, but couldn’t do anything. He was outmatched and couldn’t speak or breath at the moment.

“Sorry about this, kid, but I don’t show mercy to those that fight me.” Grimmjow chuckled evilly as he slowly began to tighten his grip, aiming to snap the boy’s neck. Jinta started to get light headed and needed to think fast. Using one of his hands, he tore a rip in space across Grimmjow’s wrist. Just as planned, the rip separated the man’s hand from his arm cleanly. Grimmjow screamed in pain and jumped back, his blood raining down on the land below.

“Heh, that was a close one.” Jinta said with a smirk as he pried Grimmjow’s hand off his neck and tossed it over his shoulder. “Now, I’ll just tear another one in your head and…” Jinta stopped when he noticed the Espada’s arm was starting to bubble. Grimmjow looked just as surprised and watched as a boney hand grew out of his wrist. The bones quickly covered themselves in muscle and skin and the 6th Espada had his hand back in a matter of seconds. Grimmjow flexed his fingers a bit before looking back at Jinta with a smirk.

“Looks like I have some new tricks too. Speaking of which, that reality warping power of yours is pretty neat, but can you do this?” the Arrancar asked before showing Jinta his open palm and started to collect red energy into it. Jinta knew what was coming and prepared for it. The 6th Espada fired his Cero at the other giant and watched as everything in front of him was consumed in a bright red explosion. The destruction was on par with a nuclear blast…maybe even greater. When the explosion ended, it left behind a dust cloud that wasn’t going to clear up anytime soon. Grimmjow took a few sniffs of the air and appeared displeased. He couldn’t smell the boy’s burnt corpse, which meant he was still alive somewhere. Where had that brat gone?

Several miles away, a large hole appeared and Jinta’s titanic form fell out of it, hitting the ground and crushing every tree and piece of land underneath him. The boy covered his mouth and coughed a bit, having avoided the Cero but been hit by some of the backlash. He had to think fast, though, that Arrancar was going to find him soon enough.

“Why every time I become more godly, something always gets in my way!? I have to think of something or else I’m finished. Come on Jinta…use your head!” the boy tugged at is hair as he tried to think.

“Um…Lord Jinta…” Ichigo muttered in a quiet voice.

“WHAT?!” Jinta shouted, almost scaring Ichigo right back into the bottom of his pocket. “I don’t have time to listen to you, carrot top!”

“It’s just that…I think I have an idea.”

“Oh? Well in that case, spit it out already!”

“Well…you can manipulate space and time, right? And you just created a hole big enough to fit your entire body through, right? Well, why not do that again…but this time make Grimmjow fall through it! As long as he doesn’t have reality warping powers like you, he’ll get trapped in the void!”

Jinta blinked a few times before a smile spread across his face. With a change of tone, he said, “That doesn’t sound like a bad idea at all! If it works, carrot top, you earned yourself a big time reward!” Jinta then looked over at his shoulder and glared at Hisagi, who was still gripping Jinta’s shirt like a frightened insect. “And you just remain useless, huh? At this rate, you’ll never catch up to carrot top.”

Hisagi didn’t say anything and just looked away from Jinta. Even though the Arrancars were their enemies, he silently wished this one would crush Jinta. The boy deserved it. All three of the boys’ thoughts were interrupted as they felt a massive spiritual pressure approach them…he was coming.
