As Captain Shunsui made his way through the Department of Research and Development, he was constantly stepping out of the way of hurrying Soul Reapers. Everyone was in a panic trying to keep up with the incoming data as they ran back and forth. The entire 12th Division had gone to hell. The flowerily-robed captain made his way to the head of the 12th Division, who was standing in front of his organ-shaped control panel while reading through pages upon pages of data.

“I’m here to check on your progress. How’s the antidote coming?” the serious faced captain asked.

“That? I finished that hours ago. The blood sample retrieved by Vice-Captain Hisagi was immensely helpful.” replied the skeleton-like man.

“Excuse me?! You were told to report to the Captain-Commander the moment it was complete! What were you doing?”

“I’ve been too busy going through the new data. Did you know the subject has grown again? He might just be able to devastate the planet if he knew how to control his spiritual energy.”

“You’re saying that thing grew again? I wasn’t informed of this…”

“Head-Captain was, however.” came another voice belonging to Ukitake. “He has given the order to move the Kido Cannon to the World of the Living and have it ready to fire.”

“Tell him to revoke the order immediately! There is no need for such drastic actions yet, I’ll have the antidote ready for departure in a moment.”

“Are you sure it will work? If it doesn‘t, you understand what we will be forced to do…”

“Am I sure it will work? You dare question my intellect? It is not a question of whether it’ll work, but if we can distribute enough of it to have any effect on the boy.”

“And how do you plan on giving him such a large amount? A pill won’t work, that’s for sure.”

“I’m glad you asked. It’s actually quite simple. All we will have to do is…”

Back on Earth, Jinta had finished toying with the minuscule city. Everything had been reduced to smoking ruins and large craters. If someone didn’t know of Jinta, their mind wouldn’t be able to comprehend what could do this. The boy god was bored now, however. With a wave of his hand, the thousands of his slaves flew out of his ears and navel and gathered within the ruined city before him. Ichigo and Hisagi had been separated from the group, however, and rested on their god’s city-sized shoulder.

“A passable job, bugs. Next I want you to…” Jinta trailed off when he noticed something approaching. The spiritual pressure he sensed meant they were Soul Reapers. What did they want now? Looking down, he spotted several groups of Soul Reapers pushing large cannon-like devices into position. “They’re gonna attack me with cannons now? Ha, this should be good…”

The cannons were smaller, weaker versions of the almightily Kido Cannon. While formerly used to fire kido, these cannons were specify designed by Mayuri to hold a different kind of ammo.

“Okay men, if this doesn’t work, we’re dead.” explained a high-ranking officer. “Aim and fire at will!”

Jinta watched as the Soul Reapers began shooting small, round objects at him from the cannons. They were even smaller than the bombshells used by the military bugs. Jinta blocked a few with his hand, just in case. Once he noticed he couldn’t even feel the impacts, he allowed the rest to hit his face. He was letting the Bug Reapers have their fun before he punished them. Strangely, the explosions caused by the round ammo didn’t spread smoke…but an unusual purple gas. The gas seeped into the god’s skin and turned it purple for a few seconds before reverting back to its normal color tone. Some of the stuff got into his nose and started to irritate it.

“What the hell are you bugs throwing at me? This stuff itches.” Jinta pondered as he scratched the places the smoke infected.

“Lord Jinta, this may be the antidote I spoke of!” Hisagi warned his master.

“Antidote? Are they trying to cure a god or give me a rash?” Jinta laughed at the Soul Reaper’s futile attempts. The bugs on the ground continued to fire, hoping for some kind of result. Mayuri’s antidote was definitely having an effect on Jinta as it spread through his cells from several different entry points. The question was: what kind of effect? Captain Kurotsuchi’s calculations were flawless, but the genius couldn’t have known that the radiation from the human’s weapon had fused with the slime inside Jinta. The result would therefore be not quite what everyone was expecting…

The antidote spread swiftly through Jinta's system fusing with the radiation and the slime, combining together into an entirely new substance. The antidote was broken down into its components, the parts that actively worked to reverse the slimes effects were broken down and destroyed while the other chemicals were recycled into his body, changing his body in an entirely unexpected way. Jinta's cells vibrated and split rapidly, a wave of new cell division coursing through his body.

Outside the Soul Reapers were watching with bated breath, hoping, praying even, that something would happen to end this nightmare. Suddenly, Jinta started feeling a strange sensation overcome his body similar to the feeling he experienced whenever he grew. He grinned down at the Soul Reapers and said, "Whatever you germs fired at me is making me stronger! I can feel it! Hahahahaha! Thanks a lot!"

It was true. Jinta's body was slowly growing again, his monstrous stature expanding to new heights. But this growth was different. He wasn't getting proportionally larger. His arms and legs were growing longer, his hands and feet were growing broader, and his torso was slowly stretching. His shirt rode up, revealing his stomach which was starting to have abs pop up on it. His shorts were slowly riding up, hugging his thighs. Jinta looked over his body curiously, wondering what was going on.

"Hey what gives? What's happening to me?" Jinta suddenly stopped talking and grabbed his throat. Was that his voice? Why did it sound so strange?

Jinta may not have been able to see what was happening but Ichigo and Hisagi could. Their lord, master, and god was aging, his face maturing, his body growing to that of a teenager, comparable to Ichigo.

The Soul Reapers soon fell into a panic. There plan had failed. They were as good as dead if they stayed here! The officers in command tried to regain order but it was impossible. They simply opened the door to the Soul Society and fled, not wanting to stay and face an annoyed teenage god. Back in the Soul Society, Kurotsuchi, Kyoraku, and Ukitake were all watching in horror as Jinta changed again, to the young god's own advantage.

"You're supposed to be changing him back, not making him stronger Mayuri!" Kyoraku shouted at the mad scientist.

"Inconceivable! My calculations were flawless! Absolute perfection! He should be shrinking back down into an ordinary human!" Kurotsuchi shouted, tossing papers aside as he looked through his data.

"Perhaps there was an unknown factor involved." Ukitake suggested.

"Impossible! It would have shown up in his blood!" Kurotsuchi scoffed at Ukitake's ideas.

"You took so long, maybe his body developed an immunity or something!" Kyoraku said with agitation.

"That blood sample was too old! By the time I got it the boy had already grown again! This isn't my miscalculation!"

As the Captains argued amongst themselves, the leftover chemicals from the antidote had all been used up, disappearing from Jinta's body and returning his aging process back to normal. Jinta looked over his body in wonder, running his fingers over his newly developed muscles. He called up a hole in space that connected with the ocean so he could see his reflection. No longer was a boy's face looking back at him, but the face of a teenager. He looked over his handsome face appreciatively before closing the holes. He brought his two loyal slaves in front of his face and said in his deeper voice, "Well? What do you think of your god now?"

Ichigo immediately answered. "You look amazing Lord Jinta! You're becoming a greater god every second!"

Hisagi added, "Your form is fantastic! Truly you are a sight to behold!"

Jinta grinned happily and said, "Yeah, I'm awesome! Though these clothes are feeling really uncomfortable..."

Jinta rolled his shoulders, the fabric tearing slightly as he did so. His shirt was now far too small for him, barely covering his chest. His shorts were no better, hugging his crotch and butt and leaving nothing to the imagination. These were clothes for a child, not for a teenage god. Not that there was anything he could do about it...yet.

Jinta looked around him and smirked as he imagined what he must look like to the insignificant nothings below him. His body may have aged but he still had the mindset of a child. It was a dangerous combination. He felt stronger as well, like his spiritual pressure had increased along with his age. He knew that all of his powers were stronger, that he could use them with more ease now. The only question was, what to test it on?

1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
After Jinta had taken enough time in admiring his new body, his sights were set on testing how much his powers had advanced. The question was…what would make a good guinea pig? Jinta placed his hands on his (now exposed) hips and studied the land around him. He could spot several mountains and a few more cities that were just steps away. All of them were possible targets, but Jinta wanted something else. His eyes drifted upward and then it hit him. The red-haired teen grinned and glanced over at his two servants.

“You two bugs better hold on.” Jinta warned as he laced his hand over them and formed a small bubble of bent reality around them. Neither of them knew what it was for until Jinta opened a large tear in front of him and stepped through it. When they arrived on the other side, Ichigo and Hisagi looked around and couldn’t believe their eyes. They were in space! The big blue planet itself was visible in the distance. The bubble around the two of them was to protect them from the vacuum of space, which their god was apparently unaffected by. As for their exact position in space, it was right next to the Moon!

“Yeah, this’ll do nicely.” Jinta muttered to himself as his gaze looked over the Moon. Despite having become the biggest thing on Earth, the Moon was still much larger than him. He was about to change that, though. Jinta stretched his arms out and pointed his palms in the direction of the giant sphere. The teenaged god began to channel his space-warping abilities into the Moon, wishing to change its form. Ichigo and Hisagi watched in awe as the Moon started to ripple; its very existence being toyed with. The Moon quickly began to shrink, becoming less and less of a bigger object to Jinta every second. Countless laws of physics were being broken by this act. Jinta didn’t care, though, as physics were but school rules that could easily be broken. Eventually, it became the size of Jinta’s torso…then his head…and finally Jinta was cupping it between his gargantuan hands. It continued to shrink still until it was like a golf ball to the giant.

“Not so big and beautiful now, are you?” Jinta said as he held the Moon between his fingers. The teen flicked his wrist and tossed the gumball-sized satellite into his mouth. He started to chew, reducing the celestial body into a mush which he swallowed. Jinta smacked his lips and said, “Hmm, I guess it isn’t made of cheese.”

The two Soul Reapers couldn’t believe their eyes. Jinta had just shrunken and eaten the moon! Impossible was not a word Jinta knew. This did bring about some worry in Ichigo, however, as he said, “My lord, won’t this have disastrous effects on the Earth?”

“So what? Why should I care?” Jinta replied, scoffing at carrot top’s meaningless worries.

“But, don’t you want to be the one that brings chaos and destruction to the planet? It wouldn’t seem right if physics became the reason for Earth’s ruin when someone as powerful as you exists!”

“Hmm…you’re right. I guess I’ll just have to fill up this empty space, eh?” Jinta said as he cracked his knuckles and outstretched his hands toward the spot where the Moon once rested. This time, he spread his powers outward and started to pull as much space debris as he could find toward the spot in front of him. Space was full of junk and Jinta was going to put it all to good use. Debris from as far as Jinta could reach began to flow together and join as one. A sphere started to form before Jinta, slowly becoming bigger and bigger until it dwarfed even him. The sphere didn’t remain just a sphere, however, and began to take on another appearance. When Jinta eventually finished, his arms fell to his sides and he started to breath heavily.

“Okay…that wasn’t as easy as I thought it would be.” Jinta said to himself. Surely, shrinking something bigger than yourself and then creating something of equal size defiantly consumed a lot of spiritual energy. “Ah well, I think it was worth it.” Jinta smiled a she looked over his work. The Moon had been replaced by a giant replica of Jinta’s face. Now, whenever someone looked up into the night sky, they would see the Moon gone and replaced with the smiling face of their god, as if to say that he was always watching. Jinta’s two slaves praised his for his work and he thanked them with just a wave of his hand. He opened another rip to Earth, but was too weak to make it lead directly to the surface. Instead, it led to the Earth’s orbit, right above Japan. Jinta put his hands behind his head and floated in a resting position. He looked down at the planet and concentrated so he could hear what was happening on the surface. All of Earth now new of his presence and was in a state of panic. Cities were rioting, loyal followers were trying to speak to others and form religions around him, and world leaders tried to calm their people as they themselves took shelter in “hidden” locations. Jinta continued to listen to the sounds of the planet as he gathered his strength back. His slaves also laid down, wrapping themselves in Jinta’s white shirt. Pleasing a giant god was a tough job.

The Soul Society was in an uproar. Every single one of their attempts to stop the rampaging boy (now teen) had failed spectacularly, resulting in casualties upon casualties. Captain General Yamamoto had had enough. After the spectacular failure of Captain Kurotsuchi's antidote he knew that there was only one course of action left for them to try before all out war had to be declared. He had called all the captains together to discuss the situation. Once everyone had gathered Yamamoto spoke.

"I have called this meeting of the captains in order to tell you all what we're going to do to deal with the menace that that giant boy presents. I have waited for too long, allowing the other captains to try and contain this situation, but no more. There is only one course of action remaining to us. At this very moment the boy is resting in space. Now is the perfect time to fire the Kido Cannon! I want it prepped and ready for firing in less than ten minutes! There will be no excuses, no more stalling, and no other plans! If even this fails we will have little other choice than declaring all out war against the monster! Make sure your squads are prepared if it comes to that!"

Yamamoto did not give the other captains any time to consider or question his plan. He was done waiting around on the promises of those who couldn't deliver. He gave the order to fire the Kido Cannon and the Soul Reapers in charge of it began to prep it. First, they moved it out into the World of the Living directly beneath the slumbering form of Jinta, barely visible against the new moon. Next, they quickly found the coordinates for Jinta's position and aimed the cannon so that the blast would hit him directly. Finally, the removed all the seals and inhibitors on the artillery, not holding back a single ounce of its power. With all the preparations complete the entire Soul Society watched with bated breath, hoping against hope that this would finally work and the nightmare would be over.

With a crushing release of spiritual pressure the Kido Cannon charged to maximum power and fired the blast into the sky. The force of the blast could be seen for miles and miles around, the light almost blindingly bright. It blasted the clouds around it outward, creating a ring around the spirit particles. The blast gathered nearby spirit particles as well, gaining even more strength as it traveled. Jinta, still asleep, had no idea what was coming for him. Hisagi and Ichigo, sleeping as deeply as their god and master, also had no idea what was coming. The trio was peacefully dreaming of the times to come.

Jinta was dreaming of being even bigger, truly ruling over the planet. Nothing could stand in his way. He was holding all his slaves in one hand and in the other was those who had attempted to oppose him. Grimmjow, the Soul Reapers, even the Arrancars. With a smirk he crushed them all in his hand, grinding the remains into oblivion. With them out of the way he could now set his sights on the rest of the universe. His body would gain more and more power, expanding further and further, taking over all that was seen and unseen until every universe was under his total command. If anything displeased him he could, with a thought, just twist it into something else. Everything was subject to his whims. Creation and destruction were nothing for him. Nothing was impossible for him anymore. Jinta grinned in his sleep and mumbled something to himself before descending back into true sleep.

Ichigo and Hisagi, meanwhile, were having a similar dream. They both were standing before the massive feet of their god, his grinning face looking warmly down at them. They were at the head of a crowd of worshipers, stretching back so far into the distance they couldn't see the end of the crowd. As they watched their god he began to grow larger before their eyes. He levitated them up to his body and they found themselves standing on his expansive chest, his size so great he was creating a gravity field around him. Everywhere they looked they saw nothing but Jinta's body stretching away in every direction. They were truly insignificant to Jinta now and they couldn't be happier. There job was now infinitely more difficult but there could be no greater joy than cleaning and serving the master of the universe.

Unfortunately for them the dreams were shattered as the blast from the Kido Cannon hit Jinta square in the back. The teen's eyes flew open and he yelled out in surprise waking Ichigo and Hisagi as well. The two slaves jumped up and looked around, disorientated and scared for their master who seemed to be in pain. Jinta grit his teeth and took the punishment, unable to avoid it or alleviate it in anyway. All he could do is wait.

1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
Jinta bit his lip as he resisted the urge to shout out in pain. Nothing was supposed to hurt him like this anymore! He was a god! Somehow, he knew this was the Soul Reapers’ doing. They just didn’t know when to quit. If this continued, however, it might actually do the trick. The pressure against his back was unbelievably intense. A minute more and it’d tear right though him! If Jinta didn’t want that to happen, he’d have to act fast! With some quick thinking, Jinta used ever ounce of his godly strength to push himself to the side and allow the beam to fly past him. Jinta had a look of victory on his face as he watched the kido beam disappear into the depths of space. Ichigo and Hisagi also watched while knowing nothing could defeat their lord and master.

Unfortunately, those smiles of satisfaction disappeared when their almighty master coughed up a large amount of blood. The carmine liquid floated in front of the boy-turned-teen’s face as he stared at it with a puzzled look. Jinta’s eyes slowly crept down to see, much to his horror, that he hadn’t dodged the beam as much as he hoped. The kido cannon had taken a huge chunk of his hip with it; leaving nothing but a burning hole in his perfect body. In addition, his back was scotched black and any cotton fabrics that once covered it had been disintegrated. Jinta coughed dup some more blood as he started to feel light headed. Ichigo and Hisagi shouted up to their god while ignoring the wavering barrier wound them. If that fell, they’d die instantly from the exposure to space, but the slaves were far more concerned with their god. Jinta heard their yells as they slowly got softer and softer until he heard and saw nothing else. His last though before darkness was that the pesky Soul Reapers were going to pay dearly for this.

*The next day*

As the world gave a sigh of relief, their mighty god rested on a bed somewhere else entirely. Jinta awoke to the sound of water and shot up instantly. He looked around in utter confusion. He was inside a room…a very fancy bedroom with a sliding glass door that led outside. How was this possible? Why was he laying inside of a room instead of crushing it under his toe! The teen also took notice to his bandaged body. Using his hand, he touched the place where the kido cannon had hit him and was surprised to feel flesh. Jinta tore off the bandages and inspected his torso. Not even a scar was present.

“Impressive. Even with my abilities; that wound would still have taken another three days to heal completely.” spoke a voice outside the door. Jinta turned to the entrance to see a figure step into the room. He wore a long robe that appeared of royalty; complete with golden linings. His hair was as blue as his own was red and his eyes shone silver. His face…

“Ahh!” yelped Jinta as he almost fell off the bed. The figure, save for the classy wardrobe and hair/eye color, looked EXACTLY LIKE HIM. “W-who are you?”

“I go by many names.” the figure replied, walking over to Jinta’s bed and started squatting down as if taking a seat. Jinta thought his look-alike was going to fall on his butt until a chair materialized underneath him. “Atum, Izanagi, ‘God’. Those of Soul Society refer to me as the Spirit King.”

“You’re the Spirit King?! Why does the Spirit King look like me? And where am I? Where’s carrot top and sixty-nine man!”

“I will answer your questions one at a time.” the Spirit King said, not appearing annoyed by Jinta’s questions. “I am a being older than time itself. Therefore, my original form as long since been lost. My appearance now depends on the current state of the universe. “I don’t have to do that, though. Just stand still and let me get all that slime out of you. If you do that; I promise to make your end swift.” Jinta offered as he slowly approached Grimmjow, cracking his knuckles as he did. He loved that sound; it was like a bad omen to those that heard it.

“W-well, I won’t have to do it if you do as I want!”

Jinta folded his arms across his chest and said, “And what do you want?”

“Not in a million years!” Jinta responded almost immediately. “I can’t let scum like you waltz around my world doing whatever he pleases. I’ll be really pissed if you kill carrot top; but if his death is the only way to put an end to you, then I don’t really mind.”

“Okay, then how about this? You leave me alone for a set amount of time. After that time’s up, we’ll continue our fight and I‘ll return Ichigo.”

On the other hand, he could give Grimmjow his last moments to do as he pleased. There wasn’t much he could do. Even if he did build up some more power over time, Jinta would just trap him in another bear hug and they’d be right back to where they started. Eventually, Jinta made his decision and said…

Ichigo nodded an mentally smirked in his head. What an idiot! He had made the whole story up. Allergic to apples? He never heard of such a thing. Anyway, a few seconds later, the giant Espada found himself in the middle of an orchid of apples. He put Ichigo down and ordered him to help pick. Ichigo did as he was told and after an hour and a half they had made a pile of nothing but shiny red apples. It was enough to feed half a town, but was barely a mouthful to the gargantuan Jinta. Grimmjow decided it was enough, though. Sometime during his work, Ichigo had stopped growing for the time being and was equal in size to Grimmjow’s fist.

Grimmjow stood up and brought Ichigo to his face. Tasking once last glace at the apples, he said, “Time to see if this works. I’ve thought up a plan to make it so if you’re lying, I won’t seem like a fool and still have some time to think of a real idea. If you ARE lying, Kurosaki, well…I know I’m not allergic to you.” Grimmjow warned, showing Ichigo his razor sharp teeth. Ichigo started to sweat and have second thoughts about this plan…

A few miles away, in the ruins of Karakura Town, Jinta sighed deeply and collapsed on the ruins of the town.

“We’ve been searching for over an hour now. There’s no sign of that bucket head or those two Soul Reapers.” Jinta said to Hisagi, who rested on the teen’s shoulder.

“I heard Urahara had a secret, underground training area. Maybe they’re hiding out there?” Hisagi suggested.

“I thought about that too, but…” Jinta surveyed the land around them. His construction of the statue had turned most of the town into a flat, bare wasteland. The rest was too destroyed to make out any landmarks. “I have no idea where the shop stood…”

Jinta planned on taking a little break when his attention what caught on the sound of flapping wings. Looking up, he spotted several Hollows carrying what appeared to be a small bag of some sorts. What were they doing?

“He noticed us. Remember what Master Grimmjow said, boys.” the lead Hollow told his followers. They watched the massive form of Jinta rise to his feet and block their path with his body. Jinta looked down at the pitiful Hollows and grinned.

“Where are you punks going with that?” Jinta boomed, making the Hollows sweat a bit.

“W-we’re just taking a bounty of humans to our leader.” spoke one of them. “With Soul Society in ruins and people dying by the masses, us Hollows are having a feast.”

“I see…” Jinta muttered. He touched his stomach and felt it rumble a bit. He was just starting to get a little hungry. “You boys are just in time. Hand over the goods; I could use a snack.”

“What? But this--”

“Just hand it over!” Jinta commanded, snatching the bag from the Hollows' talons. Without caring to check its contents, Jinta poured the apples into his gaping mouth. He started to chew and it took him but a second to realize what it was.
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.title: What a Fruity Idea

choices: Jinta swifly punishes Grimmjow, killing him without mercy
Jinta slowly plays with Grimmjow dragging his punishment out as long as he can
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
Jinta smirked as the sweet juice filled his mouth, dripping slightly down the side of his mouth. He recognized this taste. It was the delicious taste of apples fresh off the tree. His all time favorite fruit! He chewed a few more times and swallowed it down, sighing in satisfaction. The Hollow all waited anxiously to see what would happen. Jinta raised an eyebrow at them and said, "Hey you stupid Hollows! That was a bag of apples. What are you trying to pull?"

The Hollows all looked at each other in fear before one said, "Uh...well....we...we just..."

Jinta's expression got stormier as this exchange went on. He crossed his arms and slowly rumbled, "It seems to me that you guys...are up to something."

The Hollows all lost it at once. "Every Hollow for himself! Let's get the hell out of here!"

The Hollows began to scatter, trying to fly away from the gargantuan teen. Jinta wasn't about to have that. He bellowed, "FREEZE!" and all the Hollows felt their bodies forced into compliance. Jinta gathered them all up in his palm and said, "So this was some kind of set up huh? Well you're not about to get away with that! Besides...I'm still hungry."

The Hollows were helpless as Jinta opened his smirking mouth wide dumping the creatures into his waiting maw. They were about as satisfying as the humans, slightly more so since they were larger but still not much of a meal. He swallowed them without a second thought and turned to look in the direction that Grimmjow had walked off in.

"That false god is behind this. I wonder who gave him such a stupid idea like that. Why would apples do anything to me?"

Hisagi's eyes suddenly widened and he shouted, "Lord Jinta! I think I may know what's going on!"

Jinta turned his attention to Hisagi and said, "Speak up sixty nine man! What's on your mind?"

"Perhaps Ichigo gave him the idea as a trick! It's possible Grimmjow as trying to force Ichigo to tell him a weakness of yours and Ichigo made one up!"

Jinta laughed at that thought and said, "I wouldn't put it past carrot top! He's not that stupid!"

Hisagi still had a panicked look on his face. "But Lord Jinta! Ichigo might be in terrible danger!"

Jinta rotated a finger in his ear and said, "Yeah, you're probably right. That spiky haired kitty wouldn't keep his word anyway. Well, guess I'll just take care of him now then."

He began to make his way over to where Grimmjow was, not knowing that Grimmjow had been watching the situation. His face was a mask of fury. He turned to the man in his hand and said, "Well, looks like you lied to me Soul Reaper."

Ichigo looked passively up at Grimmjow and said, "Of course! I'd never betray Lord Jinta! You're nothing more than a false god! He'd never forgive me if I submitted to you!"

Grimmjow grinned a feral grin and said, "Then submit to my stomach!"

He shoved Ichigo in head first, intending on swallowing him whole. Unfortunately this didn't work out the best. Ichigo had grown to be the size of his fist and he couldn't fit him totally in his mouth. He tried a few different ways but, even when he did manage to make the spiky haired teen fit in his mouth (by scrunching him up in a ball) he couldn't swallow him whole. He spat him out into his hand and said, "Well, I wanted to swallow you whole and have you die a slow and painful death inside my stomach, getting slowly dissolved by the acid, but I suppose ripping you limb from limb will have to do."

He brought the teen up to his mouth and breathed his hot breath onto Ichigo. "The only question is, which limb first? Maybe your right hand?"

He brought his teeth over the appendage in question and rested them gently on the wrist. Ichigo started to sweat, a horrible feeling welling up inside him. He was going to die...slowly and horribly, being dismembered by this psychopath. He closed his eyes and whispered softly, "I'm sorry Lord Jinta. I failed you..."

"Jeez carrot top! Don't give up so easily!"

Both Ichigo and Grimmjow jerked their heads and saw Jinta standing there, hands on hips, glaring at the Arrancar. Grimmjow brought Ichigo to his mouth and was about to bite off his head when Jinta shouted, "STOP!"

Grimmjow slowed down but didn't stop entirely. Thinking fast Jinta ripped a hole in reality and stuck his hand through. Just as Grimmjow was about to sever Ichigo's head with his razor sharp teeth Jinta's snatched the boy back, bringing him through the rift and back into his possession. Jinta looked shocked to see how much bigger Ichigo was. Hisagi's mouth was hanging open in disbelief.

"Woah. What happened to you carrot top?" Jinta asked.

Ichigo was about to explain himself when he remembered what he had had to do. He hesitated, not wanting to disobey his god but not wanting to reveal how he had betrayed him. He bowed and said, "I'll explain myself in great detail later Lord Jinta. But for now Grimmjow is getting away!"

Jinta looked up and saw the Arrancar trying to sneak away. "Oh no you don't!"

Jinta ran forward and slammed his foot down on top of the Arrancar. "You broke your promise pussy cat! Now get ready to pay the price!"

Jinta placed his hands on Grimmjow's back and started siphoning off the slime again. Ichigo suddenly remembered the last time he did this and said, "Lord Jinta! Some of the slime you're calling up is still active! That's how I grew!"

Jinta nodded, not breaking his concentration and said, "Alright then, thanks carrot top!"

Jinta drew more and more of the slime out of Grimmjow's system, calling all the particles of it together in a ball, inactive and otherwise. Soon, he had a sizable chunk of slime in his hand. Grimmjow slowly started returning to normal, his massive body deflating smaller and smaller. Jinta set the ball down and grabbed Grimmjow by the collar, lifting him to his feet. "Now watch kitty! Watch as you shrink before a true god!"

Grimmjow watched fearfully as Jinta seemed to expand before his eyes. He could literally feel his strength leaving his body as his muscles returned to their normal size, his body shrinking smaller and smaller. He passed by Jinta's knees...his calves...his ankles...his toes...Grimmjow craned his neck back as the toes grew into mountains before him. Jinta's spiritual pressure pushed down on him, forcing him to remain standing where he was. Jinta waited until Grimmjow was nothing more than a speck before him. He laughed, the sound booming down to Grimmjow like thunder, vibrating inside every fiber of his being. As Jinta reached down to grab him it was like a monolithic god stepping down from on high, the massive fingers gripping the back of his jacket and raising his body off the ground. He rocketed upward until he was face to gigantic eye to Jinta.

"Before I take care of you, I have something to attend to." Jinta boomed, the wind and volume of his voice blowing Grimmjow backward.

Jinta picked up the apple sized ball of slime and gobbled it up in three bites. He licked his fingers and belched over Grimmjow. "I don't know how much of that slime will actually affect me, but now no one else can grow."

He looked at Ichigo and said, "Now that I think of it, hold still carrot top."

Ichigo obediently sat still and waited as Ichigo pressed his finger against his chest. Within seconds Jinta had called out all the slime in Ichigo's body, returning the boy to his speck size, and swallowing the small amount of slime like a pill. Ichigo was perfectly content being back to his normal size. He preferred it this way. Jinta then turned his full attention on Grimmjow.

"Now...to take care of you."

1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
Jinta held the miniscule Arrancar on the tip of his index finger as he looked at him. It was amazing how someone who could give him so much trouble could become less than a bug in a matter of seconds. Then again, he went from being an overworked kid to a god in a few seconds, so it wasn’t completely unbelievable.

“Look at yourself, kitten. Where’s your big tough body now? Oh right…it’s GONE!” Jinta yelled, making Grimmjow cover his ears and glad he wasn’t directly in front of the boy’s mouth. His head might have exploded…but maybe that would have been a better death than whatever was in store for him now. He couldn’t believe it had come to this, but it was over. He had tried to open a Garganta to Hueco Mundo while in the void, but Aizen must have sealed the realm from him. Bastard must not have trusted him. It didn’t matter now, because he was done for and there was no way out. “I can’t even begin to imagine what’s going through your tiny head right now. Seeing my massive, godly form quickly ascend above you while your own power abandoned you must have been a real kick in nuts. I kinda feel sorry for you. Sorry enough that I can’t bring myself to torture someone as pathetic as you. I’ll end you quickly, okay?” Grimmjow wanted to tell the brat to take his pity and shove it, but held his tongue. Anything he said right now would just amuse the kid, and he wasn’t going to offer him any more amusement.

“First, though, I want you to get one last look.” Jinta said as he slowly started to move his hand away from his eye. To Grimmjow it felt like the entire world was moving and his view was changing. What was once a gigantic eye surrounded by peach-colored skin became the giant’s handsome face, then his entire head, then his upper chest, until finally Grimmjow could see all of the god’s massive body in all its glory. A body that could have been his, if he hadn’t made some stupid mistakes. “This is what you tried to overcome.” Jinta grinned evilly and started to crack his neck, shoulders, and arm. If his knuckles cracking sounded like thunder, this must have sounded like a thunder storm. To Grimmjow, it was like death bells. “And this is what’s going to destroy you.”

Grimmjow felt himself become surrounded in shadow and looked up. The blue sky quickly became like a ceiling of skin as Jinta hovered his thumb over the tiny speck. It got closer and closer, but Grimmjow tried not to look at it and kept his eyes locked with Jinta. He’d glare at the brat until the end.

“It’s been fun, but this is goodbye. Maybe we’ll see each other again. Once I become a complete God, I might resurrect you so I can have some more fun.”

“Wait, resurr--” But Grimmjow didn’t finish, because the thumb pressed against the finger and crushed him in a nanosecond. Jinta took great pleasure in rubbing his fingers together, turning the pest into a thin smear that was absorbed into the teen’s pores. The look on Grimmjow’s face in the last moment was priceless. He had given the bug a last glint of hope to snuff out. A nice parting gift for the both of them…

“And that’s that.” Jinta said, wiping his finger on his shirt despite there being nothing to wipe off.

“Another spectacular victory, Lord Jinta! I never had any doubts!” Hisagi praised, applauding his master. “What now, master? Should we celebrate your victory?”

“We don’t have time for celebrations. I still have two Soul Reapers and another realm to ruin. Celebrations can wait until after I’m Spirit King.”

“Umm…Lord Jinta. If you don’t mind me asking, must you also eliminate the two Soul Reapers?” Hisagi asked, an expression of pity on his face.

“Huh? Why wouldn’t I?”

“Well, it’s just that Grimmjow’s crimes were unforgivable, but they’ve yet to do anything to threaten you. Their intentions may be wrong, but so were ours before we saw the light.”

“You have a point…” Jinta replied, scratching his chin. Their crimes weren’t nearly as severe as the Arrancar’s. Plus, he could always use a couple new slaves. He always wanted to turn the moocher into his personal servant, and the kid seemed to have potential too. A little siphoning like he did to Grimmjow and they’d no longer be a threat. “I’ll think about it. It depends on how much trouble they give me. I wouldn’t mind turning them into slaves, but I also wouldn’t mind crushing them between my toes. First we have to find them, though.”

Grimmjow looked over the ruins of the town and was about to get back to searching when another voice stopped him.

“Wait a moment, Lord Jinta!” Ichigo yelled up to his god. “I have a request.”

“Ugh, what now? We don’t have all day!” Jinta told the smaller teen, making the boy shrink back in nervousness.

“If it’s not too much trouble…could you please punish me?”

“Wait…what? Punish you? What for?”

“For being such a burden to you. I wasn’t paying attention and got caught by Grimmjow. I had to do and say things I’m not proud of. Plus, I exposed myself to things someone like me doesn’t deserve.” Ichigo explained, speaking of his service to Grimmjow and his accidental exposure to the slime.

“None of that was your fault, carrot top. Don’t beat yourself up over it.”

“Please, Lord Jinta! I won’t feel the same unless I pay for what I’ve done.”

Jinta looked at Ichigo with stern eyes. His slave was ASKING him to punish him. The guy was really devoted. With a sigh, Jinta responded to his slave's plea by saying…

1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
"I'm not going to punish you. I should be rewarding you."

Ichigo looked up in shock, his mouth hanging open. "B-but Lord Jinta! I'm nothing more than an unworthy insect who over stepped his boundaries! I don't deserve such kindness that you would give me."

Jinta shook his head and said, "Listen carrot top. What you did was amazing for me. That whole apple thing? Not the smartest plan in the world but I'm not surprised an idiot like that pussy cat fell for it. It gave me all the excuse I needed to not only end his life but make sure you didn't get killed."

Ichigo trembled and said, "You should have just let me die rather than inconvenience you."

Jinta shook his head again. "Whatever. I was planning on letting you get killed but it would have been a bigger inconvenience having to train a slave to be as devoted as you."

Ichigo bowed and said, "I do all that I can to please you Lord Jinta."

Jinta grinned and said, "Yeah, and you're great at it carrot top! Now, stop your complaining and think of the best way you can serve me next!"

Ichigo smiled weakly and said, "As you wish Lord Jinta. Thank you for your mercy."

Jinta just waved his hand and went back to searching. The massive statue that stood in what was once the center of Karakura Town was much smaller than Jinta remembered it, smiling at how much he had grown in the past day. Of course, the statue made it difficult to find where Urahara's Shop once stood. His godly eyes scanned the ground, looking for any hint that would allow him to figure out what part of Karakura Town he was looking at. He growled in frustration looking over at Ichigo. "Hey carrot top! You know this place pretty well! Where was Urahara's Shop?"

Ichigo squinted down and said, "I'm sorry Lord Jinta but...I can't see anything from up here."

Jinta impatiently grabbed Ichigo and deposited him on the ground. Ichigo took a second to catch his breath from the sudden vertiginous trip and got his bearings. Looking around, the entire town had been razed by Jinta. Whatever hadn't been destroyed in his rampage had been pulled into making the statue. There was nothing but a vast plain, with no way of telling this had even BEEN a town in the first place. He looked up and felt his breath catch. He had forgotten how impressive Jinta looked from the ground. He quickly composed himself and said, "I'm sorry Lord Jinta! There's nothing left! I can't tell where anything used to be!"

Jinta frowned as he scooped Ichigo up into his hand. "Never mind what I said about rewarding you carrot top."

Ichigo hung his head and said, "It's what I deserve Lord Jinta."

Jinta was annoyed. He was a god! He should be able to find anyone and anything any time he wanted! These little obstacles in his ascension were starting to get annoying. He stomped the ground in annoyance, causing the statue to wobbled dangerously, fissures radiating out from the the massive foot. Ichigo and Hisagi started conversing, trying to come up with a plan to help their god.

As all this was going on, deep underground, Hitsugaya and Renji were starting to sweat as they heard Jinta stomping around up above. Urahara's underground bunker happened to be hidden by the statue that Jinta had created. Urahara had about ten entrances to it scattered across Karakura Town all connected by tunnels. The only one Jinta would ever have a chance of finding would be the one that was currently covered. The slimes in Renji and Hitsugaya had been fermenting inside them, slowly altering their bodies to prepare them for the transformation from Soul Reaper to God but no transformation was evident in them. They were starting to get worried.

"If that stupid brat catches us down here we're screwed!" Renji shouted.

"Stay calm Renji! Yelling isn't going to help anything." Hitsugaya said calmly, a slight facial twitch revealing his nervous state.

"You do know what's going to happen if he finds us don't you?" Renji questioned.

"He'll kill us you idiot." Hitsugaya responded, trying to ignore him.

"Like hell he will!" Renji shouted. "He'll do to us what he did to Hisagi and Ichigo! We'll be broken into mindless slaves! I don't know about you, but the last thing I want to do is service that giant KID!"

Hitsugaya growled in frustration before turning on Renji. "You don't think I know all that? What do you propose we do? We are powerless until that slime Urahara gives us starts working. I shudder to think what kind of destruction that boy has already caused while we've been down here..."

Renji just growled in frustration and kept pacing. Hitsugaya stared into space, trying to ignore the sounds of thunder above him that he knew were his adversary's footsteps. Would they be able to best this behemoth of a child before it was too late? Only time would tell.

1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
Jinta had enough. If his super sight couldn’t find them, it was time to rely on a different super sense. Jinta began to kneel down and lay himself flat on the ground, pressing his ear up against the dirt. Ichigo and Hisagi were forced to grab hold of Jinta’s cotton shirt to prevent tumbling off. The teen god closed his eyes and listened closely. Nothing could be alive in these ruins, so if he heard anything at all it could only be them. His slaves noticed what Jinta was doing and tried to be as quiet as possible, even holding their breath.

Nothing.

Nothing.

Nothing.

Footsteps.

Noth--

Wait, footsteps? Coming from directly beneath him! That must have been them! Jinta opened his eyes and sat up, looking around. His eyes fell on his statue nearby and he begun to think. If the entrance was hidden by the statue…

The large boy grinned, got to his feet, and stood over his statue. Blowing on his fist, Jinta spoke, “Guess what, Soul Bugs?” Jinta reared his fist back. “I found ya!!” With that, Jinta smashed his fist into the ground, obliterating it. Fissures shot out from the impact and turned the once smooth ground upside down. Most of all, the statue was turned to dust under Jinta’s knuckles. Ichigo was saddened by the lost of his past reward, but knew someone like him didn’t deserve it.

Underground, Renji and Hitsugaya shrieked when the enormous fist crashed through the ceiling and brought it down. The shockwave created from the introduction of the huge mass created a wave of destruction that swept over the secret room. The ground tore open and the pillars of stone collapsed. The two Soul Reapers only managed to survive by hopping from one chunk of debris to the next. When it was all over and Jinta removed his fist from the earth, Hitsugaya and Renji was mostly unharmed. They were standing in the middle of a heap of rubble that had once been their hiding place. Looking up in horror, their eyes locked with Jinta’s, who stared down at them from miles above.

“Long time no see, bugs. Did you miss me?” Jinta asked, chuckling and bringing his hand back into the hole. The two Soul reapers watched the impossibly huge hand descend upon them. It would be foolish to try and escape that. Jinta carefully pinched the two young fighters between his fingers and stood to his full height. Hitsugaya and Renji were brought before Jinta’s godly face, the two almost getting sick from being brought up so high so quickly. “You boys were a pain to find, but you made the mistake of hiding somewhere I knew about. If I were you, I would have hidden myself somewhere far away…like another country. You might have had a better chance then.”

“See? I told you that’s what we should have done!” exclaimed Renji, annoying his superior.

“I didn’t think being in a foreign land would be the best thing in this situation. Does it really matter anymore?”

“The kid’s right; it doesn’t matter. I would have found you eventually. No one is safe from Lord Jinta!”

“Enough of your talk, monster!” yelled the white haired captain. “If you’re going to kill us, just do it already!”

“I was going to kill you. Stomp you under my foot FOR REAL this time. However, why should I dispose of two perfectly good slave candidates so quickly?”

“I told you! He’s going to turn us into mindless slaves! It’s worst than death!” the vice-captain screamed, shaking with fear. Hitsugaya was ashamed of the older male’s composure. He was shaking so bad it looked like he was going to wet his pants.

The 10th Squad Captain looked up at what was supposed to be their “god” and replied, “You can forget about me! I’d rather die than become your--”

“Yeah, yeah, yeah. Can we just skip the ‘I’ll never serve you’ dialogue and get straight to the part where I break you anyways?” Jinta said, rolling his humongous eyeballs. “First though, I think you two have some slime that needs draining.”

Jinta concentrated on the two tiny specks between his fingertips. The two high ranking Soul Reapers closed their eyes and prepared to feel the power leave their bodies. Power that they’d never know. After several seconds, nothing happened.

“Strange…” Jinta muttered, stopping his concentration. “You two are slimeless.” Renji and Hitsugaya looked up at Jinta with puzzled looks. They looked at each other and just shrugged.

“Are you sure, Lord Jinta? Why did the Spirit King lie?” asked Hisagi, grabbing the two other Soul Reapers attention. Did he just say Spirit King? Was the King of Soul Society helping the titan? Why?

“Dunno. At least I got two new slaves out of the wild goose chase. Now…what to do first…”

Renji scooted over to Hitsugaya and whispered in his ear.

“Captain, what’s going on? Was the slime Kisuke gave us duds?”

“I don’t know. They were supposed to be more potent versions than the stuff Jinta took, right? Perhaps part of that potentness makes their bond with our bodies stronger. We could have no slime on our systems because it’s already completely fused with our beings.”

The tattooed Soul Reaper nodded, hoping the younger boy was right. If he did have an enormous power laying dormant in his body, he wished it would hurry the hell up! It wouldn’t do much good if it activated when he had already succumbed to Jinta’s dominance.

“Did I tell you specks you could whisper?!” Jinta boomed, making his two slaves separate immediately and back away from Jinta’s god-like face. “Anyway, time for some good old slave training.”

1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
Jinta smirked down at his new slaves, wondering what would be the best place to start breaking them in. There was nothing nearby that he could use to restrain them and put them somewhere on his body. Too bad. He was hoping to make some Soul Reaper rings to round out his living jewelry line. He looked over his body. He could put them in the pockets but that would be far too lenient. He wasn't about to let them just wander around on his shoulders either. This shouldn't be so hard...

He snapped his fingers which was the sound of judgment to Renji and Hitsugaya. He grinned down at them and said, "Alright insects! I've come up with a great idea! You two are going where none of my slaves have gone before!"

Renji instinctively glanced downward, fearing that Jinta meant they were going somewhere very...private. Jinta laughed and said, "Yeah right! Been there done that. You two are going somewhere a lot less fun."

He gathered Renji, Hitsugaya, Ichigo, and Hisagi into his hand and removed his shirt, revealing his sculpted upper body to the world. He flexed a little, loving his older look. He lifted up his arm and smelled his pit. He made a face before smiling. "Wow, I've worked up a real sweat today. Taking down false gods and looking for little wannabes really works up a sweat. Doesn't help that I haven't bathed in awhile. But it's a perfect environment for two little troublemakers."

Renji moaned and covered his face while Hitsugaya just glared at the teen god. Ichigo and Hisagi smiled at each other and Hisagi said, "You should have just surrendered to Lord Jinta. It would have been a lot easier."

"Shut the hell up!" Renji shouted, grabbing Hisagi by the collar. "I'm not some pathetic little toy to be used by an over sized kid!"

"HEY!" Jinta bellowed from on high. "I didn't give you permission to touch my slave!"

Renji instantly let go to cover his ears from the booming voice. Jinta grabbed Renji in his fingers and dangled him in front of his face. "Listen up you little runt! Kiss your old life goodbye! You're not a Soul Reaper anymore! You don't have any authority! You're less than the dirt I crush under my feet! So GET USED TO IT!"

He punctuated every word with enough force to reduce Renji into a silent, quivering blob of nerves. Jinta nodded at his success and turned his attention to Hitsugaya.

"What about you snowball? You got anything to say?" Jinta asked with a smirk.

Hitsugaya merely glared up at Jinta and said, "I have nothing to say to a monster like you. You won't get away with this."

Jinta snorted in amusement and said, "Yeah, sure thing snowball. Keep up that bravado. It'll make it all the sweeter when you're begging to kiss my toes."

Before Hitsugaya could respond Jinta dumped him on his shoulder along with Ichigo and Hisagi before picking him up and putting him in the same hand as Renji.

"Well specks it's time to head to your new home! Enjoy!"

Jinta laughed as he raised his arm and slowly brought the duo closer and closer to his pit. The closer they got the more they could feel a horrible heat baking off of it, a distinct smell emanating off of it, the stench increasing with every inch. The pit was littered with a small growth of red hairs, each one massive in scale. A single follicle could serve as a living area for the specks, with no fear of falling. Renji started to retch a little at the horrific scent, smelling like thousands of gyms full of thousands of sweaty guys all assaulting his nostrils at once. Hitsugaya could feel sweat dripping down his face and gathering in his clothes. It was like descending into a foul smelling furnace.

Finally, they were within the confines of the pit. Jinta tipped his palm until the two Soul Reapers were settled on his fingertip. He held them up to the slimy skin and let them see first hand what was in store for them.

"Say hello to your new home, and goodbye to your humanity!" Jinta said with a snicker.

Without another word Jinta pushed his finger tip into the skin, lightly brushing them off. The sweat instantly adhered them to the skin. Renji was pushed face first into the skin while Hitsugaya was lucky enough to be facing away from the skin. Of course, it was all the same once Jinta lowered his arm. Hitsugaya was forced to watch as the massive arm slowly lowered, hair crinkling into place all around him, the light slowly disappearing, the heat increasing until he was trapped in the foul smelling darkness, his tormentor's muffled laugh the only sound he could hear.

Jinta dusted his hands off and said, "Well that was easy. That just leaves Hueco Mundo to take care of now."

Ichigo looked up at his god and said, "Lord Jinta! If I may ask, how do you plan on taking care of Hueco Mundo?"

Jinta rolled his eyes and said, "The same way I took care of the Soul Society carrot top! No one there is even close to my power! It'll be a massacre!"

He cracked his knuckles and ripped open a portal to Hueco Mundo, stepping through it. This was it. The last obstacle in his path to becoming God. As soon as he was done taking care of Hueco Mundo he would go back to the Spirit King and take over his throne. Jinta frowned as he looked down at his body. It had been awhile since he had grown. What was taking that damn slime so long? He wanted that feeling back, the feeling of his power growing more and more. Technically speaking the Spirit King was still more powerful than he was. That really annoyed him. He didn't want the throne of All Creation to be just handed to him. He wanted to take it! To arrive in front of the Spirit King as a superior being and make him cower before him! He wanted even God to acknowledge him as the most powerful, kneel down before him, and kiss his feet.

Jinta grinned as he imagined this scene. Oh yeah he was going to make it happen. If his body didn't want to grow fast enough for him he could always find another warhead to eat. America had quite a stockpile if he remembered correctly...
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.title: Sweaty, Smelly Prison

choices: Aizen creates something to fight Jinta.
Aizen messes with Jinta's head a little more.
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
Hueco Mundo, the world of the Hollows, was as silent as it always was. That is, until a rip appeared out of nowhere and a certain teenaged red head stepped through to make some noise. Under one of his large, strong arms were his two newest slaves; slowly cooking in the intense heat Jinta’s body radiated. Under the other was his damp, sweaty shirt which he hadn’t bothered to put back on. If he had put it on, all the heat his body gave off would have been trapped in its folds and eventually cooked his slaves to death. Plus, he wanted to show Hueco Mundo just what they were up against. He had never been to Hueco Mundo before, obviously, but he was hoping for something similar to Soul Society. Some Hollow villages, maybe a few large towers. Something that could be called Aizen’s kingdom. Needless to say, he was disappointed.

“This is Hueco Mundo?” inquired Jinta, looking over the desert-like world and wiggling his toes through the white sand. “No wonder Aizen wants to rule the world. I’d be unhappy too if I ruled a wasteland.” Jinta scanned the horizon and looked for any structures. Save for a few half-buried buildings, the only thing he could see was a large fortress in the distance: Las Noches. He had to say, the Hollow realm was quite big. Despite his own impressive size, the castle was a ways off. It would take at least a minute to get there if he ran. Jinta wasn’t in any rush, though, and started walking forward. He wanted the Arrancars to hear his approach and watch helplessly as his gargantuan form got closer and closer.

The world under Jinta’s soles wasn’t lifeless, though. As Jinta marched through the sands, the Hollows that made there home in Hueco Mundo began to become aware of his presence. However, these were weak and mindless Hollows. They didn’t understand just how powerful and mighty Jinta was, just that he was a massive source of spiritual energy that they wanted to devour. Before Jinta knew it, thousands of Hollows emerged from the sand and started to surround him. Several more thousand Hollows took flight and flew at Jinta’s massive form. They attached themselves to his torso and attempted to cause the boy harm. Biting, scratching, slashing, and punching they tried; but nothing seemed to break through the behemoth’s hard muscles.

“Pests.” grumbled Jinta as he brushed the specks off himself. He was about to continue his trek when he noticed something heavy on his feet. Looking down, he saw that thousands of Hollows had covered his bare feet like swarms of insects. “Ugh, what do you bugs think you’re doing?!” Jinta lifted his feet out of the Hollow crowd and stomped them out of existence. He turned his attention to another flock of flying Hollows.

“You want all this delicious spirit energy?” Jinta asked, patting himself on the chest. “Well you can’t have it, but you can become part of it!” Jinta opened his mouth and took a long breath, filling not only his lungs with air but his mouth with Hollows. No Hollow could escape the unimaginable force of the vacuum and were sucked up. Once all the airborne creatures were in his wet cave, Jinta closed his lips and swallowed them all in one gulp. He felt them drop into his stomach where they were easily overcome by his inner juices. Some Hollows continued to fight from the inside, but were quickly melted by the acids. Rubbing his abs, Jinta felt his stomach rumble under his hand and hot air rose up from it toward his mouth. Jinta bent down so his face was directly above the grounded Hollows and unleashed a huge belch. The force of the sound wave alone crushed any remaining Hollows and burrowed a crater into the sand. Jinta wiped his mouth with his arm and smirked evilly.

“Thanks for the meal. Got anymore?” Jinta looked around, but found that any surviving Hollows were intelligent enough to flee. He shrugged and continued on to Las Noches. As he approached, the fortress’s leader watched him. Aizen’s eyes showed no fear, only amusement.

“While your senses are that of a god’s, they are still senses. You are not immune to my power.” Aizen said as he began to unsheathe his katana. “Shatter, Kyoka Suigetsu.”

Jinta’s walk to Las Noches was taking too long so he decided to pick up the pace. He started to run, feeling the expansive realm pass by him. He covered miles in seconds while any Hollows or structures that happened to be in his path were swept up in the destruction he was causing. Eventually, he reached the palace and towered over it. A frown spread over his lips. The castle may have been impressive to anyone else, but to Jinta it was puny. A little bigger than Seireitei, but still nothing compared to him.

“I came all this way to destroy this? What a waste…let’s get this over with.” Jinta stepped over the fortress so both his legs were positioned on either side of it. Grinning down at the sizable structure, Jinta let himself sit down on the palace. It quickly broke under his massive weight and collapsed. The dome was hollow on the inside, so not much was offered in terms of resistance. Jinta felt his butt crush the entire building and everything inside of it. Soon nothing was left standing and Jinta rubbed his ass into the rubble a few times before getting up and dusting his pants off.

“Well that was simple. Now to find a way to make myse--” Jinta was interrupted by something that caught his eye. Not far from his current position was ANOTHER fortress, this one identical to the one he had just obliterated. Why hadn’t he noticed it before? “Two castles? Who builds to castles right next to each other?”

Jinta just shrugged and strolled over to the second fortress. He sat down again, but not on the structure this time. Instead he sat just before it with his back facing the building. He sighed and leaned himself back upon the building. Like before, the fortress creaked under his weight until its few supports were broken and it fell under his body. Jinta smiled as he crushed the second castle under his muscular back. Ichigo and Hisagi were lucky not to roll of the boy’s shoulder. They couldn’t grab onto his hard skin, but they remained in place by the layer of sweat decorating his broad shoulders.

“Okay, NOW we’re leaving.” Jinta announced, sitting up and preparing to get to his feet until yet another thing was caught in in his sight. Yep, you guessed it, a third Las Noches. Jinta’s face turned red with anger as he hurried to his feet and stomped over to the building. Without bothering to think of a creative way to crush this one, Jinta simply kicked the structure to bits. It took just a few swings of his feet until nothing remained but smoking ruins. Jinta stopped to catch his breath and wiped his brow of sweat. Hitsugaya and Renji must feel like they’re in a volcano. After getting his energy back, Jinta smiled down at the ruins beneath him. How easily it was to do what no one else could before him: defeat Aizen and his goons. He wasn’t doing anyone a favor, though. They just happened to be plotting against him. Jinta turned back to the other ruined palaces to take in their destruction as well.

Jinta’s mouth gaped open in shock. They were both standing again.

Aizen smirked at Jinta’s little display of power from the real Las Noches, hidden from Jinta. He had cast his Zanpakuto’s Shikai on him and trapped him in his illusion. Jinta’s superior senses only served to make the illusions seem all the more real. He didn’t expect this to stop Jinta in the end, however. He was only stalling for time until his 8th Espada finished their ultimate project. He planned to have as much fun with Jinta as he could, and that wasn’t just limited to confusing the boy a bit.
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.title: Aizen's Game
