Jinta manages to break through the illusion somehow
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
Jinta was getting seriously pissed. No matter what he did, Las Noches seemed to pop up out of nowhere. But that was impossible! Castles didn't just pop up out of nowhere. After stomping out his tenth castle he stopped to catch his breath. He leaned down, hands on his knees and just panted. This was insane! Someone was making him a fool of him and he wasn't going to let him get away with it. Ichigo, who was pressed face down on top of Jinta's shoulder, would have been able to tell Lord Jinta that what he was seeing was nothing more than illusion. Hisagi, who was plastered on his back, with his head pointing sideways, was in the same boat as Jinta, thinking the fortresses were real and trying to figure out how they were rising up out of the ground. When Jinta was done resting he saw that six fortresses were surrounding him. He crossed his arms and said, "There is no way this is happening! These fortresses have to be a mirage or something."

Aizen smiled at the teen's revelation and said, "Alright then, let's try something else."

Jinta smirked when he saw the fortresses disappear. "Hah! I knew it!"

He looked around for the real fortress but there didn't appear to be one. He was about to start heading off in a random direction to find the fortress when he saw something strange out of the corner of his eye. He turned to look and saw what appeared to be a crowd of specks rushing toward him. He focused on them and was shocked to see it was thousands of Soul Reapers! But that was impossible! He stepped forward and brought his foot down on them with a deafening crash. This merely caused them to start swarming up and over his foot, rushing up his legs. He could feel their tiny blades trying to attack him and failing miserably. He used his other foot to scrape them off, sending many of them tumbling down to the ground while others merely swarmed onto the other leg. It was like being attacked by a bunch of insects.Soon, they were running up his torso. Jinta slapped them and rubbed them into his giant body, their presence becoming more and more annoying. Finally he just shouted in frustration and fell onto his back, turning back and forth until all the bugs were crushed underneath him. When he got back up he saw that the Soul Reapers had all vanished.

"Alright, now what the heck is going on here?!?" Jinta roared in frustration, looking around as if hoping to spot the source of his agitation. Aizen, however wasn't about to let Jinta find the real Las Noches. If his concentration faltered on keeping the fortress hidden Jinta would destroy it in an instant. But Aizen wasn't one to lose his cool so easily. He merely cast yet another illusion over the teen god.

Jinta's question was left unanswered as he was suddenly hit from behind. He was thrown forward onto his stomach. He turned around and felt his jaw drop. He hadn't seen anything like this coming. Standing before him with a sadistic grin and cracking his knuckles was Grimmjow. Jinta jumped up and saw that the fallen god was the same size as him. He shook his head but Grimmjow was still standing there. There was just no way! This was impossible!

"I killed you less than 15 minutes ago!" he shouted. "How the hell are you even here?!?"

Grimmjow didn't bother answering. He merely charged forward slammed a fist in Jinta's gut, sending the boy to the ground once more. Jinta kicked out and managed to knock Grimmjow down onto one knee, jumping up and kicking him in the face. Jinta ran over and stomped on his stomach, knocking the wind out of him before kicking him in the face again. Jinta panted a little and watched as Grimmjow got up. Jinta had seen that he had clearly did some damage. A bruise on his stomach, a deep scratch along his face, things like that. However, when Grimmjow faced him again there wasn't a single sign of any damage whatsoever!

Aizen knew he couldn't keep this up forever. Las Noches was hidden from view but if Jinta were to stumble over to it he could accidentally crush it without realizing it. Just having him running and jumping around was causing massive damage to the area, breaking apart the ground, opening fissures, and creating earthquakes that raged up and down the countryside. If Aporro didn't hurry up and finish his experiment they might not last...
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.title: Fighting the Illusion

choices: The Infinity Corps gang up on Jinta.
The Infinity Corps have something else in mind.
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
Aizen watched Jinta’s little skirmish with the fake Grimmjow from the comfort of his throne. The boy was beginning to suspect something, but that hardly mattered. Knowing it was illusion or not, Jinta was still trapped in it. A holographic screen displaying Szayel’s face popped up in front of the former captain, a wicked grin plastered to his face.

“Everything is ready, Lord Aizen.” the pink haired Espada announced.

“Good, then let us end this charade.” replied Aizen, equally as enthusiastic as Aporro but not showing a hint of it.

Outside, Jinta recoiled from another blow of Grimmjow’s. He was covered in bruises and cuts and short on breath, but wasn’t planning on giving in to the ghost. Just before he threw himself at the older giant, Grimmjow shattered into millions of glass shards that vanished before they hit the ground. Jinta was confused once again, and even more so when he noticed all his injuries were gone.

“Okay, what’s going on here?! I’m sick of this game! Carrot top, do you know what’s going on?” Jinta asked his head slave, but noticed when he looked down that both the smaller teens were laying down on his shoulder unable to move. “Oops, guess my body’s a lot more sweatier than I thought.” Jinta gently peeled the two shrimpy teens free. He then lifted his arm and checked on his two slaves-in-training. “You two still alive?” Jinta got a few groans as a response and plucked them free, holding all four of his slaves free. He picked up his shirt which had dropped during the fight, fanned it in the air to remove any sand, and slipped it back over his torso. He turned his attention back to Renji and Toshiro, who were still really weak from their hot stay in his pit. “Your training is far from finished, but I don’t want to torture my good slaves in the process. We’ll continue after we finish up here.”

The two sweaty Soul Reapers didn’t respond, being too weak. Jinta deposited all four of them on his shoulder. Ichigo, now able to speak, yelled up to his master, “Lord Jinta! I think we’re in an illusion!”

“Illusion? That would explain a lot.”

“Yeah, it’s Aizen’s Zanpakuto. It has the power to control anyone’s senses. This is my first time seeing it, but I’m sure of it!”

“Alright, but the real castle is still there, right? I just can’t see it. In that case, I’ll just kick this place apart until I feel it crumble!”

Before Jinta could put his plan into action, he felt the ground start to rumble. It rumbled so much that even the mighty titan himself was thrown off balance. Four hidden, gigantic hatches opened nearby. They were each large enough for Jinta to fit through, and each seemed like a hole to infinite darkness. The sound of machines starting to crank echoed across Hueco Mundo as four giant capsules started to emerge from the pits. These capsules were far from normal, being covered in what looked like skin instead of metal and sporting many eyes. It was proof that these objects were probably grown, not constructed. No one would be able to construct something so massive in so little time, let alone four of them. Jinta was both amazed and angered that something actually existed that was equal in size to him. Once the capsules had fully emerged, he proceeded to stomp over to them so he could trash them…whatever “them” was. He barely got half-way there when the capsules started to open, and he stopped dead. Steam spread from the capsules and washed over Hueco Mundo like a thick fog. That wasn’t all that poured out, though. Jinta, his slaves, Aizen, everyone in Hueco Mundo felt a massive spiritual energy flood out of each capsule as they opened. Each one must have been given off spiritual pressure equal to Jinta’s, who was rooted in place. His slaves were once again laying flat on the boy’s shoulder, and not because of the sweat this time.

“Captain!” yelled Renji, lucky enough to have his face facing sideways so he could speak. “What is this?! This spiritual energy…it’s identical to the kid’s, but there’s four of them!”

“Aizen!” Hitsugaya muttered his name with spite. “What have you done this time?”

Aizen smiled, his victory all but assured. The capsules fully opened and the figures of giants started to emerge. They were all just as big as Jinta and dressed in the same garb as an Arrancar . And their faces…were that of a white-haired Jinta.

“Oh for crying out loud!” Jinta screamed, ears steaming. “I’ve had enough with look-a-likes! Can’t anyone be original?”

The look-a-likes didn’t seem to notice Jinta. They were too busy examining their bodies, grinning with delight at what they saw. They appeared to be Arrancars, each possessing the mask fragment of an upper jaw positioned in such a way so it covered their left eyes. Other than that and their hair and clothes, they were perfect copies. Same face, same build, same grin. If they had Hollow holes, they weren’t visible. Eventually Jinta’s yelling got their attention and they looked his way.

“Who are you? You’re not us, since your hair’s red.” one of them spoke, his voice exactly like Jinta’s.

“He must be the guy we were created from.” answered another.

“Created from? What the hell are you talking about?” Jinta asked, scratching his hair. Hitsugaya and Renji looked at the four Arrancars with disbelief. One Jinta was enough…now there were four more!

“They’re clones, in a sense.” spoke Aporro, who increased the volume of his voice via a microphone so everyone could hear him. The scientist appeared next to one of the bare feet of his creations.

“Explain, Pinky. Now.” Jinta commanded, already disliking the man.

“Your ability to come up with pet names at first glance is astounding.” Aporro said, curling a strand of hair with his finger. “They are clones I created using the DNA you so generously left behind during the last few days. At your size, even a droplet of blood is easy to find. Plus, that little stunt you pulled to wipe out the Soul Reapers helped out quite a bit.” Szayel licked his lips at the last part, displaying his creepy side. “I call them the Infinity Corps. They have your size and all your abilities, plus your average Arrancar‘s abilities such as Cero. Unfortunately, they also posses your personality, but they’ll kill you and the Spirit King all the same. Infinity Corps, eliminate this menace immediately!”

The Arrancar Jintas didn’t move a muscle. They acted like they didn’t know Aporro existed.

“What are you waiting for? I told you to eliminate him!” Aporro ordered up at the far larger Arrancars. The Arrancar who owned the foot Szayel stood next to looked down at him with a grin.

“Hey, look boys. It’s a tiny speck.” he said, bringing the others’ attention towards him.

“You’re right. I wonder why it thought it could stand among gods like us.”

“You should teach it a lesson.”

“W-w-what?!” Aporro mumbled, his legs becoming weak as he watched one of his creations lift his bare sole over him. “You can’t disobey me! I created you!! I control--”

*STOMP*

The white-haired Jinta swiveled his foot a bit before erupting into a fit of laughter with his brothers. Jinta felt like laughing too, if these four weren’t his enemies. Inside Las Noches, Aizen simply smirked while others looked on in confusion. During the production of the Infinity Corps, he had tricked Aporro into making them obey no one but himself.

“My children,” Aizen spoke to the four teenaged-looking Arrancars. Special chips had been planted in their heads, allowing them to hear Aizen’s commands from anywhere. “Please eliminate this so-called-god.”

“Roger.” they all said as they cracked their knuckles, giving Jinta wicked grins.
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.title: The Infinity Corps

choices: Jinta refuses...and is forced into humiliation.
Jinta refuses...and suddenly starts growing again!
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
Jinta bent down slightly, raising his fists in a fighting stance, and waited for the impostors to make the first move. They were all slowly spreading out, circling him around. He was aware of each one of them, even the two behind him. These clones were made with his personality and he knew just how creative and destructive he could get. He was standing in the fighting stance to hid the fact that he was gripping reality, ready to rip it open and escape or trap these clones away until he could decide how to deal with them. Suddenly, the one to the right of him said, "Hey, we don't want to fight you."

Jinta turned to him and said, "Yeah right! You wannabes were made from me so I know how you think! I'm not going to let anyone stand in my way of becoming god so there's no reason you four shouldn't feel the same."

The one to the left said, "Actually, we're being suppressed by a chip in our head." He tapped his head.

The one behind him said, "So we really can't do anything that he doesn't want us to do" He pointed to an empty area. Jinta figured he was pointing at the real Las Noches. He wanted to mark the area in some way so he'd be able to find it later but couldn't think of a way. He turned to the guy in front of him who said, "So we do have to kill you."

The one to the right: "And we will."

Right: "But that doesn't mean we can't have some fun first!"

Front: "Besides, we could kill you in a second anyway. Totally crushing you is fun...but humiliating you first is even better!"

Jinta glared at them and shouted, "Like I'd ever let you nobodies take me out!"

The Infinity Corp all laughed at him and the one to the right said, "Look at you! You're pathetic! You're all bruised and beaten! We could take you out in five seconds!"

Jinta jeered and said, "I'd like to see you try!"

Before he knew what was happening he felt hands and feet slamming into him from all directions. These guys were fast! Was he always this fast when he was at 100%? He was suddenly face first in the warm sand, his arms pinned behind him while his legs were being held down by two hands for each leg. He struggled and tried to free himself.

"I'd stop if I were you original." The one holding his arms said with a snicker. "I've got my hand right next to your neck. If you make any more sudden moves say "bye-bye" to your head."

Jinta stopped and shouted, "What, you think this is enough to stop me?"

The one holding his right leg said, "Don't kid yourself. You're too tired to knock us off and your hands are tied up so you can't rip open reality. You're helpless!"

"Besides," a voice said from above him.

Jinta looked up and saw the last of his clones smirking down at him, hands at his hips. "Our slime was improved, integrated with our cells. Yours however..."He just grinned evilly.

"Really, we're giving you a great deal." The one on the right leg said.

"I mean, nothing's stopping us from stealing all your slime right now and crushing you like a bug." The one on his other leg said.

"We're giving you a chance to live for a little longer, so I suggest you take it!" The one holding his arms said.

Jinta gritted his teeth and stared at the ground. The best thing he could see from his angle was the bare feet of the clone standing in front of him. The last thing he wanted to do was imagine himself small enough to be crushed by those feet. He wasn't some stupid bug! He was a god! He was going to smash these wannabes, and obliterate the idiots who thought they could stand up to him!

"Don't worry Lord Jinta! These pretenders are nothing compared to you!" Hisagi shouted.

"He's right! Rise up and smash them Lord Jinta!" Ichigo shouted.

"Hey, what are these? Specks?" The one standing above Jinta grabbed all four of his slaves into his palm and looked at them with an evil grin. "Hah! Nice, you have some little slaves! Hey, there's four of them!"

The one holding his arms shouted, "Awesome! One for each of us!"

That was it. Jinta saw red. He twisted savagely, catching his opponents off guard and freeing his arms which allowed him to get enough leverage to free his legs. He got to his feet and tackled the clone holding his slaves, pinning him down. He raised his hand and was about to sever the clone's head when one grabbed him from behind, forcing his arms up and pulling him off the other clone. The one who had been tackled got to his feet and slammed his fist in Jinta's gut. "Consider this a warning." He slammed it in again. "If you try anything like that again..." Again. "We'll finish you off for good!" The last punch was aimed at his face.

"So...what's it going to be?"
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.title: Plans of Humiliation

choices: The clones play with Jinta sexually.
The clones toy with Jinta's slaves.
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
Jinta’s answer was easy. So easy, in fact, he spat it in his face. The Arrancar didn’t change is facial expression and just wiped the saliva off with his sleeve. He gave his original a good kick in the gut afterwards, making Jinta spit out blood next. While he was recovering from the blow, the two other Arrancars grabbed his shoulders and forced him to his knees.

“Submit to us or not, we’ll still have our fun.” the clone in front of him said as he pocketed the four tiny Soul Reapers somewhere in his white jacket.

“Aren’t we supposed to distribute those amongst ourselves?” the one holding Jinta’s left shoulder asked.

“We will, but first let’s have some fun with this so-called-god.” the front clone replied, cracking the fingers of his right hand as he looked down at Jinta. The one-eyed clone crouched down and grabbed Jinta’s hair with that hand, forcing the technically older male to look at him. “Ready, guys? Do it.”

Jinta’s eyes widened as he realized what they were about to do. He started to thrash, desperately trying to escape their hold.

“Don’t you dare! I’ll kill you!” he shouted, but it was too late. It had begun. All four of his clones were in physical contact with him, and through that contact they began to draw out the slime within Jinta. The red head felt his power, his godhood, leaving him from four different points. Slowly the slime began to seep out of his pores, just as he had done to Grimmjow only minutes before. It gathered into the Infinity Corps’ hands, each one of them grinning down at Jinta sadistically. Jinta wasn’t in physical pain, but they knew he was hurting. When they had finished, each one of them let go of the boy and held a golf ball of the powerful slime in their palms.

“Should we eat them now?” One of them asked, inspecting the orb between his fingers.

“I don’t see the point.” the front one answered. “We don’t need to grow any bigger than we already are to humiliate this guy. He’s about to shrink, after all.” The frontal clone looked Jinta in the eyes and grinned. “Don’t worry, original. We didn’t take all of it, just enough to cut you down to size. And look, it’s starting.”

Jinta watched as the face that almost seemed like a reflection of his started to get further and further away. The four clones who surrounded him pocketed his prized slime for later use and watched as the mighty Jinta shrunk before their eyes. Jinta got to his feet and noticed he was looking directly into one of the clone’s chest. He continued to lose his size and became leveled with the doppelgangers’ waists. He looked at his hands in horror and disbelief. He didn’t seem to be losing his older body, but that hardly seemed important when what really mattered was going out the window. This couldn’t be happening, not after he had done so much. He had struck fear into an entire planet, destroyed the protectors of said planet, and crushed anyone who got in his way. In the end, he was to be beaten by himself?! He knew the saying “You are your own greatest enemy”, but no one said anything about there being four yous!

Jinta felt himself stopped shrinking and looked up. He was horrified to see that he stood just up to the Arrancar’s knees. It wasn’t even half his former size! The four look-a-likes chuckled down at him with their arms folded over their chests. Jinta felt like a little kid about to be bullied by a bunch of teenagers. This wasn’t how a god was supposed to feel. He clenched his fists in anger and craned his head up at the front clone, giving him a death glare. He prepared to tear reality, separating the white-haired Jinta’s body from his grinning head. Before he could, the Arrancar acted first and pointed his palm at the smaller boy. Jinta felt his hand hit something solid. He tried punching the air, but hit a hard surface instead. Feeling around with his hands, he realized he was trapped in an orb of warped space…and it was shrinking! The sphere got smaller and smaller by the Arrancar’s command. Jinta tried bashing out of the orb and even increasing his spiritual pressure, but the walls wouldn’t give. Eventually he was forced into a fetal position, hugging his legs and burrowing his face into his chest. He heard the superior gods mock him above, giggling and making comments. One of them picked up the orb and brought it to his face, peering at its contents.

“Hey, look guys, a soccer ball. All ready to be kicked around.” the Jinta clone mocked, grinning at the red-headed teen. Jinta tried to shout curses and threats at his captor, but the sphere was made to allow sound in…but none could get out. "Alright let's do this!" Both clones shouted, heading towards the giant Hitsugaya's legs with the attention of severing them at the ankle. Hitsugaya, of course, saw them coming and quickly kicked out at them, knocking them both down like puppies trying to nip at their master's legs. The clones didn't give up, warping space and punching through it, each time their fists appearing in different areas over Hitsugaya's body. The giant Soul Reaper couldn't predict where the punches would come from and stepped back, avoiding the last round of punches and grabbing both clones by the wrists, yanking their bodies forward. In order to avoid having their arms ripped off they quickly opened the tears wider, their entire bodies pulling through until Hitsugaya had one in each hand and one his mouth. He crunched down on the one in his mouth, ripping the clone in half and spitting out his corpse onto the sand, red blood staining the expanse of gray. Hitsugaya turned his attention to the two in his hands and said, "Now there's just you two to worry about."

The clones struggled and tried to escape but there was no way they could overpower this over sized boy. Hitsugaya looked over the two clones and saw Ichigo trapped on the clone's now soft dick head, and Hisagi trapped on the other clone's nipple. He knew they were loyal to Jinta, but they had been through far worse than any other person who had had contact with Jinta. After spending so much time in the boy's pit he could understand how constant abuse like that would turn one's mind. He transferred both clone's to one hand and carefully plucked the two tiny Soul Reapers from their prisons and held them on his finger tip. He looked them over and said, "Are you two okay?"

Ichigo nodded and said, "Thanks for saving me but...I won't help you! And I won't leave Lord Jinta!"

"Me either!" Hisagi shouted. "Don't think a false god like you can stand up to Lord Jinta!"

Hitsugaya chose not to answer. He would be able to deal with these two later. He lowered them to the same area where Renji was waiting and opened the space, adding the two with Renji. Both Soul Reapers ignored Renji and started looking anxiously around for Jinta.

"Where is he? What happened to Lord Jinta?" Ichigo asked worriedly, looking around.

"I don't know! I can't see him!" Hisagi said, his tone equal to Ichigo's.

Renji was disgusted watching them. He had seen Ichigo not too long ago and he had been willing to fight an impossible fight even if it meant dying. Now...he was a sniveling slave to an over sized KID. Then Renji remembered exactly what it had been like, being so close to the giant, being subjected to his will. He suddenly had much more sympathy for the two Soul Reapers. He couldn't bring himself to point out where Jinta lay, broken and defeated. It might shatter their world view even more. They were going to have to eventually see the truth, that Jinta was a horrible monster that needed to be put in his place, but it would be done gently, reversing their brain washing until they were back to normal...if that was possible.

Hitsugaya stood back up and looked at the clones in his hand. They were still struggling, their hands pinned at their sides, unable to do anything to stop the silver haired giant.

"Now...what should I do with you two?" He asked to himself, looking the clones over.

"This isn't over!" One shouted, still struggling. "You can't keep us down for long!"

"Yeah!" The other shouted. "You're nothing compared to us! Nothing!"

Hitsugaya couldn't help but snort at these comments. "Please. On equal footing you and your friends were nothing to me. You're just a bunch of over sized children, arrogant as long as you're torturing creatures smaller and weaker than you. Really, you're nothing more than a group of bullies holding a magnifying glass to an ant hill."

"Shut up! We're gods! GODS!" The first clone shouted again his struggling increasing.

Hitsugaya tightened his grip and the clones groaned in pain. "Look at you now. How does it feel to be on the other side? As nothing more than insects to a greater being?"

"Hah!" The other clone spat. "You're not so great!"

Hitsugaya glared icily at the boys and started increasing his size. He grew bigger and bigger, the clones shrinking away in his hand. The expressions on their faces were priceless. Slowly it dawned on them what was it was like to be a speck on the fingertip of a god. To the Soul Reapers on the ground it was almost beyond their comprehension. Hitsugaya's massive body expanded seemingly endlessly above them, his face, his chest, his stomach, soon not even his knees were visible to their sight, his massive feet rising like mountains on either side of them. For just a moment Ichigo and Hisagi felt uncertainty in their beliefs. But then they quickly remembered the miracles Jinta had pulled off, always surviving, always growing bigger and stronger. He would again. They knew it!

Hitsugaya brought his finger tip to his eye and looked down upon the specks on his finger tip. "Now how does it feel? You are nothing to me. Accept it."

The clones didn't. "Never! You'll have to kill us first!" They answered in unison.

Hitsugaya said nothing more. He merely brought his finger back, turned it over, and watched as the specks fell. He watched as they opened a rift in space and landed gently on the sands. He then lifted his foot and smashed their bodies into the sand. That was it. It was over. Hitsugaya sighed and shrank down, down, down, until he was still bigger than Jinta, but not nearly as huge as he had been. He undid the space around Renji and the others and lifted them up to his face. "That's it. I finished them all off. Now we just have to take the slime from Jinta and this whole nightmare will be over."

Hitsugaya looked for the boy, ready for this whole ordeal to be over. He wasn't where he had been. There was nothing but a pile of blood and dried cum. He looked around in alarm, trying to find him. He saw him, a few feet over next to a pile of clothes, his throat working like he was swallowing something. Hitsugaya had no idea that some of Jinta's slime had been stolen and that he was currently swallowing the last of it back into his system. Soon, he would be back to his old strength.

1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
Jinta swallowed the last bit of his stolen slime and felt it drop into his stomach. From there, it would enter his bloodstream. He wanted his former power back. He wanted the pain he felt to disappear. Nothing of the sort happened; he needed some time.

“Jinta.” he heard a voice say in the distance. The red haired god looked over at Hitsugaya, the being that had so easily defeated his clones. Fear pricked at his skin as he stood up, trying to ignore the pain that still shot through his body. He refused to look weak in the Soul Reaper’s presence. “It’s over, Jinta. Just give up. I don’t want to put you through any more suffering than you’ve already been through.”

Jinta didn’t say anything and just continued to stare at Toshiro. He made a movement like he was complying with the giant’s request, but he refused to do anything of the sort. His hand wiped through the air and tore open another portal in reality. Hitsugaya tried to stop him but was a second too late, he was gone. He had no idea where he went.

“Damn it, Jinta!” the young captain cursed.

“Ha, see?” Renji blurted out and looked over at Hisagi and Ichigo. “Your god just abandoned you!”

“Impossible!” Ichigo shouted at Renji. “Lord Jinta is just making a tactical retreat. He’ll be back for us, you just watch.”

“Kurosaki…” Hitsugaya brought the three Soul Reapers to his face and stared at the orange haired teen in particular. “If you know where he went, tell me. This nightmare has to end.”

“I don’t know, and even if I did I wouldn’t tell a false god like you!” Ichigo yelled back at the titian of a boy. “Are you going to torture us for information?”

“Torture you? Of course not! Don’t be absurd!” Hitsugaya relied before he dropped the three littles on his shoulder. Renji was the next one to speak.

“What now, Captain?”

“We’ll head back to the World of the Living and find a quiet place. I have the size changing down, but I still need to practice my other abilities. We also have to wait until the slime inside you activates.”

“Agreed. Once both of us have perfected our powers, we can try to undo everything Jinta’s done.”

Toshiro turned his attention to Jinta’s slaves and asked, “What about you? What are you going to do?”

“The first thing Lord Jinta is going to do once he gets his power back is come after you. We’ll just stick with you and wait for him to come for us.” Hisagi explained. Hitsugaya said nothing more and created an exit to Earth. He stepped through it, leaving this white wasteland behind. One thing nobody noticed were the ruins of the real Las Noches, which was destroyed at some point during the battle. Aizen’s body was not among the dead.

++++++

Jinta emerged from the void and hit a marble floor hard. From his kneeling position he looked around and noticed he was in some kind of throne room. He had pictured the Spirit King’s realm, but was expecting to end up in the same room he was in before. The red head’s gaze looked forward and spotted the Spirit King, sitting in his throne and staring emotionlessly at Jinta. The boy muttered a curse when his eyes fell upon the face. He still had his blue hair and silver eyes, but the face was of Hitsugaya’s.

“You did a good job of dealing with the Soul Reapers and Grimmjow, but it would appear that Aizen was too much for you. Those imitations did a number on you.”

“Shut your mouth.” Jinta mumbled as he wobbled to his feet. He was right, though, those clones had thrashed him. They had beaten him, tortured him, and even raped him. He knew he looked pathetic before this majestic being, but this was only another set back. He was far from done. “Are you going with him now? Is snowball your new heir?”

“No.” the deity replied. “While Toshiro is the most powerful being at the moment, his goals conflict with my own. He and his partner, Renji, plan on using their combined powers to undo everything you’ve done. The people you killed will be revived, the places you destroyed will be rebuilt, and the lives you changed will be undone. This is all well and good, but my situation will go unchanged. Aizen will still have the opportunity to take my throne. Ichigo and the Soul Reapers might prevail over him, but the universe will till go without a Spirit King. Seeing you to the throne is the best option.” The Spirit King paused and though about his next words. “You must still overcome Aizen and the two Soul Reapers if you desire my throne.”

“Aizen is still alive?” Jinta asked, surprised. Hitsugaya had really decimated the place during his fight.

“The creations may have been defeated, but the mastermind still lives. He has hidden himself away and is currently sending the remainder of his Hollow/Arrancar army to attack cities all over the United States. His plan is unchanged: gather enough souls and spirit-enriched lands to create the King’s Key. He’ll use it to access this realm, kill me, and take my throne. If that happens, he will become more powerful than anything you can imagine.”

“Can’t you just swat him like a fly? You are God, right?”

“I could…if he didn’t have the King’s Key. Not only does it act like an arrow to direct those to my realm, but it also has the power to neutralize my powers. Don’t ask me why this is so; I created the King’s Key back when the universe was still in chaos. I do not remember all the details.” The Spirit King paused again and tapped the edge of his arm rest. “Enough about Aizen, let’s talk about you. You need to rest and gather your strength back.”

“Can’t you just heal me like you did last time? I don’t have time to rest!”

“I can heal the wounds of the body, but I cannot heal your mind. What you went through on Hueco Mundo must have left mental scars. Take a day or two to rest, I will not take no as an answer.”

Jinta stared at he higher god in the eyes for a bit. He was in no position to deny this guy; he could easily throw him out and into Hitsugaya’s mercy. What would he do then?

“Fine, but once I have my power back I’m going after snowball. I have to teach him who the real god is!”

“Have you been listening to me at all?” the Spirit King snapped. “Aizen is the immediate threat; he must come first.”

“You think I care what you say?! I can squash that bastard any time I want! I’m going to show that kid I’m a god first!”

“That’s what your clones said just before he slaughtered them.” The Spirit King replied, sending chills down Jinta’s spine. “You will rush right into your death if you fight Hitsugaya as you are now. Not to mention that by the time you are healed, Renji’s power might also activate. Imagine what the two of them could do to you?”

“I’m not going to run away like a coward. I always find a way to dominate my enemies!”

The Spirit King gave a long sigh before replying, “Very well. If you must do that, I will try and assist you. I may have a way to make you more powerful than you’ve ever been. You might stand a chance.”

“How?”

“Like this.”

Jinta suddenly felt something impact his gut. He noticed the Spirit King wasn’t on his throne anymore, but directly in front of him. At first he though the more powerful being had decked him, but looked down to find his hand burrowed into his stomach. It didn’t hurt, but the feeling…of his hand…in his gut.

“What…are you doing?” Jinta gasped as the hand removed itself, taking with it a large orb of slime. It was every ounce of his power gathered into a head-sized sphere. Jinta could feel it…his power disappearing. His godhood vanishing. The realm prevented him from seeing it…but he could feel himself shrinking. Looking down at himself, he watched his perfect muscles disappear slowly. His teenage body was turning back into the lean, undefined kid he once was. “You…bastard…I’m going…to kill…” Jinta tried to finish, but eventually passed out from shock. His naked body collapsed at the Spirit King’s feet, who continued to look down at him with cold eyes.

“When next you awake, you’ll have this back. It will be more than it was. Until then, sleep.”

The almost immortal being called for his guard, who took Jinta to be tended to. The deity sat back in his throne and placed Jinta’s slime on his lap. He closed his eyes and began to concentrate, slowly channeling his power into the orb.

1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
As the Spirit King slowly enriched Jinta's slime with his own godly powers the guard lifted Jinta's frail, tired, worn out body into his arms and carried him to the same room he had been in before. His body still ached since the Spirit King hadn't healed him yet. When the orb rejoined his body he would be healed and granted far more power than he realized. Would it be enough to take down Renji and Hitsugaya? Would he be in time to stop Aizen's reign of terror? Only time would tell. The guard wiped away the sweat, blood and dried cum stains from the boy's body, cleaning him off and patching up a few of the still bleeding wounds. When Jinta was dry, clean, and somewhat patched up, the guard laid him out in the bed, covering him up before leaving. The guard treated him with the utmost respect, partly because he was incredibly loyal to the Spirit King and partly because Jinta was poised to BE the next Spirit King.

The snicked shut and Jinta moaned a little, tossing and turning. The feelings from his rape were still fresh in his mind, the experience like a film reel that kept playing over and over again. His body getting savaged, his body getting tossed around, his body getting dominated, abused, used, and tossed away like a broken toy. He had never known such cruelty. His mind didn't make the connection that he himself had been doing such horrible, deplorable acts, before meeting the clones. The very fact that they were clones spoke of the innate potential for cruelty inside Jinta. Would he go so far as to gang rape a person if he had the ability to do so? Perhaps. But since most beings were specks to him, he'd never get the chance one way or the other. Either way it didn't matter. He was god. God wasn't supposed to be treated like that. He was supposed to rise up, crush his enemies, decimate the landscape, fill the puny mortals heart's with fear! But now...he was nothing more than a tiny mortal with a god much stronger than him running around. The very thought filled his heart with rage and frustration, sadness and hopelessness.

These feelings were compounded as he fell into a deeper sleep and nightmares started assailing him. He twisted and turned in the bed, his face scrunched up in an expression of horror. Sweat stood out on his forehead. He dreamed he was in a featureless landscape, naked, still in his child form, vulnerable. Suddenly, the ground started vibrating. He looked around, trying to find the source of the vibrating, but couldn't see anything. The vibrating grew stronger, becoming a rumbling, then a booming. Jinta felt his heart pound faster. What was going on? He looked around again and saw, in the distance, a figure approaching. He watched in fear as the booming became louder, stronger, the ground started to move under his feet. The figure continued to get closer...closer...the features suddenly became recognizable to him.

"Carrot top?" he whispered to himself.

Sure enough, it was Ichigo approaching, though much, MUCH bigger than Jinta had ever seen him. His footsteps were causing the ground to shake and warp underneath him, throwing Jinta around like a rag doll. Soon, an enormous bare foot landed next to him, the toes stretching almost higher up than he could see. Another landed a distance away, slamming into the ground though the step was light. Jinta quaked, looking up. He couldn't see past Ichigo's knees, let alone see his face. A voice rumbled down to him from on high. "Where's Lord Jinta? Isn't he supposed to be the greatest god in the universe? Why would he be hiding?"

Jinta tried to shout and get Ichigo's attention, but failed, his foot moving slightly into the air, moving over top of him! "Oh well...guess I'll look for him elsewhere." The foot came down upon Jinta, crushing him into oblivion. His former worshiper had crushed him unknowingly like a bug. Such was Jinta's feelings of inferiority after his experience.

This nightmare flew smoothly into the next, Jinta now standing on top of a warm, peach colored landscape that stretched in all directions. A massive eye suddenly filled the sky, glaring own at Jinta with a malice he hadn't felt since Grimmjow was alive. Of course, it was Grimmjow in this nightmare.

"Get licking kid! You thought you were a god? Don't make me laugh!"

Jinta found a massive finger tip press him forcibly against whatever part of Grimmjow's body he was on, the pressure immense. He stuck out his tongue and licked, the taste filling his mouth. Such was Jinta's feelings of humiliation after his experience.

Nightmare after nightmare assailed Jinta's mind. Hisagi playing with his body in the same way Jinta had played with his, Hitsugaya forcing him into slavery, Renji forcing him to worship his body, all ending with a replay of his breaking at the hands of the Infinity Corps. Hour after hour, Jinta replayed these nightmares, and many others besides them, until he was weeping in his sleep, curled up into a ball. He had been reduced back to what he truly was: a hurt, frightened little boy. The Spirit King could sense this change and hastened his efforts. After the orb was integrated in Jinta's body his confidence, ego, and arrogance would come back along with his power.

1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
Jinta’s hellish nightmares went on for a good half-day before the Spirit King finally finished perfecting the slime. The deity entered Jinta’s room to find the boy tossing and turning; his body covered with his own sweat. The Spirit King was holding something in his hands, but a cloth was draped over it. He removed the cloth to reveal a brilliant light that no mortal eyes could look at. At the core of the light was the orb of slime: the result of Kisuke’s genius and the Spirit King’s will. The god removed the blanket from Jinta’s slumbering form and, using his powers, pinned the boy still. As the red head fought against his power, the Spirit King slowly lowered the orb into the child’s stomach. The light sank into his flat belly where it then quickly spread across his entire body; almost as if the slime was sentient and eager to return to its host.

Inside Jinta’s nightmare, the former god was all but dead. He laid on an invisible ground, bloodied, beaten, and crying. Standing high above him were his nightmares, whom had surrounded him in a circle of giants. Ichigo, Hisagi, Hitsugaya, Renji, Grimmjow, and even the Infinity Corps all grinned down at the defeated bug at their feet.

“Face it, original,” one of the clones spoke. “You were never meant to be God. You’re just a pathetic speck.” The clone raised his foot above the whimpering child, ready to stomp the pest flat. “Bye, bug.” The white haired Arrancar stomped down hard and grinded his foot into the ground. He was about to erupt in laughter with his fellow gods when he suddenly noticed his foot start to get hot. An unbelievably strong force started to push against it and soon lifted the foot a few inches off the ground. From the spot where Jinta had laid came a radiant light that blinded each one of the giants. The clone’s foot was easily tossed aside as the light began to take on a human shape. The nightmares watched as the figure grew larger and larger before them. Once it had reached their height, it started to show physical features of Jinta. Jinta continued to grow past the circle of giants and the group found themselves forced back by Jinta’s humongous form. Their efforts to escape his growing body were soon halted, though, as the boy’s spiritual pressure weighed down on them and forced each one to their knees. Now they could only watch in horror as Jinta’s growing feet quickly caught up to them and overcame their miniscule bodies. Jinta looked down at his body, which was perfect once again, and pumped his fists into the air. Any angst he had previously felt seemed to melt away as he grew bigger and bigger. He didn’t seem to be slowing down either, which pleased him greatly. For the next few hours, he did nothing but grow. He enjoyed each second of it.

When Jinta finally left the realm of dreams, he had a smile on his face. His nightmare-turned-paradise was fresh in his mind. When he recalled the last thing that happened to him before he lost consciousness, he bolted upright. The first thing he noticed: no pain. The second: his body was back to its muscular teenage appearance. Third: it was once again flawless. Any sign that he was dominated and raped was gone. A few bandages covered him, but tearing them off revealed not even a scar underneath. With a grin of confidence he leaped out of bed and started jogging around the room, doing jumping jacks, and even some push ups. He felt better than ever before. He felt like a new guy…a new Jinta…a new god. After finishing an exercise routine made for a star athlete (without breaking a sweat, to boot) Jinta examined the room and spotted some clothes neatly folded on a chair for him. They were exactly like his previous ones, but that was fine with him. His ascension into godhood hadn’t changed his fashion interests.

After making himself decent, Jinta opened the door to find himself in another, slightly larger room. It was a dining room of sorts and the only person inside was the Spirit King; calmly sipping from a cup of tea. His appearance this time was…different. It was no longer Hitsugaya’s, yet it wasn’t Jinta’s either. It was like a combination of the two. Jinta would soon change that.

“I’m shocked. I expected the slime to take at least another eight hours to spread through your body. It only took two.” he said, despite showing zero facial expressions that proved he was surprised. “Would you like some tea?”

“Got any soda?” Jinta asked, not much of a fan of tea.

The Spirit King snapped his fingers and a bottle of cola materialized on the table. Jinta snatched it up, unscrewed the top, and started gulping it down. In a few seconds, the contents of the bottle were in Jinta’s stomach and the teen tossed the empty container on the floor. He pounded his chest and released a loud and mighty belch. The belch was so intense that the Spirit King’s cup of tea shattered in his hands. If Jinta had any appreciation for the Spirit King’s efforts, he definitely wasn’t showing it.

“So, what are you going to do now that I have restored your powers?”

“Do you have to ask? I’m heading back to Earth to show snowball and Aizen who the real God is!”

“I assume you have a plan?”

“Of course. Crush anything that gets in my way!”

“You must not underestimate Hitsugaya and Renji. I may have given you power like never before, but they too possess great power. If you don’t be careful you’ll end up in the same position as last time. I cannot save you a third time.”

“Relax, those false gods don’t scare me! The only reason snowball defeated those fakers was because he could grow bigger than them. I can do the same thing now, right? I’ll just grow to match him…or maybe even BIGGER than he can get.”

“And what about Aizen?”

“Bah, what is that puny Soul Reaper gonna do? All he has is a toothpick that can make illusions and an army of specks. He’s nothing to me.”

“I agree, but the gap between your abilities is not the problem.” explained the blue-haired good. “Time is the problem. If you do not defeat Aizen before he creates the King’s Key…”

“Then he’ll come here and take your throne, thus becoming Spirit King before me.” Jinta finished, rolling his eyes. “Big deal! I’ll still trample him! In fact…maybe I’ll let him become Spirit King first so I can have someone worthy to fight for the throne.” Jinta smiled evilly.

“That would be very unwise.” The Spirit King snapped, giving Jinta stern look. The red haired god ignored him and without so much as a thanks, opened a portal to the World of the Living and stepped through. The Spirit King was left alone with a very bad feeling…

1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
Jinta stepped out in familiar territory: Japan. Full of useless specks that had submitted to him. He had no eyes for these mortals though. He had bigger fish to fry, namely a snowy kid who thought he could match Lord Jinta! Jinta looked around, expecting to see silver haired Soul Reaper nearby, training or something, but he was nowhere to be found. Jinta scratched his head in confusion and a little annoyance. He was all fired up and had been looking forward to stomping snowball into the ground. Now that no one was around he felt like he was missing out on something. Determined, he set off across the landscape, looking for Hitsugaya.

As Jinta arrived in the World of the Living, Hitsugaya, his three Soul Reaper companions on his shoulder, was arriving on the shores of California. He pulled his huge body out of the water, shaking his head, his hair quickly spiking up in its natural style. To the Americans nearby, it was truly an awe inspiring sight. Hitsugaya truly looked like a young god, his body toned and perfectly proportioned, a look of calm serene on his face. He looked down at the specks surrounding his feet and smiled slightly. "Don't worry. I'm not here to hurt you."

And the people believed him. There was something greatly calming about him. They all stared up at him as he walked carefully over and around them. He had come here with a purpose, and that purpose was finding and killing Aizen.

After leaving Hueco Mundo Hitsugaya had, using his god like powers, sensed a fleeing presence leaving Hueco Mundo along with them. He knew it had to be Aizen. As though to confirm it, hundreds of other presences had suddenly appeared around him, each one belonging to a different Hollow or Arrancar. Aizen was making his last stand to make the King's Key. This was their last chance to find him and eradicate him once and for all. He could have easily opened a portal to where Aizen was, as Renji had suggested, but Hitsugaya knew better. Aizen was no fool. He would probably be expecting something like that. Hitsugaya had no idea how much energy Aizen would need to make the key, but if he didn't do something it wouldn't take long. Hitsugaya had searched out where the presences were and he had found that they were in America. So, he had decided to traverse the ocean, making an effective sneak attack. He wouldn't have time to train up his powers, but there really was no time to be had. Crossing the ocean had been easy. He had made himself large enough that he could just walk, but had bent reality around him to hide his huge body and make sure he wasn't creating any waves. When he had reached land, he had decreased his size to better move about the humans. He had also clothed himself so that he wouldn't be wandering around naked.

Now, all he had to do was find Aizen and take him out. He closed his eyes and felt around for Aizen and his army's presences. Soon, he located them. They weren't far off, wreaking havoc in Los Angeles, one of the larger cities in the state. He had to think carefully...how was he going to go about this? He could easily devour/destroy the Hollows that Aizen employed but Aizen himself would be a challenge. He would have to attack him swiftly and secretly. It would be better if he had some back up...he looked down at Renji and said, "Do you think your slime will activate any time soon?"

Renji tried to see if he could feel anything happening to his body, but he couldn't tell if anything was. He shrugged and said, "Dunno. It could be awhile."

"And we don't have time to wait. Looks like I'll be handling this alone."

"Don't be worried about that." Ichigo suddenly said. "Even you die Lord Jinta will return to us and take out Aizen and his pathetic army, just wait and see!"

Hisagi nodded and said, "This is nothing for him. Just don't get in his way or he might step on you!"

Renji growled and shouted, "Shut up you two! I've had enough of your zealotry! If you're not going to help then don't even talk!"

Ichigo and Hisagi smirked at each other and said, "You'll see soon enough. Lord Jinta will show you the light."

Hitsugaya held up his hand in front of them and said, "Enough. We're going to fix you two up just as soon as all this is over."

Ichigo and Hisagi both ignored this statement, crossing their arms and closing their eyes. They didn't want to hear it. They were loyal to Lord Jinta and that was that.

Meanwhile, back in Japan, Jinta had looked over the whole archipelago, twice, and still hadn't found anyone besides the mortals. He stomped his foot in annoyance, the shock waves radiating out from his bare foot. "Where the hell is everyone? This is really starting to piss me off!"

If Jinta had been more savvy with his powers he would have known to sense Hitsugaya, his worshipers, Renji, or even Aizen. Since he wasn't, he was left in the dark. He crossed his arms and thought back to what the Spirit King had said when he had first come before him. He skipped over the parts where he tried to tell him what to do and suddenly remembered correctly. The United States! That was where Aizen was, causing trouble. Of course, he had been doing so for a half day. By the time Jinta arrived, who knew what would be going on?

Not thinking about it, Jinta dove into the water and started swimming towards America.
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.title: The Wheels of Fate Are Turning

choices: Hitsugaya doesn't realize it's Renji.
Hitsugaya realizes his mistake at the last moment.
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
Hitsugaya carefully walked toward the mass of spiritual pressure, maneuvering around any other cities that were in his way. Even with his caution, the giant could not prevent some massive property damage. No one was hurt in his trek, luckily. The humans below had heard of the giants in Japan, but this one was unlike the ones from the news. He had a gentle face and didn’t seem to wish them any harm. Despite this, they knew well enough to get out of his way, just to be on the safe side. The 10th Squad captain was several miles from Los Angeles when he started to hear the screaming. Looking in the distance, he spotted the large city. It was the second biggest city in the U.S., which made it a prime target for Aizen’s soul collecting. The renegade Soul Reaper’s army had already caused much destruction to the city. Smoke littered the air above it and fires had broken out anywhere. City folk were everywhere, trying desperately to escape the invisible Hollows. Very few of the humans had the ability to see the creatures, and thus only few saw their doom in the face.

The Hollows were alerted of the young giant’s presence when he arrived at the edge of the city. They did not stop their feast of human souls, however. They were instructed to harvest spiritual energy and stop for no reason. Toshiro took a moment to come up with a plan. He couldn’t just run in there and start smashing Hollows; there would be thousands of human casualties. He would have to deal with the problem from outside the city. Using his godly senses, the titanic Soul Reaper picked out all the Hollows in the city and focused only on them. Using his gravity powers, each of the monsters were lifted from the streets and hovered helplessly above the city’s skyscrapers. Hitsugaya smiled at the mass of tiny Hollows, which seemed almost like a living cloud, began to gather them all up into one clump. Once they were all squashed together like some deformity, the white head froze them all into an orb of ice. With the orb resting on his palm, the teenage god grinned at the weak Hollows and gave the sphere a mighty punch. Each one of the Hollows shattered into millions of pieces that harmless fell onto the city like snow. Hitsugaya wiped his hands off and placed them on his hips, congratulating himself on a job well done.

The survivors in Los Angeles gazed up at their savior with mixed feelings. The boy had saved them, but they couldn’t help but cower before his intimidating form. Hitsugaya gave them all a kind smile and said, “It’s alright now. You don’t have to be scared any longer. You’re safe now.” The mortals all seemed to believe him and began to cheer. Hitsugaya appreciated their thanks, but his work wasn’t done yet. He was about to search for Aizen’s spiritual pressure when something else distracted him. More Hollows began to appear from Gargantas; these ones Gillain-class. The Gillain surrounded the god, but only reached dup to his knees. Regardless, they began firing red ceros at him like they would any opponent. The weak beams of light didn’t even tickle Hitsugaya. The Soul Reaper made a fist with one of his hands and formed a sword of ice in it. Using the giant blade, he began to cut up each one of the Gillain. His strokes caused catastrophic damage to the earth, but he made sure no one would be caught up in the destruction. After just five swipes of his ice blade, the Hollows had all been vanquished. Hitsugaya wasn’t even the least bit tired. This was too easy.

“Aizen! Your puny army is nothing compared to me! Show yourself and let’s end this!” Hitsugaya shouted, his voice echoing for miles. It wasn’t long before he got a response.

“My dear Hitsugaya-kun. You sure have grown. Do you feel powerful? Do you think you can kill me with your power?” came Aizen’s calm voice, seemingly from all around the giant. Hitsugaya couldn’t tell where it was coming from.

“Why don’t yous top hiding like a coward and we’ll find out!”

“Silly child. I’m already before you…”

Toshiro’s expression was perplexed . He didn’t understand what the bastard meant until he heard a soft chuckle…coming from his shoulder. Hitsugaya looked down to see Aizen standing with Ichigo and Hisagi, who had jumped back at the sudden appearance of their worst enemy. But…where was Renji?

“When did you get there?! What did you do with Renji?!” Hitsugaya yelled at Aizen, his face quickly changing from a kind smile to a pissed appearance.

“Abarai? While you were dealing with those Hollows, I was busy slaughtering him. He’s right there.” Aizen pointed down to the city. Hitsugaya looked in the direction the man was pointing. He spotted the red haired Soul Reaper on the roof of a skyscraper. He was covered in blood, half his stomach was missing, and he was missing an arm. Hitsugaya was dumbfounded.

“W-when…how…” Hitsugaya clenched his teeth and gave Aizen a death glare. “AIZEN!!! YOU BASTARD!!”

The white-clad Soul Reaper simply smiled.

+++++++

Renji was totally confused. One minute he was watching his giant comrade make mincemeat out of some Hollows, the next he was screaming at him. Hitsugaya was looking straight at him with pure hate in his eyes. Ichigo and Hisagi also looked like they saw a ghost.

“Guys…what’s wrong? Why are looking at me like that?” Renji asked, looking into the other Soul Reaper’s frightened faces.

“Aizen, you bastard! Renji was an asshole, but he didn’t deserve to die!” Ichigo yelled at him. Wha-? What the heck was he talking about? Had he gone…

Crap. Kyoka Suigetsu.

“Idiots! It’s me! I’m not Aizen!” Renji tried to reason with the two teens, but neither could hear him. Aizen’s hypnosis completely muted him. Before he could say another word, two peach colored walls surrounded him and gripped him tightly. Toshiro gripped “Aizen” between his fingers and brought the man up to his giant eyes.

“Aizen, you’re going to pay for this! I’ve waited so long for this.” Hitsugaya threatened coldly, his kind nature all but evaporated.

“Captain! It’s me! You’re being tricked by Aizen! Snap out of it!”
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.title: Hitsugaya Vs. ...Aizen?

choices: Hitsugaya searched for Aizen
Jinta arrives at California...
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
Renji shivered as he stared into Hitsugaya's eye. There was nothing in there except a blazing hatred. Renji was totally powerless, his sword long since eaten by Jinta and his arms pinned at his sides. There was no kido that would be able to wound the massive captain anyway. Renji didn't even bother trying to struggle. If this was it, the end, there was nothing he could do.

To Hitsugaya, the friend in his hand was nothing more than the smirking face of his greatest enemy, the man who had orchestrated death, destruction, and had plans of domination. And now...he was in his grip, totally at his mercy. And yet...something didn't seem right. This was almost too easy. It was true that Hitsugaya now had the power of a god and that should make Aizen just another insect to him but...why did he allow himself to be captured? Why was he calmly staring up at him as though nothing was wrong? This had the makings of a trap all over it. He increased his grip and still, Aizen didn't change his expression. Hmm...

Renji looked fearfully up as Hitsugaya just stared. He hated this waiting. The people below at Hitsugaya's feet were all looking up at the god teen, wondering what was going to happen. They knew that their lives were at stake in this situation, though they didn't understand who these giants were or where they had come from. In all reality, they were merely innocent civilians caught up between a battle of the gods.

Hitsugaya was prepared to move ahead. He held what he believed to be Aizen in one hand and gripped his arm in the other. With little to no pressure he managed to snap Aizen's arm, the bone breaking cleanly. Aizen merely stared up at him and said, "Does this bring you some kind of pleasure Hitsugaya-kun? Holding me...breaking my bones...will this really undo any of the damage I've already done?"

"No...but it'll stop you from doing anything like it again." He snapped the other arm in the same way.

Renji screamed out in pain again. This was like torture. Why didn't the captain just kill him? Crush him? Finish him off? This pain...it was cruel. He had broken bones before but this was unlike any other time before it. This was pain mixed with the anticipation that he was going to be killed...and there was absolutely nothing he could do to stop it. He breathed heavily, both arms hanging uselessly at his sides. Hitsugaya switched his grip and grabbed the leg, snapping it. Renji cried out again, no one hearing him, no one helping him.

Jinta took a deep breath as he started to tread water still quite a ways away from California. He had created numerous disturbances in the ocean, the waters getting stirred up by his body, tidal waves radiating out from his body. He wasn't being nearly as careful as Hitsugaya. He growled in frustration and kept swimming. If he didn't see land soon he was going to increase his size until this ocean was a puddle!

Back in California, Hitsugaya had broken all of Aizen's limbs and he was still staring at him calmly with the same expression. For every limb that had been broken, he had had a deprecating remark to impart on Hitsugaya each one making him angrier and angrier. But he showed no expression of pain, not even when the limbs broke, the sound like a gunshot, clear and loud. This wasn't right. Hitsugaya closed his eyes tight and spread his senses out. Just barely...he could feel a crack somewhere. Aizen's Kyoka Suigetsu was able to create near perfect illusions. NEAR perfect. To someone with Hitsugaya's powers this was nothing that couldn't be broken...it was just a matter of finding the chink in the armor. He carefully passed his senses over the entire area until he managed to find it. He forced his influence into it and he felt the illusion shatter around him. He blinked a few times and looked down. His blood ran cold and his anger boiled even higher.

Renji lay, broken, with a look of hopelessness and fear on his face. Hitsugaya brought Renji up to his face and said, "I'm sorry Renji...I didn't mean to let something like this happen."

Renji looked up in disbelief and said, "You...can see me?"

Hitsugaya nodded and said, "I'm going to make Aizen pay for this..."

He held his hand over Renji and healed his tortured bones. The red haired Soul Reaper slowly sat up and tested his limbs. They felt tender but otherwise good. Hitsugaya deposited him on his shoulder and said, "Now...for Aizen."
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.title: Breaking Through The Illusion

choices: Hitsugaya attempts to reason with Jinta.
Renji's slime awakens, and he isn't about to chat with Jinta.
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
Behind Hitsugaya, in the same city he had arrived in upon entering California, the citizens were still recovering from Hitsugaya’s arrival. While many didn’t think they were in danger and thought of Hitsugaya’s arrival from the sea as some holy sign, many others couldn’t wait to flee the city and head in the opposite direction as the giant white head. They would be the smart ones…

Hardly seeming like an hour since the young god had arrived at their shores, the Americans suddenly noticed something else heading their way, and fast. At first it looked like giant head of red hair, but they could soon make out a titanic body attached to that hair. Jinta, having swam for longer than he had liked, finally saw land and swam right towards it. Once he reached it, he pulled his body out of the water and the bugs below him got their second glimpse of a god. Jinta dripped with sea water and his white shirt clung to his teenage body, leaving little for the spectators to imagine. With a quick movement of his hand, Jinta drew all the water form his clothes and hair and tossed it back into the ocean. Placing his hands on his hips, the red head looked down at the crowd gathered before him. The crowd stared up at Jinta for a good few seconds, believing he was another gentle giant like the kind young man from before.

“The hell are you bugs looking at?” Jinta boomed as he raised his foot and stomped the crowd into nothingness.

Boy, they were wrong.

“Sure, now they start screaming.” Jinta said as the city erupted into chaos with that one simple action. The specks below him tried their best to run from the giant, but those that were nearby were simply crushed as Jinta made his way deeper into the city. His hand passed over his stomach as he felt it rumble.

“Swimming across the Pacific sure makes a god hungry! You specks will have to do.” Jinta raised his hand and began to gather hundreds of tiny morsels into his palm. One second, the citizens were running from the giant, the next they were flying through the air toward the outstretched hand. After gathering several hundred victims, Jinta brought the handful to his mouth and dropped his snack in. Taking a few seconds to swish the squirming meat around his mouth, Jinta swallowed the mortals without chewing.

“Mmmmh.” Jinta hummed as he smacked his lips. “It might just be me, but Americans have a lot more flavor to them than Japanese. I always did like American food!”

Jinta rampaged through the city, gathering a few more tasty handfuls. After the fourth, he licked his lips and burped with satisfaction.

“Thanks for the snack, but I can’t spent all day stuffing my face. I have bigger fish to fry.” Jinta waved the survivors goodbye and stomped out of the city, leaving several more crushed buildings as a farewell gift. The moment he stepped on U.S. soil, he could sense Hitsugaya somewhere in this direction. That false god had nowhere to hide…

Several miles ahead, Hitsugaya was having a poor time locating Aizen in Los Angeles. Every time he thought he sensed the Soul Reaper’s spiritual pressure, it would vanish seconds later. Aizen may be an insect to him, but he was a crafty insect.

“This isn’t working.” Hitsugaya muttered, massaging his temples in irritation. “He might not even be here anymore. He could be in a different city planning another attack.” Hitsugaya turned to Renji, hoping the Soul Reaper had an idea, but the small man was looking off in the opposite direction. He couldn’t blame him; he had almost died by his hands. It was probably hard to look the giant in the eyes right now. The 10th captain was about to resume his search somewhere else when something suddenly caught his attention. Turning around, Hitsugaya focused his senses in hopes that he was wrong, but only confirmed his worries. An impossibly huge spiritual pressure, like his own, had appeared. He should have noticed it sooner, but he was so busy searching for Aizen’s spiritual pressure. This power could only belong to one being…

“Shit.” the young god cursed.

“What’s the matter?” Hisagi asked, not really paying attention to anything till now.

“It’s Jinta. He’s here and he‘s somehow become even more powerful than before.”

“What?! Lord Jinta is here?” the former vice-captain repeated. He turned to Ichigo, who was also grinning like a child. “Lord Jinta’s come for us!”

“Toshiro, you’ve done a good job up till now, but if I were you I’d shrink back down to normal and let Lord Jinta take care of the rest.” Ichigo suggested to the giant captain. He knew Hitsugaya had no place being a god, but he didn’t was to see him get hurt.

“Idiot! You think we’ll just stand down and let that brat make us slaves again? Forget it!” Renji shouted at the younger teen. “Captain Hitsugaya, we have to set a trap for the kid!”

“I have a better idea.” Hisagi jumped in. “Why don’t you try speaking with Lord Jinta? He’s not always such a bad guy. If you spoke with him, he might consider making a truce so you can fight Aizen together.”

“I don’t know…” Toshiro scratched his chin. “I’ve seen what that kid can do, he might just let Aizen become Spirit King just so he can have someone powerful to dominate. Still…it’s worth a try. I hate to allow Aizen to run free, but I can’t go looking for him with Jinta right behind me.”

Renji appeared displeased. Talk with him? They were going to talk to the monster that had destroyed Soul Society and taken thousands of lives? The monster who’s clones were just about the only things more cruel than Aizen himself? The monster who had replaced the moon with a replica of his face!? It was unbelievable!
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.title: First Impressions

choices: The two find Aizen as he begins destroying another major city
Hitsugaya and Jinta can't find Aizen...
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
Despite Renji's protests Hitsugaya continued walking toward Jinta's location. He was merciless, cruel, and focused only on himself but he was also clever, cunning, and able to outdo his opponents through sheer force of will. He was an invaluable asset in fighting against Aizen. Any kind of damage or death could be undone after Renji's powers awakened anyway so it didn't matter what happened. The idea of killing anyone unnecessarily made Hitsugaya cringe but he knew he had to do what he could to stop Aizen...and then Jinta. This was a plan that would require him to gain Jinta's trust...and then, eventually, back stab him. He closed his eyes and clenched his fist. The whole plan was too much like something Aizen would come up with. He pushed this from his mind as he saw Jinta in the distance.

Ichigo and Hisagi lit up seeing their god and started jumping up and down waving. After so long away from their god they were happy to see him in such high spirits again. Renji was, of course, not happy to see him in the slightest. He was never going to forgive the boy for what he had done and would continue doing if left unchecked. Trying to reason with him was pointless. Even if Hitsugaya managed to get him to help them he would back stab them the second Aizen was taken care of. He wanted nothing more to do with him. If nothing else he wanted the kid to be punished for his atrocities. When his powers awakened he was going to make sure that he did.

Jinta saw the white haired false god approaching and smirked. "Well, well, well, looks like Snowy is saving me the trouble of looking for him!"

Hitsugaya stopped when he was a few feet in front of Jinta. They were the same height now. "I'm not here to fight you Jinta."

Jinta laughed and said, "Yeah, because you don't want to get your ass kicked! So are you saying you're here to submit to me? It'd make my job easier! Then I could worry about breaking you in and taking care of Aizen. So if you want to give up just lay down in front of me and start shrinking."

"You mouthy little brat!" Renji yelled suddenly. "Trying to get this kid to help you is an exercise in futility! Let's just stomp him again and get out of here!"

Jinta frowned and flicked Renji off Hitsugaya's shoulder before anyone could do anything. Renji went flying backward, caught at the last second by Hitsugaya. His body was almost broken again from the attack. This was already not going well...

"Lord Jinta! We knew you'd come back to us!" Ichigo shouted.

Jinta smiled and said, "Hey there carrot top! Looks like you and sixty nine face are doing fine! Come back to me now!"

Ichigo and Hisagi both eagerly jumped from Hitsugaya's shoulder into the open air. Jinta gathered them closer with his gravity powers and put them on his shoulder. "There. Back where you belong."

Hitsugaya put Renji on his shoulder, healing the wounds that Jinta just gave him, and said, "Enough! I didn't come here to give myself up to you! I'm here to offer you a truce. Aizen is a greater force than either of us can take out. But working together we can finish him off for good!"

Jinta laughed, hard, grabbing his stomach. "That's hilarious! You actually think that speck is a match for me in any way? Give me a break! Thanks for the laugh though Snowy. See you around."

He pushed roughly past Hitsugaya and continued on his way to find Aizen. Hitsugaya grabbed his arm and said, "I'm serious! Either you're going to work with me or you're going to be subjugated before I continue looking for him."

Jinta grew until his arm was too thick to be grabbed. He shoved Hitsugaya to the ground and planted a foot on his chest. "I don't think you get it Snowy. I'm a god. A GOD! I don't get beaten by pathetic little bugs with big ideas and I don't need help from people like you except to lick my feet! So how about this? I'll help you if you beg for it! Get down on your hands and knees and pledge yourself to me! Then I'll help you take out this would be god!"

Hitsugaya glared coldly up at Jinta. "I would never submit to you! If you won't help me I'll take Aizen out myself!"

Jinta laughed and said, "Not what you were saying a few minutes ago. You have no confidence in your own power. I, however, do! So just stay out of my way Snowy!"

He kicked Hitsugaya away and laughed before heading back towards the city where he could sense Aizen. Renji growled and said, "See? He won't listen to reason! You should just beat him down and then take out Aizen!"

Hitsugaya stared at Jinta's retreating back. What could he do to get the boy to help him? Was there anything he could do? He ran up to Jinta and said, "If...I promise to serve you after all this will you promise to focus all your efforts on taking care of Aizen and not try and kill me?"

Jinta grinned and clapped Hitsugaya on the shoulder. "Sure! It's not like I couldn't just stomp you and Aizen at the same time but having you willingly submit to me is just too hilarious!"

He held up Ichigo and Hisagi to Hitsugaya and said, "Say hi to your newest slave boys!"

Ichigo and Hisagi obediently bowed and greeted Hitsugaya. Jinta laughed again and said, "Alright! Follow my lead and let's take out Aizen!"

Hitsugaya followed the boy giving Renji a meaningful look. Words were just words. Once Aizen was out of the way he could focus on taking out Jinta. By then Renji will probably have awakened his powers and taking out Jinta would be easier. Unless Jinta grew more powerful...this could turn out to be a big mistake on his part. He didn't even know what kind of powers Jinta had right now. Were they just the same as his own? Or did he get something more?

Either way, he had to live with his choice now, come what may.
