Suddenly, the entire army begins to meld together into one giant being.
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
It was an unbelievable sight to behold. Two gods (or, as Jinta liked to think of it, one god and an oversized slave) both marching across the state of California. Jinta was always in front, with Hitsugaya right behind him. The smug giant would never allow the false god to walk beside him or, god forbid, in front of him. As the two trekked through the foreign landmass, neither could truly understand the amount of havoc they were causing the poor U.S. citizens below. What was a simple step to the giants upset the earth they walked on and ripped it asunder. Even Hitsugaya, who didn’t mean anyone harm, couldn’t keep track of every insignificant speck at his feet. Occasionally, someone would be lucky enough to survive Jinta’s feet, only to be unknowingly stepped on by the white haired god and crushed into the dirt.

While Toshiro was focused on Aizen’s spiritual pressure, his eyes were glued to Jinta’s broad back. He could fully understand Renji’s contempt; he also wished Jinta to pay for what he had done to Soul Society. For now, however, he would need to bury his hate and work with the monster of a boy. No matter how sickening it was.

“You seem really interested in my back.” Jinta suddenly spoke up, turning his head and grinning at Toshiro. “Like what you see?”

Hitsugaya glared at the red head and turned away before replying, “Don’t be absurd.” Jinta chuckled and resumed looking forward, occasionally flexing his back muscles for Hitsugaya.

Eventually, the two reached the edge of another large city. Even before it entered their sights, they could already make out the screaming. Now that they were looking down at it, they saw the entire metropolis being attacked by Hollows and Arrancar. The evil creatures were slaughtering every living thing in sight and consuming them. The sight brought disgust to Hitsugaya, while Jinta didn’t seem to be bothered. He seemed more interested in looking past the bloodshed and finding the one bug that mattered; Aizen.

“Hey, Aizen, come on out! Your humiliating death is long overdo!” Jinta shouted before lifting on of his titanic feet and stomping down on the city, crushing everything under it (Hollow and human alike) into oblivion. Hitsugaya moved to stop him, but held back. He couldn’t risk angering the red haired god and causing a fight to break out between them. They needed to focus their bloodlust on the real enemy. Toshiro merely looked away as Jinta stomped to his heart’s content, trying to smoke out Aizen.

“It can be undone. It can be undone .” Hitsugaya repeated to himself, knowing none of these deaths were permanent as long as he could defeat Jinta in the end. The people of the city, however, believed without a doubt that these were their last moments. First they were attacked by invisible forces that slaughtered them indiscriminately, now two titans had arrived and one of them was bringing complete destruction to them all. To the unlucky mortals, it was hard to imagine how these two events could be linked at all…

After a few minutes of nonstop stomping, Jinta had decimating almost the entire city. Despite his work, he didn’t look pleased.

“This doesn’t make any sense. I keep thinking I’m crushing that insect’s spiritual pressure, but it just appears somewhere else!”

“It’s probably a trick on some sort.” Toshiro deduced, having experienced the same thing. “Aizen may not even be in the city.”

“Hey, thanks for the heads up, slave.” Jinta glanced at the former 10th Squad captain with a smirk. “You could have spoke up BEFORE I started squishing!” Jinta bellowed with laughter as he brought his foot down on a skyscraper that was still standing. Hitsugaya had to actually grip his wrist to stop himself from slugging the bastard right in the face. As he tried to calm himself down, he suddenly noticed something odd. Strange streams of light were emerging from underneath Jinta’s foot and speeding off into the distance. Not only from under his foot, but all across the ruins of the city. Further inspection revealed that even more streams of light shooting across the sky from other cities, probably also under attack by Aizen’s forces. Toshiro followed these strange lights with his eyes and noticed they were all collecting on a nearby mountain. Being a Soul Reaper, Hitsugaya identified these lights as souls. If that was the case, then the only reason they would be joining together like this is if…

“Jinta, take a look at that.” Toshiro pointed over at the mountain where all the souls were assembling.

“That’s Lord Jinta to you, bug.” Jinta scolded before looking to where Hitsugaya was pointing. A smirk spread across his face as he saw the pretty little light show. “Well, looks like something’s going on over there! Let’s take a look.”

++++

Aizen had one arm held in front of his chest, palm open. His eyes were closed and he was concentrating on gathering all the lost souls from across the state into his hand. When the big bad heard a few stomps coming his way, he opened his eyes and looked up to see the grinning face of Jinta. The red head had followed the souls and found him on a cliff, alone and completely unprotected.

“Finally found you!” Jinta exclaimed as he folded his muscular arms over his equally muscular chest. He was giving his best intimidating smirk to Aizen, but the speck-sized Soul Reaper didn’t even blink.

“So, we finally meet face-to-face, boy.” Aizen said calmly before turning his attention to the other titan behind Jinta. A titan he knew very well. “And this is quite a surprise. Captain Hitsugaya, you must be very desperate to join forces with the same person that murdered all your friends and comrades.”

“If it means taking you down, I’ll do anything.” Toshiro replied, keeping a straight face. “Even throw away my pride.”

“I see…unfortunately, you’re too late. I have almost gathered enough souls to complete the King’s Key. You helped greatly, boy. Did you know that? With Soul Society in ruins and the Soul Reapers all but extinct, there is no where for the souls of the people you kill to go. They linger here and my army harvests them like a feast.”

Jinta looked down at Aizen’s hand and saw, at the center of the blinding light, a complex key being made. The key wasn’t complete, though, and still lacked a few parts.

“That’s it? That’s what you’ve devoted your life to obtain? Let me show you what I think of your little toy.” Jinta raised his fist into the air and slammed it down on the cliff. The impact broke the mountain in two and caused a rockslide that fell harmlessly around the two giants’ feet.

“This is just a means to an end.” came Aizen’s voice. The two giants looked tot their side to see Aizen standing in mid air, completely unhurt. Not even his white uniform was dirtied. “You may think of it how you wish, but know that it is with this key that I will obtain limitless power.”

“That limitless power you’re talking about? It’s going to be MINE when I’m finished with you!” Jinta began to approach Aizen to end the little speck, but was stopped when the sky started to rip apart. In actuality, it wasn’t ripping apart, it was just that so many Garganta portals were opening at the same time that it appeared that way. From these portals, Hollows and Arrancar poured out like water from a faucet. They all gathered around their master like a shield. When the Garganta finally closed, the two young titans were faced against what looked like a living cloud. Each particle of that cloud was actually a basic Hollow, Gillian, Adjuchas, Vasto Lorde, or Arrancar. There were so many of them, they might just have been almost every Hollow left in existence. Aizen’s entire army.

“Hold them off.” Aizen commanded, his voice seemingly reaching every member of his army. “The King’s Key should be complete in ten minutes.” With that said, Aizen seemed to disappear into the depths of the Hollow cloud.

“Hehehe, you ready to crush some bugs, Snowy?” Jinta asked as he cracked his knuckles in anticipation. For once, Toshiro actually agreed with Jinta’s course of action.

“If they’re just Hollows, I don’t have any complaints.” the turquoise eyed god replied, also cracking his knuckles. The Hollow army all gave their signature battle cry simultaneously as the two giants got into their fighting positions.
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.title: Army of Millions Vs. Army of Two

choices: Jinta and Hitsugaya work together to fight against Legion
Renji's powers awaken and are stronger for having taken so long...
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
Before Jinta and Hitsugaya could so much as move, Aizen, within the huge cloud of Hollows, signaled a nearby Arrancar. The Arrancar was lean, with short spiky green hair. His hole was clean through his right foot and he was dressed in shorts and a tank top. The remains of his Hollow mask was three small chunks across his forehead, connected by thinner pieces, making it look like he was wearing a circlet of some kind. He nodded at Aizen and activated his special ability. Aizen had modified this Arrancar so that he had a very special power, namely, the ability to absorb other Hollows into his own being and gain their powers. With all of the Hollows currently surrounding him, it was sure to be an enormous boost. His whole body glowed red and the Hollows closest to him started moving towards his body. As soon as they touched they were absorbed, disappearing into the Arrancar. He grinned as he absorbed more and more, his body starting to grow in size and muscle.

As the Arrancar slowly started his rise to power, Jinta was looking happily into the Hollow cloud. "Okay Snowy here's how it's going to go! I'm going to take out all those Hollows in the upper right, right, and lower right corner! You can have the rest!"

Hitsugaya sighed and said, "Wouldn't it make more sense just to each take half?"

Jinta snorted and said, "No way! That's like cutting my fun in half!"

"This isn't a game! There's a lot at stake here!"

"No duh Snowy! So just do what I say before I start laying the beat down on YOU!"

Hitsugaya growled in frustration but let the matter drop. He was about to approach the cloud when it suddenly disappeared in a flash of blinding red light. When it cleared, the cloud had been replaced by a massive Arrancar. He was so huge, Hitsugaya and Jinta only came up to his massive abs, his body no longer lean and athletic but ripped with muscle. His tank top had been shredded and his shorts were now more like speedos. He grinned and said, "So you two are the ones causing Lord Aizen so much trouble? Don't make me laugh!"

"Who the hell are you?" Jinta shouted, surprised by this Arrancar's sudden appearance.

The Arrancar shook his head and said, "I've taken on all the other Hollows and Arrancars here. I no longer am a single entity. Just call me Legion, one from many!"

Hitsugaya didn't like the looks of this. This Arrancar had far more power than anyone they had faced yet. Even the Infinity Corp seemed weak in comparison to this behemoth. Just what sorts of tricks were up his sleeve? Where was Aizen in all of this? He didn't have time to ponder these questions as Legion made his move. With movements quicker than could be followed, he picked Hitsugaya and Jinta up and lifted them up into the air, slamming them together repeatedly. "Hah! Talk about pathetic!"

Jinta growled and managed to kick Legion, hard, in the stomach. The Arrancar didn't even flinch. He tossed the two into the ground and jumped up, stomping on both of them. "You're going to have to do better than that you weak little punks!"

Before they could move he kicked them, sending them flying backward. Before they could hit the ground, he dashed ahead of them slammed his arms into their bodies, sending them down to the ground. He laughed wildly, elbowing Hitsugaya in the gut. He was fast...too fast! And so strong...they weren't ready for this level of skill and horror! Legion seemed to interpret every move they were going to make before they made it. As soon as Jinta raised a hand to try and use his gravity powers or open a hole in reality, Legion would attack him, grabbing his arm and twisting it, throwing him to the ground. While they were distracted, if Hitsugaya tried to attack from behind, Legion would dodge any attack thrown at him and slam his knee into Hitsugaya's body.

This was bad. They were too divided in their attempts to attack him. They would need to band together if they wanted to stand any kind of a chance against him. For Ichigo, Renji, and Hisagi, it was torture trying to keep themselves from getting killed. Ichigo and Hisagi were clinging desperately to Jinta's shirt, their hands and arms sore from the effort, while Renji had grabbed onto Hitsugaya's hair and wasn't letting go, getting tossed about with every movement the massive captain made.

"Wow, this is just too easy!" Legion said with a laugh. "How did you guys manage to survive this long? You must have been up against some really weak opponents!"

"Shut up!" Jinta shouted, wincing at his bruised body. "I'm going to take you down, stomp that insect Aizen, and take over from god! And you're not going to stop me!"

Legion looked amused. "I'd like to see you try kid."
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.title: Hollow Supreme

choices: Jinta starts to grow...
Legion still has some tricks up his sleeve.
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
Jinta had it with this guy. He only fought him for a couple minutes and he was already sick of him. No one was supposed to be bigger or stronger than him. NO ONE. There was only one way to correct this mistake: growth. Jinta would tap into his new growing ability and become the same size Hitsugaya was when he crushed the Infinity Corp. The evil red head started to concentrate, picturing himself bigger and everyone and stomping this Legion like an insect. He hadn’t even grown a centimeter when Legion suddenly appeared in front of him and grasped his face, thrusting it into the ground. The giant Arrancar grinned cruelly as he squeezed Jinta’s head like an orange, enjoying the boy’s squirming.

Hitsugaya took this chance to form an ice sword in his hand and swing at Legion’s arm. The spiky haired man caught Hitsugaya’s blade with his other hand. He smirked at the white head as his hand began to glow red hot. The ice sword started to melt rapidly until it was just a harmless puddle on the ground. Before Hitsugaya could understand what had happened, Legion slugged the teen in the face with the same burning hand. Toshiro went flying backwards, landing on top of a few mountains. Legion smiled as he watched the “god” writhe in pain as he clutched his burned cheek.

“Did I forget to mention? All those Hollows I absorbed didn’t just increase my basic powers; I also got a shit load of new abilities too!” Legion explained with glee before picking Jinta off of the ground and tossing him away like a rag doll…right into Hitsugaya (who had managed to wobble to his feet a few seconds earlier). Both teenaged titans were collapsed on the ground on top of one another.

“Damnit, Snowy! Don’t get in my way!” Jinta yelled as he got to his feet and glared down at the ex-captain. Hitsugaya glared back at Jinta, his face still searing with pain.

“This isn’t working, Jinta! We have to work together to beat this abomination!” Toshiro tried to explain, but the other giant just pushed him aside.

“Work with a false god like you? Forget it! Just sit back and watch me fight this creep myself.”

“If you do that, you’ll die!” Hitsugaya snapped back, raising his voice to such a level that Jinta probably would of slugged his incompetent slave for the outburst of they were somewhere else. “Did the last encounter with Aizen teach you anything?! If you underestimate your opponent, you’ll get killed. Is that what you want? To be stomped into the dirt and spat on, never becoming God like you wanted?”

Wait…what am I saying? I don’t want him to become God! I want to prevent that! Hitsugaya thought to himself. He remembered, however, that these were just words. All he needed right now was to get Jinta to work alongside him so he could live to undo this entire mess. He could still stop the brat once Aizen was stopped first. To do that, Hitsugaya would say and do anything, even get on his knees and beg.

Lucky, he didn’t need to go that far. His words were already having an effect on the red headed teen, even though his face showed otherwise. Jinta’s head started to fill with the memories of his encounter with the clones. Memories he never wanted to happen again, but just might if this oversized Arrancar won.

“Fine…I’ll cooperate with you, but just this once! After this guy is beaten, you’re going back to serving me!” Jinta said, pointing at his fellow giant.

“Fine, let’s shake on it.” Hitsugaya put his hand out for Jinta to shake. Jinta looked at the hand for a few moments before scoffing and quickly shaking it. No sooner had their hands touched that they both noticed a giant, multicolored Cero heading their way. The gods threw up a barrier of warped space to block the beam. The explosion from the Cero hid Legion, who broke through the barrier grasped Jinta around the throat. With one young god in his right hand, Legion used his left foot to stomp down on Hitsugaya’s chest, forcing him to the ground. The giant, supreme Hollow smirked as he choked Jinta and grinded his heel into Toshiro’s chest, making both boys groan in their suffering.

“Sorry to interrupt your little chat, but I just can’t keep away from your delicious spiritual energy. I know Lord Aizen told me to hold you off, but I think I’ll just kill you both and feast on your souls. Forget ten minutes, this won’t even take ten seconds.”

Legion was about to put all his strength into crushing Jinta’s throat when he suddenly lost feeling in his left leg. Toshiro had tore open a spatial rip through his leg, separating it at the knee. The Arrancar hollered in pain as he released Jinta and collapsed to the ground. Both teens retreated back just as the bone, muscle, and skin of Legion’s lost leg reappeared. The regeneration was even faster than Grimmjow’s…

“Lucky shot, punks.” Legion muttered as he got back to his feet and prepared for another assault on the duo. Jinta and Hitsugaya glanced at each other, both nodding before taking off in different directions. Legion followed them with his eyes and smirked amusingly. “Separating, eh? Doesn’t matter, I’ll just tear you apart one at a time!” Legion chose Toshiro as his first target and rushed for the white haired titan. The former 10th Division captain didn’t have enough time to react. Luckily, he didn’t need to. A portal appeared in Legion’s path just before he reached Hitsugaya. The Arrancar came out another portal and slammed face-first into Jinta’s mighty fist. Legion cried out again as he stumbled back, clutching his broken nose which quickly healed. When he looked up again, he noticed both giants were starting to enlarge themselves.

“Oh no you don’t!” the green-haired man shouted before pointing one hand at each of the teens, releasing a double Cero on them from each palm; without even needing to charge first. The boys stopped their growth and dove out of the way, avoiding the powerful laser in the nick of time. Their growth had left their height up to Legion’s chest now. Legion decided it was time to take them both out in a single attack…

“Okay, punks, try and dodge this!” Legion clapped his hands together, as if praying, and slowly separated them. A small orb of pure energy formed between his hands, and the further the hands got from each other, the smaller the orb got. The sphere continued to compress until it was just a tiny twinkle to the titans. Legion’s smirk widened as he flicked the twinkle at Jinta. The red head watched the small light slowly make its way toward him until it was directly in front of his chest.

“What the hell is this puny thing going to do?” Jinta laughed, mocking the Arrancar’s attack.

“Jinta! Get out of there, now!” Hitsugaya shouted, making Jinta glance over at him with a puzzled expression.

“Wha-?”

*BOOOOOOOM*

The small spark of light exploded with devastating power, tearing the ground asunder. A giant pillar of light shot into the sky, climbing so high that it passed Earth’s orbit. Legion watched, laughing manically, as his attack destroyed everything in the vicinity. When the pillar shrank and vanished as quickly as it came, the spot the three titans were formerly fighting in was revealed to be reduced to a large crater several miles deep. Legion stepped over to the edge of the crater and peered down, seeing something surprising: the two gods’ corpses. They were intact, but heavily damaged. Both of them were missing a few limbs and one was even missing half their face.

“Wow, your bodies were made from tough stuff. Hope your spiritual energy is still fresh.” Legion licked his lips as he descended into the crater. As he approached the bodies, the face of Hitsugaya’s corpse suddenly cracked. Legion raised an eyebrow just before the corpses turned to ice and shattered.

“What the-?” Legion didn’t finish, as the real Jinta appeared above him and slammed into his back. with the oversized Arrancar on the ground, Jinta raised his foot and slammed it down on him, breaking his back in several places. The titanic Hollow bellowed in pain once more, and Jinta kept his foot firmly pressed into his back so he couldn’t heal.

“You stupid bug! You can’t kill us with a flash light show!” Jinta said just before hopping off the Arrancar. Legion rolled over on his back and saw a giant sphere of solid ice floating above him. Toshiro smirked down at him and let the sphere fall. Legion managed to scream a single note before the round object came down on him with a loud crash. Jinta and Hitsugaya walked next to each other and grinned at their work. It wasn’t over yet, though…

The ice sphere started to glow red right before a pillar of red hot flames erupted out of the crater like a volcano. He sphere of ice was disintegrated and out of the fiery tower came Legion…a very pissed off Legion. His eyes glowed bright red and his body seemed to be covered in flames. Legion howled in anger before rushing at the two smaller giants. Neither was able to react in time and Legion slammed both his searing hot fists into their stomachs. He grinned evilly at the two stupid “gods”…but something was wrong. His fists were buried in their guts, but neither of them were showing as much pain as they should. His fists should have burned right through them! Looking down, Legion realized the problem; both teens’ midsections were enwrapped with ice. Son of a…

“Ready?” Jinta asked Toshiro. “On the count of thee. One…two…three!”

Both giants pulled Legion closer to them and head butted him at the same time. Legion’s skull was fractured and a good amount of his mask fragments were destroyed. Legion staggered back, leaving himself open for Hitsugaya to tackle him to the ground. As the Arrancar’s forehead healed, Hitsugaya bound the man to the ground by freezing his hands and legs.

“Ha! You think this can hold me? Naïve fools!” Legion said as he started to heat up his body. No matter how hot his skin got, however, the ice would not melt. “What’s going on? Why won’t this ice melt?!”

“It is.” Hitsugaya replied, his hands outreached and pointing at Legion. “I’m just regenerating the ice at a rapid rate so you can’t melt it fast enough!”

“Damnit!”

Jinta approached Toshiro, holding his bleeding head and bruised stomach. “Damn this guy! He ruined another one of my shirts!” Jinta complained as he removed his hand, revealing a big hole burned into his shirt which made his abs visible underneath. Hitsugaya also sported similar damage to his own clothes.

“Now’s not the time for that! We have to hurry up and finish this guy, I can’t keep this up forever!”

“Yeah, yeah, yeah. Let me just grow until I’m big enough to squash this guy like an insect. He won’t be able to regenerate from that!”

“Fine, just don’t crush me along with him.” Toshiro told the other giant.

“Don’t worry, I won’t. What do you think I am, heartless?”

Jinta's wrong...Aizen is still alive
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
Jinta swiftly started increasing his size, not wanting to give Legion the chance to free himself. He intended to grind this fool of a Hollow under his heel until there was nothing left! He hated having his authority undermined, he hated his clothes getting ruined, he hated bugs who got to full of themselves and thought they could become gods, and, most of all, he hated getting hurt! Gods were not supposed to get hurt! He would make Legion pay for even THINKING of bruising his gorgeous body. He had to make sure Snow wasn't smashed though. He had been a lot of the things that Jinta hated, but he was now a loyal slave...sort of. A little conditioning and he'd be just as good as Ichigo and Hisagi...but he'd have to work to get into as high a position as they were in Jinta's eyes. Well...as high as a speck can get in a god's eyes anyway.

Soon, Jinta was big enough to crush Legion underfoot but he didn't stop there. He kept on growing. He wanted to totally smash this Arrancar and the only way to do that was to make sure his godly foot was big enough to exert the force necessary to destroy his very molecules. His body stretched out in all directions, his massive feet on either side of the Arrancar and Soul Reaper. Legion, seeing Jinta's smirking face quickly disappearing high, high, HIGH above him, started panicking and struggling to free himself. Hitsugaya started sweating with the effort of holding the supreme Hollow in place. If Jinta didn't hurry up his prey would escape! Hitsugaya wanted to shout up at the god teen to just get on with it already but knew that yelling at him while he was this size would no doubt earn him a place next to Legion as a smear on the red head's foot.

Jinta stopped his growth when Hitsugaya and Legion were nothing but specks to him.

"Alright Snowy!" his voice bellowed out over the landscape. "Move aside and let me crush this wannabe god!"

Hitsugaya didn't need to be told twice. With a burst of energy he solidified the prison around Legion before escaping a good distance away. Legion immediately began heating up his body, the ice cracking and melting all around him but Jinta wasn't about to let the speck escape. He lifted his mammoth foot above the struggling Hollow and slowly brought it down. Legion could only stare up in horror as the massive flesh colored object descended from the sky on top of him. When the foot was mere feet away from obliterating him, he broke free from the ice, got to his feet, and held his arms above his head. Miraculously, he caught the foot and stopped its descent! Jinta frowned and forced more pressure on his foot, but Legion held fast, holding the god at bay. Jinta started getting annoyed and put all his weight on the foot. Legion was forced to lower the foot closer to his body, his arms shaking, but he still managed to hold Jinta off!

"You damn bug! Die already!" Jinta started increasing his size again, forcing more weight and pressure on the Hollow.

Hitsugaya watched nervously for a second before looking around for Aizen again. He was focused on creating the King's Key now and wouldn't be able to draw his sword. This was the best time to find him and crush him. Aizen was the last major threat to the world. Hitsugaya had confidence that he could stop Jinta. He still felt a pang of guilt at all this. Then he remembered Jinta's atrocities. It really was for the best. When this was all over Jinta would be punished but he'd make sure the punishment wasn't too severe. Jinta was a monster who had destroyed millions of lives but he was also a small boy. To him, the world was a toy to be played with or broken. From his immature perspective he didn't even believe what he was doing was wrong. It was really the slime that had had started this whole fiasco. Never again should such a weapon be available to anyone.

Legion's arms started growing weaker and weaker. He was fighting a losing battle. Jinta could increase his size infinitely. Sooner or later, his foot would be coming down on the hollow. Jinta was totally unconcerned with the anything going on except crushing this Hollow into a pancake! He grunted and shoved and continued enlarging. Soon, the shadow of his foot was starting to cover Hitsugaya again! Hitsugaya looked up at the truly terrifying size of Jinta's foot, filling the sky above him, balanced on the single point of a stubborn Arrancar. The whole thing defied the laws of physics and reason but it was happening right before him! Perhaps the laws of the universe truly meant nothing...

Hitsugaya started increasing his own size, running to get out of the shadow of the god's foot. He was neck in neck with the edge of it when Legion's arms finally gave out, the bones snapping like dry twigs, allowing the foot to come crashing down on top of him. Hitsugaya dove at the last second and just managed to avoid getting crushed, the wind of the appendage's descent blowing him away. The force of Jinta landing decimated the already destroyed area, sending fissures out into areas of land that had, thus far, remained untouched. The Americans were witnessing destruction that blew the destruction Japan had faced out of the water. When Jinta was sure that Legion had been ground into nothing he sighed and fell back on his butt, the tremors creating even more devastation while his ass took out miles and miles of land. Jinta scratched his exposed abs and said, "That was more work then it should have been...damn bugs."

Suddenly, a squeaking sound filled his ears and he looked down between his legs. A teensy white speck was yelling at him...or something. Jinta could attune his hearing and understand what he was saying perfectly...but he wasn't about to get lectured by a speck. He rolled his eyes and said, "I don't care what you're yelling about Snowy! I took care of it so just shut up! One more word out of you and YOU'LL be a stain under my foot!"

He slammed his foot down next to Hitsugaya for emphasis. Hitsugaya, his temper cooling down after that display, looked up at Jinta and shouted, "Fine! But shrink down so we can look for Aizen now!"

Jinta looked around at the destruction and snickered, "Hey! Maybe I already took him out.!"

He laughed at the idea of having taken out Aizen, who had been feared by so many, as a side note, as collateral while fighting someone else. The whole thing was too funny!
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.title: Stamping Out A Bug

choices: Hitsugaya turns the crater into a hot tub.
Something happens that interrupts their relaxation plan.
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
“Don’t joke about that!” Toshiro yelled back up at the giant giant. “Aizen wouldn’t be killed so easily.” Hitsugaya turned away from Jinta and started scanning the destroyed landscape. Aizen would have had to escape pretty far to avoid Jinta’s colossal foot, so he would need to expand his search. Hitsugaya started walking around the area, pushing his senses outward to detect the faintest hint of the bastard’s spiritual pressure.

Nothing.

Toshiro couldn’t sense Aizen’s spiritual pressure anywhere. Did he already complete the key and make it into the Spirit King’s realm? No…they would have sensed that. “This…can’t be.” Toshiro mumbled to himself, rejecting the idea that Aizen really had been just collateral damage.

“No way, you mean I was right?!” Jinta exclaimed when he saw Toshiro’s dumbfounded face. “Oh…wow…I think…I think I’m gonna…”

Jinta fell onto his back, crushing even more of California, and started bellowing with uncontrollable laughter. He rolled around like some immature child, trying to keep his laughter in check…and failing miserably.

Hitsugaya ignored the tremors caused by Jinta’s laughing fit. He was still trying to wrap his head around this. Aizen, the man who he had hated even more than Jinta. Aizen, the man who had betrayed Soul Society and was feared by everyone. Aizen, the man who always gloated and acted like he had already won before the fight started. He was crushed without either of them knowing it.

“What’s wrong with you, snowball?” Jinta asked, finally regaining his composure and sitting back up. “Aizen’s kicked the bucket. I thought that’d make you happy.”

Toshiro was happy, somewhere behind his amazement. His only regrets being that he didn’t see the look on the Soul Reaper’s face right before he was crushed and the fact it wasn’t HIS foot that had ended him. There was another reason why he wasn’t as thrilled as he should be: this victory wasn’t permanent. Aizen’s death would need to be undone, just like everything else. Letting him stay dead would cause a number of problems Hitsugaya wouldn’t even begin to try and comprehend. At least, when everything was back to normal, they would have a chance of beating Aizen with their own power.

“Well, whatever. The specks are gone.” Hitsugaya heard Jinta say. He turned around to see Jinta starting to shrink back down to his “normal” size. The teen was stretching his sore muscles as he shrank. “…hey, speaking of specks.” Jinta glanced down at his shoulder. “Hey, carrot top and 69 face, you two still alive?”

Ichigo and Hisagi were both slumped over Jinta’s shoulder, beat red and with very sore arms from having held on to Jinta’s t-shirt for so long. They were still conscious, amazingly.

“We’re fine, Lord Jinta!” Ichigo shouted up to his master. “We never let go, not even for a second!”

“You were amazing, Lord Jinta! They way you worked so well with Hitsugaya…and the unbelievable size you grew to…your powers are limitless, master!” Hisagi praised, making Jinta grin.

“Crap, Renji!” Toshiro dug into his hair and fished out the red head. When he plucked him out, the small man looked as worn out as Jinta’s slaves did.

“I’m okay, Captain. Did you beat him?” Renji asked, having not seen the entire fight from within the boy’s hair. It was a good thing too; the sight of his worst enemy and his friend working side-by-side probably would of made him sick.

“Well, time’s a wasting! Time to take God’s throne!” Jinta shouted as he started to rip a hole in reality connecting to the Spirit King’s realm.

“Wait a sec!” Hitsugaya shouted after Jinta, making the red haired menace stop.

“WHAT?! Aizen’s dead, what more reason do I need to stay here?”

“Well…it’s just that, are you sure that’s a good idea? I doubt you’re going to let the Spirit King just hand his throne over to you, right?”

“Of course not! I’m going to challenge him for it. I won’t accept myself as the Spirit King until I turn the old one into a sniveling bug at my feet!”

“And you think you can do that in our condition?” Hitsugaya pointed at Jinta’s bruised and battered body. The red head examined himself and sighed.

“Good point…I guess I may as well rest up for the fight. These wounds will heal by tomorrow, I guarantee it!” Jinta decided before waving his hand over his stomach, repairing the ruined shirt in a flash. Hitsugaya did the same.

“Now, how about we find someplace to sleep. Preferably someplace away from any people.”

“What are you, my mom? I’ll sleep whenever and wherever I want.” Jinta spat at Toshiro, walking off to examine the surroundings. Hitsugaya rolled his eyes and placed Renji on his shoulder. The older man suddenly spoke up.

“This is our chance, Captain! He’s weakened from the fight with that Arrancar.” Abarai stated, growing impatient with this little charade.

“Not yet. In case you didn’t notice, I’m not at 100% either. Plus, I’d feel a lot better once your powers finally awaken.” the white haired teen explained to his speck-sized comrade. Renji just sighed and sat down, looking displeased.

While Jinta looked around, he came across the crater Legion had made using his little sparkle attack. Jinta’s crushing of the land had filled the crater with debris, but one gravity power later and the crater was once again empty and even a little wider.

“Hey, Snowy, I think I just came up with a way to use your powers efficiently!” Jinta called the false god over to him as he directed his attention to the crater. “The bottom of this crater is really hot; there must be an underground volcano around here somewhere. If you were to toss a big chunk of ice in here, it’ll melt and turn into a nice hot bath!”

“Excuse me?” Hitsugaya inquired, shocked. His powers were the only reason hey had managed to escape that battle with their lives, and now this brat wanted him to make a hot bath for him? “Why do you need to bathe? You can just remove the dirt off yourself with your abilities.”

“Yeah, but there’s nothing like a nice hot bath to ease the body. You can even join me, if you want. It’ll help comfort our wounds.”

Hitsugaya hated the idea of using his powers for such a meager purpose, but it was hard to refuse. For once, Jinta was speaking logically. A nice hot soak would feel nice after that fight…
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.title: Aizen is Beaten...Time to Relax

choices: Hitsugaya and Jinta go to sleep.
Renji's power awakens in the night
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
Hitsugaya hesitated before sighing and holding his hand out. A huge chunk of ice appeared in the air and fell down into the crater. A sharp hissing noise filled the air and the ice instantly began melting. Renji yelled out, "Captain, what are you doing?!? You can't take a bath with that kid! This isn't the time to be fooling around!"

For once, Hitsugaya was sick of Renji's constant complaining. He sighed and said, "You didn't just spend the last eight minutes getting beaten black and blue. I'm need some time to relax and heal so just deal with it alright?"

Renji heard the weariness, and annoyance, in the young giant's voice so he merely sat down, crossed his arms, and stayed silent. Jinta rubbed his hands together excitedly as he watched the ice melt, steam rising up from the crater.

"Nice work Snowy! Took a little longer than I liked but we'll work on that...or not. When I'm God I'll be taking away your powers. But hey! At least you get to be one of the personal slaves of God! That's a pretty good deal I think, don't you?"

He laughed loudly and took off his shirt. Hitsugaya ignored the comment and added a bit more ice to the crater, filling it up so that the water was just about overflowing. Hitsugaya was too tired to even think about answering Jinta's jeers. He didn't know where the boy turned teen even got all of his energy. He never seemed to be tired and was constantly moving about, laughing and talking. He looked up at the boy and as shocked to see he was naked.

"H-hey! Put something on! You can't go in there naked!" Hitsugaya sputtered, his face turning red.

Jinta raised an eyebrow at him and said, "What's your problem Snowy? Don't like my body?"

He grinned and started flexing, his muscles jumping up impressively. He was quite muscular thanks to the slime enhancing his body to near perfection. When he got the Spirit King's powers, and surpassed them, he'd be even more perfect. He walked over and slung his arm around Hitsugaya's neck, nearly crushing Renji. "Listen Snowy, you gotta get over these feelings of modesty. Look at us! We're giant gods! Well...a giant god and a slave to god who just happens to be a giant, but you get my point. Who cares if anyone sees us? Besides we look awesome! Here, let's get a look at your body!"

Jinta sighed and patted his abs again. It felt so good to put an uppity bug in his place. He shrank himself back down to his base height and wrapped an arm around Hitsugaya, pulling him close. "Alright Snowy! Time for me to put the Spirit King in his place!"

Hitsugaya smiled and held Jinta close, rubbing his face against the teen's pecs. "I can't wait to see you destroy him, become God, and reduce me to my proper place. It shall be the greatest moment in my life."

Jinta laughed and said, "That's the spirit! I'm glad I have at least three slaves who can get with the program and worship me as God! Now, let's go!"

He was about to open a portal to the Spirit King's realm when he felt a huge pressure building up inside his body. He groaned and bent over slightly, grabbing his stomach. Hitsugaya rubbed his back, a concerned look on his face. "Lord Jinta! Are you alright? What's wrong?"

Jinta panted a little, sweat beading on his forehead, but grinned. "I'm fine Snowy...that wannabe god's slime is just finally bonding with me! I can feel my power growing!"

As he said this, his spiritual pressure suddenly spiked upward, blowing Hitsugaya away, along with Ichigo and Hisagi. Luckily the two specks crashed against Hitsugaya, who gathered them in his hands as they watched Jinta change. His spiritual pressure climbed, higher and higher, the force of it pushing down on Hitsugaya, Ichigo, and Hisagi. Jinta laughed as he stood up, his body glowing, his muscles pulsing with power. He began to grow, his base height increasing, doubling. He climbed higher and higher into the sky, his feet encroaching on Hitsugaya. He crossed his arms, his muscles bulging larger, as he watched Hitsugaya get to his feet, moving backward to avoid getting crushed under his god's increasing feet.

"Wow Snowy! You're becoming a speck just like carrot top and sixty nine face!" Jinta smirked as he said this, hands on his hips to better see the tiny Captain.

Hitsugaya tripped as he moved backward, landing on his butt as the toes finally reached him. Luckily, he ended up between the big and second toe, avoiding getting crushed by his god. Finally, it seemed like Jinta's body had stopped growing. Jinta carefully pushed his toes apart and scooped up Hitsugaya onto on his finger. He raised the finger up to his eye and laughed to see the tiny Soul Reaper on top of it. "Hey Snowy! Looks like you got your wish! Though I plan on making you even smaller!"

To Hitsugaya, Jinta was god like, enormous and intimidating. To Ichigo and Hisagi...Jinta blew their minds. He was so fantastically large, so massively huge, that he defied comprehension to their tiny bodies. They were in total awe of him. They grinned into that eye and knew that their god was now only one step away from taking over the universe. Jinta set the bug and specks on his shoulder and opened a portal to the Spirit King's realm. He was ready to take his throne.
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.title: Energy Boost

choices: Jinta is right, there is no limit to his growth potential.
The Spirit King is right, Jinta can't grow as big as him.
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
Jinta couldn’t wait any longer. As soon as the portal was big enough to accommodate for Jinta’s massive size, the young god leaped through and waved Earth goodbye. The next time he saw it, he would be the “God” so many of its inhabitants worshiped. He thought about all the things he could do to the planet once he was Spirit King. Since he could just recreate the planet indefinitely, any damage he caused to it didn’t have to be permanent. These destructive thoughts, among others, kept Jinta amused the entire ten seconds it took to travel through the dimensional tunnel connecting to the Spirit King’s realm.

When Jinta exited the portal, his feet landed on something other than the elegant floor of the Spirit King’s palace. Instead, it was a jagged and rocky surface.

“Is…is this the Spirit King’s realm?” Hitsugaya asked as he looked around. This wasn’t how Jinta remembered it. Instead of a gorgeous palace, Jinta now stood in the middle of some king of asteroid field. Each piece of space rock was large enough for the massive Jinta to stand on. In addition, several celestial bodies that Jinta didn’t recognize could be seen in the distance. These planets were far closer to each other than they should be, however. It looked like they’d crash into each other if they continued on their path.

“Hey, Spirit King! Come out! Don’t tell me you died while I was gone!” Jinta shouted out into the void-like realm. As if to respond to his voice, a lone asteroid floated into Jinta’s line of sight. This asteroid carried a throne on it, and the Spirit King was seated on that throne. Jinta was happy, but not surprised, to see that the deity looked just like him again. Hitsugaya, who had never seen the Spirit King before, felt the urge to question why he looked the way he did. He didn’t, though, as it didn’t matter. This “God” would soon feel the might of his one true god.

“You took your time in coming here.” the Spirit King said, staring at Jinta emotionlessly. “Why did you not come here the moment you defeated Aizen?”

“I felt like taking a little nap. I need to be at 100% when I beat you. Actually, I feel like I’m at 200%!”

“I don’t understand. I have no intention of fighting you, only to give you the title of Spirit King.”

“Well, I refuse your offer! I hate the idea of you looking down at me for even a second! I don’t want the ultimate power handed to me, I want to reach out and grab it myself!”

“I’m telling you, that is not nece-”

“It is necessary!” Jinta clenched his fist and glared angrily at the Sprit King. “I won’t be satisfied in taking your throne until you’re under my foot where you belong!”

“…nothing I say will change your mind?” the blue-haired Jinta asked, staring coldly at the red head.

“Nope.”

“Very well. I will give you the fight you desire. However, know this: If you fail to defeat me, I will absorb you into my body and use your spiritual energy to replenish my power. No matter what happens, there will be a Spirit King to sit upon the throne.”

“Wait, why didn’t you just absorb me from the start?”

“I have been Spirit King for an unfathomable amount of time. Do you know how long it’s been since the universe was formed? You have no way of possibly knowing how long I’ve lived. I grow bored of it, and I would much prefer not to repeat this life again.”

“So you want to die? Ha, I’ll gladly grant your wish as the new God!” Jinta cracked his knuckles and readied himself for the last showdown.

“You think…you can kill me?” the supreme being asked as he stood up from his throne. Without lifting a finger, the asteroid he stood on collapsed under his massive spiritual pressure. The spiritual pressure was so powerful that it visibly cut at the walls of space. While Jinta’s slaves could not stand under the pressure, Jinta just stood there with a big smirk. “Then by all means, Jinta Hanakari, show me the power of the one who will become God!”

The Spirit King gave a primal howl as a golden light engulfed his form. There was no one in the universe that didn’t see this light, even if it was just a glint in the sky. Jinta quickly covered his slaves with his hand, for this light would have surely burnt out their eyeballs. Jinta himself had to throw up an arm to shield his eyes. He spotted the light start to expand and he jumped back to avoid being sucked into the golden figure. The asteroids and space debris seemed become a part of the slowly growing light. If Jinta didn’t keep moving, he’d lose this fight before it even started! When it appeared that he was running out of asteroids, Jinta opened a tear in reality and jumped through it. He reappeared a few miles from the expanding light and watched the last of the asteroid field get absorbed. By this time, the light started to fade and reveal the figure within.

The Spirit King had revealed his true form to Jinta. A few things were different about the blue-haired deity now. First, his pupils were gone and his eyes were like white voids. Second, his hair was moving as if there was wind in this realm. Third, his long robes were gone and he was naked. Despite having Jinta’s form, his muscles were even bigger and more powerful than Jinta’s. You could tell just by looking at him who would win an arm wrestling match. Finally, the most obvious difference was the Spirit King’s size. He was…huge. The only objects bigger than him now where the celestial bodies that existed in his realm…and not by very much. Jinta, despite having just gone through a new growth spurt, was nothing but a fly to the Spirit King. The red haired god looked up at the current true God with his eyes wide and his mouth gaped open.

“I thought…I though you said you were weakening!?” Jinta shouted up at the titan before him.

“I am. My current power output is only 30%.” the humongous creator stated calmly.

“You’ve got to be joking…” Jinta, who was standing on the spirit particles in the air, stepped back a bit.

“It’s not too late. You can still have my throne and we can avoid this battle.”

“Forget it! You don’t scare me, pal!” Jinta rooted his feet to the spot and glared up at the Spirit King. “I don’t care how big you get! I’ll stomp you like any bug who thought they were bigger than me! My power is limitless!”

“Limitless? Do not be naïve. Nothing in this universe is limitless. Even I, the Spirit King, have a limit. As the one who gave you the ability to grow, I know more than anyone that there is a limit to how much you can grow.”

“Well, let’s see who’s right! I’ll show you just how big the great Lord Jinta can get! I never needed your throne to be the most powerful being in existence! I just want the perks your power carries.”

Jinta gathered up all the strength he had and used it to fuel his growth ability. The Spirit King folded his arms across his chest and watched his chosen successor attempt to rise above him.
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.title: Limitless or Powerless?

choices: The Spirit Kings power is added to Jinta's and he takes the throne
Something's wrong...that was almost...too easy...
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
Jinta was fuming. How dare this insignificant soon to be speck tell him he has limits? If he had believed that he had limits he would have been killed a long time ago! He would have been decimated by the army, crushed by Grimmjow, broken entirely by the Infinity Corps, fallen to Aizen, lost to Hitsugaya, get betrayed by Renji! In other words, if he had believed he had limits he wouldn't be where he was standing right now, powering himself up, getting ready for the mother of all growth spurts. He was going to show this would be god, this so called "King" and force him into submission! Anyone who dared have power that didn't immediately submit to him, that actually TOLD him he couldn't do whatever he wanted, had to be eradicated. Who needed this punk's power anyway? Jinta's was limitless! He would burst through the canopy of reality and create his own if he needed to! All of the power of the universe wouldn't stand up to him when he was done! This was it! The final moment of his ascension!

The Spirit King watched as Jinta clenched his fists, his spiritual pressure rising dramatically with every passing second. He sighed as he watched this ridiculous display. This child had been given a godliness that wasn't true, a man made power that someone had gotten drastically out of control. However, the Spirit King was willing to step down to this boy since the vacancy of Heaven needed to be filled. But now this? He would have to put this silly red haired child in his place and seek out another to take his place. Hitsugaya was the third strongest in the universe, perhaps he could be convinced to take the throne? He had recently had his mind broken by Jinta's will. With a little more prodding and convincing his mind might be turned toward doing what the Spirit Kind wanted. It was really his only option at this point. Jinta was too stubborn to merely take the throne when it was offered. The Spirit King turned to Jinta again and saw the boy was still gathering energy, preparing to try and outgrow him. How sad. This was getting to be almost embarrassing. To Jinta, this was an ultimate display of his soon to be superiority but to the Spirit King, it was merely a futile effort that would be snuffed out within seconds. The perspective between the two was devastating. He decided to let this charade continue for a few more minutes before he crushed Jinta. It was sad that all this time had been spent grooming this red haired maniac and now...for nothing. Oh well. There was still time, still options.

As the Spirit King thought this, though, something strange happened. He knew that Jinta was reaching the threshold of his limits, that he would soon stop powering up and start growing, reaching only the size of his shin if he was lucky, but...he was still taking in vast amounts of power! His intake should have been slowing down but it was still as strong as ever! That was simply...impossible! The Spirit King's once inscrutable expression suddenly wavered. He wasn't used to this feeling of apprehension...for millenia he had ruled over the universe as the strongest being in existence! But now...now he was actually being challenged by another...whose power was exceeding the limits placed on him! For the first time in a long time...he was starting to feel fear. Jinta grinned as he felt so much power flooding his body.

"Ha! I would have done this a long time ago if I knew I could get more power THIS easily!" He laughed as he looked up at the Spirit King. "Look out you pathetic bug! I'm coming to get you and there's nothing you can do to stop me!"

The Spirit King knew he was right. Jinta had officially shattered his limits and was now drawing in more and more power, power that was getting to be beyond his own! The intake of power seemed to be increasing with ever second! Jinta's spiritual pressure was actually starting to break apart and disintegrate the smaller celestial bodies surrounding them. The slaves on Jinta's shoulder were totally overwhelmed by their god's power and were capable of nothing more than staring at Jinta as he prepared for to take the throne of Heaven. The Spirit King felt his primal survival instincts kick in and moved forward, to crush Jinta under his toes. He lifted his foot and brought it down on the red haired usurper, hoping to swiftly crush the life from him. It was not to be, however. Jinta merely raised his left arm, his non dominant one, and easily caught the foot. His body was pulsing with power, a red aura surrounding him. He was drawing in power naturally now, with no conscious thought or effort. He smirked up at the Spirit King from between the once great being's toes and said, "Game over!"

With that Jinta began to grow. Within seconds his body was half the size of the Spirit King. With little effort he pushed and the Spirit King fell flat on his back, looking up at the still growing Jinta in terror. He had never known a power as great as this, a power that literally defied all logic and did the impossible. Jinta put his hands on his hips and effortlessly grew larger and larger. The Spirit King kept craning his neck back more and more to see Jinta rise into the sky. The clothes that had been provided with his power slowly shrank on the boy, showing off his ever developing, muscular body, until the shirt was bunched up around his chest. Within a few more seconds, rips split all over it, the fabric exploding when he so much as breathed. His shorts soon followed, hugging his massive thighs before splitting off, leaving him in just a pair of briefs. These, too, met their end, leaving Jinta totally naked, showing off his hot bod for all to see. He kept on growing, becoming more and more massive. The Spirit King shakily got to his feet and began to run, to avoid those gigantic toes that were slowly getting closer to him. Jinta noticed this and smirked again, crossing his arms. He grew faster, watching his toes chase the Spirit King who was becoming more and more speck like. He kept up just behind him, never moving, just growing, watching the Spirit King slowly get more and more tired. Soon, he collapsed on the ground, spent, totally at Jinta's mercy. Jinta managed to grab the less than speck like monarch from the ground and lift him up to his eye. He bellowed laughter out at the minuscule creature shaking with fear and said, "Now, who was it you said had limits? Everything wasn't it? Well, here's one thing that DOESN'T HAVE ANY LIMITS!"

The sheer force of his voice obliterated every sense the Spirit King had. He was suddenly nothing more than a blank slate, laying dumbly on the fingertip of a true god. Jinta knew this and, now mostly just posturing for himself, said, "Don't have anything to say to that, huh? I guess it's time to show you who the true god is around here!"

Jinta tossed the Spirit King in his mouth. The tiny body didn't even hit the tongue. It merely sailed down Jinta's throat and landed with an inconsequential splash in his belly. Jinta patted his stomach and sighed happily. It was done. He was now officially God.
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.title: Limits Are Made to be Shattered

choices: Jinta uses his new powers to have some fun...with Earth.
An uninvited guest appears in Jinta's realm...
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
The being once known as “God” didn’t even last a second inside Jinta churning gut. Moments after patting his stomach, Jinta felt the Spirit King’s power become one with his own. However, no matter how mighty the blue-haired look-a-like was, the power boost was comparable to a droplet of water in an ocean. Even though Jinta didn’t feel his power grow at all, he did feel strange new power course through his veins. He suddenly felt familiar with all of reality, as if he had walked every inch of it. He was now the new Spirit King, and could do anything he wished. He couldn’t wait to test out his new abilities as the one and only god.

“You bugs ready to see a show?” Jinta asks his slaves as he cracks his knuckles. When he hears no response from the trio, the red head looks down to his shoulder to see his three slaves cowering. Jinta was just so impossibly huge for the three Soul Reapers to comprehend. They couldn’t even tell where they were anymore, let alone watch whatever Jinta was about to do. It was only thanks to Jinta’s divine senses that he could still see the germ-sized mortals. He could see that they were shaking under his massive spiritual pressure and incapable of even responding to his booming voice. “Hmmm…well, you guys just hang tight for a minute. Try not to get crushed by my presence!”

Jinta directed his attention back in front of him and grinned widely. He outstretched one of his massive, god-like arms and opened his hand. Without warning, a small planet the size of Earth formed in his palm. The planet was beautiful, much like his former home, and could even be called superior to the blue planet. Next, Jinta materialized an entire population on the planet’s surface. With a couple mere thoughts, Jinta had created a new planet and new life. An even smiled curved across the god’s lips just before he closed his fist and grinded the celestial body into dust. It took just a little more effort to obliterate his creation; he actually had to move his fingers.

“Yeeeeaaaaah…” Jinta murmured as he wiped the space dust on his abs. “Being God is going be an eternity of fun!”

Jinta folded his arms across his chest and glanced around. If he was going to be Spirit King, he would need a palace. The last wimp had one, so it was only fair he did too. Jinta leaned back as if to sit down and his new throne materialized under him. Just as his sculpted buttocks hit the cushioned throne, the void around him began to change. Space and time warped and in a few seconds a “room” had been formed around the deity. Unlike the last Spirit King’s realm, this one didn’t look like a regal throne room at all. Instead, it looked like part of a teen’s dream house. Posters sporting Jinta’s likeness decorated the walls and statues of Jinta posing rested along those walls. A mini-fridge filled with soda cans laid next to the throne and Jinta reached over for one, popping it open and downing it in seconds. He burped loudly before crushing the can and disintegrating it in his hand. He looked around the room, satisfied with his work so far. There were a few doors leading to other rooms, but Jinta decided to create those rooms later. He had all the time in the universe to create his realm the way he wanted and he could fill it with whatever he wanted.

Not wanting his slaves to die under his spiritual pressure, Jinta shrank himself (and the room around him) down a bit so his slaves were back to being mere specks again. Now able to move and see their lord’s face, the trio began praising their god.

“You’re amazing, Lord Jinta!” Ichigo yelled, his face showing nothing but compassion for his master. “I had no doubt in my mind that you could defeat God! You’re truly the most powerful being ever to exist!”

“Heh, thanks a lot, carrot top. Don’t stop there, though. Keep the praise coming!”

And so they did. His three slaves showered their god with compliments while the red haired Spirit King leaned against his throne and poofing cans of pop in his hand to down in three gulps. After his fifth victory can, Jinta waved for his slaves to quiet down. After they obeyed, he plucked Hitsugaya into his hand and brought him up to his face.

“You ready to shrink, Snowy?”

Hitsugaya nodded happily as Jinta brought a single finger up to Toshiro and pushed it against him. The slime inside the inferior god gathered onto Jinta’s fingertip and his white haired slave began to shrink back down to his normal, speck-like size. Hitsugaya looked down at himself and smiled proudly as his god-like body returned to its normal, only slightly muscled appearance. After the deed was done, Jinta gathered the two other Soul Reapers into his hand, stood up, and placed the trio back onto the seat of the throne.

“You insects can get back to servicing me after I experiment with these powers of mine some more.” Jinta told them as he stuck his finger into his mouth and ingested Hitsugaya’s slime.

“Take us with you, Lord Jinta!” Hisagi pleaded a she got on his hands and knees and looked up at his towering master like a puppy. “We can’t stand being away from you!”

“Don’t cry, 69 face! I’ll only be gone for a bit. Take this time to rest, since you’re going to be doing some slave work when I get back.”

And with that, Jinta was gone. He didn’t open a portal like he used to, he simply wasn’t there anymore. As the supreme being, Jinta no longer needed to transport himself from one place to another. He could simply choose to exist wherever he wanted. His three slaves sighed with disappointment and sat down to rest. With their god gone, they did the only thing they could think of: talk about him. They discussed their favorite things about him and what they thought the universe was going to be like now that Jinta was in charge. Ichigo and Hisagi even asked Hitsugaya some uncomfortable questions about the previous night when he slept with him. The entire conversation would have seemed strange to most, but to the trio is was normal. To them, their god was the only thing that mattered anymore. No, not their god. THE god.
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.title: The New Spirit King

choices: Jinta keeps having fun with the Earth and the rest of the Solar System
Something happens in the Spirit King's Realm...
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
As of yet, the universe had yet to feel the true extent of what had happened. After Jinta had left the Earth to destroy the Spirit King, things had settled down. No one knew what what had happened or where the giant red head had gone. There was a distinct calm that pervaded the planet. People began to slowly emerge from hiding, those that had survived the massacre wrought on the planet by Jinta, Grimmjow, Hitsugaya (unintentionally), and Aizen and his Hollows, daring to hope that they would survive this whole ordeal. The planet was ruined, entire countries brought to their knees. Japan was utterly devastated, holes covering the area, entire cities and towns crushed, destroyed, or eaten, people broken and dead or living and fearing the return of the gods. The United States was little better off, millions of people dead, major states wiped out during the battle between Legion and Jinta. The people emerged, hope finally blossoming in their hearts after all of this cruel destruction.

However, that hope was ultimately meaningless.

Jinta disappeared instantly from his new home realm and reappeared on the Earth's surface. His massive naked body was a sight to behold, and the power he now wielded was evident in his perfect shape and form. Not a single person who laid eyes on him had any doubt that this teenage giant was God, through and through. Jinta laughed as he looked out over the ruined planet. "Man! We really did a number on you bugs didn't we? Well, good! This planet will make the perfect tool to test my new powers on!"

He started to grow, his body stretching up and out, his feet doing damage on a massive scale without him even having to move. The humans ran and screamed, trying to avoid the massive appendages and ultimately failing as the feet bulldozed over them. Jinta was eager to see how much abuse this planet could take. How much weight it could withstand. Soon, his feet covered all of the United States of America. The country sank under his unfathomable tonnage, the ground shattering under the weight, magma already starting to rise up and consume the area, the oceans rushing over the land until there was nothing left. Jinta shook his head and said, "This is the most powerful country in the world? What a load of crap! It wouldn't even make a good footstool for a god like me!"

He moved on, still growing, his feet taking out entire countries in one step. He was a force of nature, a force that couldn't be challenged or stopped. The human race was at the whim of a cruel child who had gained mastery over the entire universe. Soon, Jinta had escaped the atmosphere, his massive upper body jutting out into space. Looking down, it was like he was striding over a road map of the world. He snickered at how pathetic everything looked from his height. He stopped moving and just stood on the most northern part of the planet, growing bigger and bigger, slowly crushing the world under his weight. He picked up the moon, still shaped as his face, and played with it like a human would with a ball. He inadvertently crushed it when he grew too big to handle it properly but merely created a new one and kept playing. He barely even had to think about it. Massive cracks started running over the planet, the core warping under the sheer weight of Jinta, magma flooding the Earth and turning it into a barren wasteland of destruction, the skies clouded by ash and smoke. All of this registered as nothing more than a pleasant tickle on Jinta's feet. He stepped off the Earth just before he smashed the thing into oblivion and sat down next to it. He slowly brought his feet together, rubbing the Earth between the enormous, soft soles, before bringing the feet together, smashing the Earth into dust. It was no more. The suffering of the human race had finally ended...

As if!

With a snap of his fingers, Jinta made the planet reform, all the humans present on it once more. Those who had been smashed or eaten in Karakura Town back when Jinta was merely hundreds of feet tall, now looked up in horror as the sky was filled with the eye of Jinta. That was all they needed to see. The malice, the cruelty, the joy of destruction in his eye was the same no matter his size. Some of the humans were sure they were still dead and this was their personal Hell. Others thought that Jinta was a second coming and was preparing to take them all to Heaven. Still others, and these were the fatalistic minority, knew what Jinta really was and were prepared to be a plaything for as long as Jinta was interested in them.

Jinta sighed and gale force winds suddenly ripped South America apart. He laughed at how easy it was to harm the planet and said, "I can't believe I used to live on this pathetic little mud ball! Look at it! Size of a baseball..."

He suddenly grew larger. "Size of a ping pong ball..."

He grew larger still. "Size of a marble! Pathetic! I can balance it on one finger!"

The massive fingertip rose up and obliterated half the planet, the other half barely surviving as it ground to a halt in its rotation on Jinta's finger. He bellowed laughter at this and said, "Damn! I barely have to do anything to destroy you microbes! But that's okay, because I can just bring you all back again!"

With a mere thought the Earth was whole again. He shrank himself down until the planet was the size of a basketball to him. He held it in his hands and peered down at the people. Without him even having to say anything they were worshiping him as God. He nodded approvingly and said, "It's about time you specks understood! I'm God and you all survive on a whim! Tomorrow I might decide the Earth is a rotten place and crush it! And then, if I'm particularly mean spirited, I might not even bring it back! But as long as you all keep worshiping me and do exactly as I say, there won't be a problem! Got it?"

Jinta couldn't hear the entire world unite as one to agree with his proposal, but he knew they got the message. He crushed the Earth between his hands again, tearing huge chunks of it off and eating it, using various parts of his body to destroy it, until it was gone again. *Snap!* And there it was again, same as ever. Jinta was loving every second of this. There was an entire universe out there for him to toy with. And he had all the time in the world to enjoy it!
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.title: The World at His Fingertips

choices: Kisuke makes his choice and carries out his plan.
Jinta's back. Looks like Kisuke will have to put his plans on hold.
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
“How much longer is Lord Jinta going to take? I’m going crazy!” Ichigo screamed as he paced back and forth atop the gigantic throne.

“Calm down, Kurosaki.” Hitsugaya told the older-looking male. “It’s only been five minutes!”

“You’re going to have to get used to this.” Hisagi told him. “A real god can’t be cooped up in his realm for all eternity. He’s probably going to do this a lot, and we won’t be brought along every time.”

“I know…” Ichigo pouted, but continued to pace.

“Just stop pacing, you’re-” the former captain stopped mid-sentence and glanced to his left. He stood up and continued looking to the left.

“What’s the matter, Toshiro?” the orange-haired teen asked. He didn’t get reply and noticed Hisagi also standing up and looking in the same direction.

“There’s another spiritual pressure here. Something’s coming…”

“What’s coming?! I don’t sense anything!”

Suddenly, a small piece of Jinta’s realm began to ripple as a doorway appeared out of thin air. The door just sat there for several seconds and the three Soul Reapers stared at it. It slowly creaked open until the opening was big enough for a lone figure to step out. Ichigo, Hisagi, and Hitsugaya were stunned at the appearance of…

“Hey there!” Urahara greeted, waving a hand at the three men-turned-slaves. Despite everything that had happened, the older man had never lost his joyful and unworried smile. As the former 12th Division captain stepped out of the door, his other hand came into view and was revealed to be carrying a King’s Key. That would explain how he gained access to the realm, but where had he gotten it?

“Kisuke! Where have you been all this time?” Toshiro asked as the bucket hat wearing shop owner approached them and tucked the key into his robes. The doorway behind him faded away a quickly as it had appeared.

“Hiding. I was watching the entire time, putting my faith in you and Renji. Unfortunately, it would appear things did not go as planned.”

“It’s for the best. A world ruled by Lord Jinta would be better than a world ruled by a dying coward…or Aizen. I hope you haven’t come to stand against Lord Jinta. It’s pointless, Kisuke. You could down several gallons of that slime and you would never become a god that could defeat the one true God.”

“I know, I know. No one has any hope of becoming a god more powerful than him.” Kisuke replied, waving hands to settle Hitsugaya down. “I’ve come to surrender myself to Lord Jinta. If you can’t beat them, join them!”

“Really? Well, I guess it’s fine then!” Ichigo cut in, grinning at Urahara. “I’m sure Lord Jinta will make you his slave, since you are the reason his accession to godhood began. Don’t think he owes you anything, though. The first Spirit King helped Lord Jinta a lot and he was rewarded with a one-way trip to our god’s gut! You try to make yourself any more important than you are and I assure you you’ll regret it!”

“I get it, Ichigo. I’m just another insect to Lord Jinta, that’s all. Now, how about we all just relax and have some tea? I can see our lord isn’t here at the moment, so why not enjoy ourselves?” Kisuke reached into his robes and pulled out a large tray, complete with four teacups and a kettle.

“Um…where were you keeping that?”

*Five minutes later*

“Ahh, this is nice.” Toshiro muttered as he sat back with a cup of hot tea in his hand. “There’s nothing like drinking some nice tea while basking in the majesty of our master’s domain.”

“I can think of a few things.” Hisagi replied. “What about drinking sake while basking in the majesty of our master’s domain? That would be relaxing.”

“You’re both wrong.” Ichigo cut in. “Nothing can beat drinking our lord’s own sweat while basking in the majesty of his own godly body!”

The four males nodded in agreement.

“The universe sure is going to be interesting with Lord Jinta in charge.” Kisuke said as he poured some more tea. “It was a lot of fun watching him climb to the top. He went through a lot of battles to get here.”

“They were all intense battles, too.” Hisagi said, recalling all the fight she had witnessed while clinging to his master’s body. “Now, however, he’s the Spirit King and no one can challenge him!”

“That’s…not entirely sure. There is one being that could have challenged him…if he was still alive.”

“What are you talking about? Lord Jinta is GOD. What can fight that?”

“The Spirit King is not only a title, but also a force. All forces have an opposite, including the Spirit King. If he consider the Spirit King to be “God”, then its opposite would not be a god, but a demon. A “Devil”, if you will…”

“No way. Are you saying there’s really such a thing as the Devil?” Ichigo asked, not buying Urahara’s story.

“Of course, you could call it the Devil anyway. You’ve seen the gates of Hell, haven’t you? Deep inside that realm is the throne of the Hell King, a throne that has been empty for countless years.”

“I’ve never heard of this “Hell King”…” Toshiro repeated.

“Not surprising. Not many people do. He hasn’t existed since the only carrier of the title was defeated by the original Spirit King long enough. The Spirit King destroyed the Hell King’s body and threw his spirit into Hell. Over time, the spirit faded away and now only his unimaginable energy remains…sealed inside his worn down throne.”

“Well…there’s nothing to worry about then. The only being that could challenge Lord Jinta has long since been dead.” Ichigo went back to smiling and drank another cup of hot tea.

“True…but his power is still there. Just as Jinta absorbed the power of the Spirit King, one could travel into Hell and take the power of the Hell King. That person would have enough power to fight Lord Jinta on equal terms.”

“Right…and who’s going to do that?” Hisagi laughed, followed by his two companions. Kisuke also chuckled a bit and brought his cup to his lips. His eyes looked from Ichigo to Hisagi to Hitsugaya.

Who indeed…

Urahara used his free hand to feel around in his coat. His fingers came upon a glass syringe containing a yellow liquid. This liquid, if his research was correct, would clear the mind of one who was brainwashed by Jinta. His researched showed that these three had somehow become corrupted by just being around the giant teen. Was it some kind of energy he radiated, or perhaps it was just his B.O. that had a unique property to it. Whatever the reason, it could be undone with his antidote. He only had enough to use on one of them, though. After he made his choice, he would bring that person to his side and then…well…send them to Hell.
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.title: The Man With a Plan

choices: The slime activates and Ichigo begins his trials in Hell
Jinta returns to his realm...
1522122212211122211211111112211111222212.content:
Out of all the Soul Reapers here...Ichigo was the obvious choice to use. He was the strongest of the three and he had been in servitude the longest. When he got his will back and realizes all he has had to do, all of the things he had said, and the way he had prostrated himself as a lesser being before a kid who had gotten too big for his britches...he was going to be pissed. He had to be quick and careful though. If Jinta came back it would be incredibly difficult for him to inject Ichigo and get him to Hell's throne. He had to act now. Thinking fast, he looked up and over the other three's heads and said, "Look! Lord Jinta has returned!"

All three of them turned their heads to look, smiles on their faces. Urahara moved fast and stabbed Ichigo in the neck, covering his mouth as he did so, pressing the plunger and injecting the teen with the antidote. Ichigo instantly stopped struggling and went limp in Urahara's arms. Before the other two could even turn their heads back Kisuke used the King's Key to return to his hiding place with Ichigo. Hitsugaya and Hisagi turned around with frowns on their faces.

"Hey, Lord Jinta isn't...huh?" Hisagi looked around as he noticed they were missing two people. "What's going on here?"

Hitsugaya looked angry as he said, "Kisuke tricked us! He wasn't coming here to join Lord Jinta at all! He's kidnapped Ichigo!"

Hisagi clenched his fist and said, "That bastard! We have to go after them!"

Hitsugaya sighed and said, "We can't! The only way we could follow him is if we had a King's Key. We'll have to wait for Lord Jinta to return and inform him of what happened."

Hisagi crossed his arms and said, "I don't like it...but you're right."

And so the two Soul Reapers waited restlessly for Jinta to return. Meanwhile, Ichigo's head was finally clearing up, Jinta's influence no longer controlling him. He looked at Urahara and said, "Ow, my head...What's been going on here?"

"You'll remember soon enough Ichigo." Kisuke said with a serious look. "But we don't have a lot of time to dilly dally so listen up."

Ichigo wasn't listening. His eyes grew wide as he remembered his experiences being broken, beaten, and servile to Jinta. He clenched his fists, his whole body shaking with rage. "That bastard...I'M NOT GOING TO LET HIM GET AWAY WITH THIS!"

He looked ready to charge back into battle, but he was lacking Zangetsu. The sword had long since been absorbed into Jinta's body and was now unable to aid Ichigo. Urahara sighed and said, "Listen Ichigo, I know you're angry at Jinta but you can't do anything with your current power. Now you really are less than a germ to him. He could end your life a thousand different ways in less than a second, torture you to the end of time, and do anything he wants with your body. He is God now."

Ichigo punched the wall and said, "I don't care! I can't let him get away with this! Even if there's no hope I still want to try and beat him down!"
